title: Marketing Director, AI, Gastrointestinal (Santa Clara or Remote)
description:
Careers that Change Lives The Marketing Director is responsible for developing and executing global market strategy for artificial intelligence (AI) across the GI portfolio with a focus on GI Genius and the associated innovation pipeline. This role includes the leadership of the AI marketing team including driving a highly disruptive innovation pipeline (in conjunction with external business partners) and market development activities across the globe. A Day in the Life Strategy  Lead execution of the commercial strategy for GI Genius and associated products/services including Genius Academy.   Create and refresh 5 year strategic global marketing plan.   Define market and product requirements for disruptive AI innovation pipeline in collaboration with external development partners.   Develop and strengthen in depth knowledge of the emerging and radidly evolving artificial intelligence market landscape.   Identify key global market expansion opportunities.   Provide recommendations and input to the GI Leadership Team representing the perspectives of the market, customers and other related stakeholders.  Team Leadership  Lead the marketing team to successful accomplishment of marketing Vital Few objectives.   Define the roles and responsibilities of the team for maximum output.   Ensure strong communication within the team and across the organization.   Provide on-going career and professional development to team members.   Manage financial resources within assigned budget to achieve key goals of strategy execution.   Sustain a team environment of collaboration, trust, achievement and high engagement.  Cross Functional Collaboration  Successfully partner and communicate with other functional leaders (including business development, R&D, clinical, regulatory, sales and finance) in the development and execution of marketing plans, with a major focus on GI Genius.   Partner with the Business Development team in analyzing potential organic and inorganic opportunities to support growth of the business.   Partner closely with WW regional managers in adapting global marketing strategy and executing regional plans.   Partner with Global Integrated Marketing and the Communications team to generate awareness of portfolio and develop engaging marketing materials and PR campigns, building advocacy with patients and providers.   Establish a practice of consistent communication across all global stakeholders.   Collaborate with external partners to deliver a robust pipeline of AI innovation into the market.  Market Development  Partner with functional leadership in developing go-to-market and market development strategies including operations, clinical, health economics and reimbursement and education.   Execute KOL strategy supporting new product development, publications, training and engagement on a global and regional level.   Establish strong relationships with influential healthcare professionals, societies and institutional decision makers including those in clinical and health economics.   Generate awareness of the GI AI portfolio and value propositions through omnichannel marketing including digital campaigns, web presence and convention strategy.   Employ market research to regularly assess market opportunities and trends.   Intimately understand the multi-stakeholder needs and key issues to successfully develop and position the AI portfolio in the marketplace.   ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS/SCOPE   :  The Marketing Director reports to the Sr. Director of Global Marketing and will play a key role on the Global Marketing Leadership Team. The Marketing Director will work across the global business unit functional leadership (sales leadership, R&D, finance, health economics and reimbursement and clinical.) Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required  10+ years experience with a Bachelors or 8+ years experience with a graduate degree in two or more of the following functions in the medical device space: product marketing, market development, and strategy and portfolio management.   8+ experience managing and leading teams  Nice to Have Proven success in marketing management and working collaboratively with a cross-functional team. Exceptional quantitative, analytical, written and verbal skills. Proven track record of planning and execution. Experience with global marketing either in or with global markets. Ability to balance development of strategy plus experience in bringing that strategy to life through execution. Executing in the shared service organization, strategic agility, managing vision & purpose, decision quality, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills. Key element is flexibility and ability to work independently. Ability to work in a hybrid home/office work environment. Ability to travel as much as necessary for position (up to 50% travel). About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Physical Job Requirements The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)

title: Senior Director – Enterprise Analytics & Reporting - Digital and Technology Partners (remote/hybrid)
description:
Job Description  Strength Through Diversity  Ground breaking science . Advancing medicine. Healing made personal. Senior Director – Enterprise Analytics & Reporting - Digital and Technology Partners (remote/hybrid), Req#2795662 This position is a remote/hybrid. Requires 1 - 2 days onsite per month. Background Mount Sinai, one of the leading US health systems with a top-ranked academic medical center, medical school and faculty practice is committed to its mission to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve. To achieve this mission requires thousands of employees making millions of decisions each year from patient care to resource utilization to managing our business – all of which require information to be delivered to the right person at the right time in a trusted and understandable manner and with the skills to interpret and ultimately use those insights. This candidate will play an enormous role in developing and executing a strategic vision to achieve this mission. Mount Sinai is midway through a major modernization effort of our data platforms, processes and the skills to use them. Data warehouses are rapidly moving to our cloud-based Data Hub (codename: BayesCAMP) where near infinite scale to work with massive data sets including our ten million patient EHR and the many other critical data assets like ERP, Workforce Mgmt, Claims, ServiceNow, etc, etc. These sources will be ingested, cleansed, enriched, cataloged and provided to those users who can help turn this data into information. This candidate will lead multiple teams of analysts, BI developers, and Epic report writers to work with a combination of Epic’s built-in reporting tools as well as our newer tools and platforms – all in the quest to deliver information to the right person at the right time. DTP Is Looking For Team Members Who The senior director – enterprise reporting & analytics is a key leader within the Mount Sinai Digital and Technology Partners (DTP) organization and reports to the vice president – enterprise data services.  Are comfortable “playing up” and “playing down” as needed to accomplish business objectives   Work productively amidst ambiguity   Thrive in fast-paced work environments   Seek to improve the status quo  Within DTP, the enterprise data services team is a thoughtful and diverse group of data architects, engineers, stewards, data science analysts, BI developers and Epic report writers that have important functional roles bringing value to the business. We work hand and hand with many clinical and operational team stakeholders to support their efforts with analytics. The team blends past experiences from inside many different health systems with cutting edge data analytics and machine learning capabilities to deliver exceptional and unique value to our broader business. The frontier ahead includes exciting new tools and data science projects along with transformational business initiatives in a supportive environment and continuous learning culture. Role Summary The Senior Director – Enterprise Analytics & Reporting will work collaboratively with other leaders in the DTP department to support many stakeholder. These stakeholders are from across the organization and are in need of information, insights and BI solutions that contribute to sound strategic planning, decision-making, goal setting, and effective performance measurement. This comes as a mix of descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive analytics. Successful candidates will demonstrate an advanced understanding of the healthcare domain, technical data manipulation and analytic development skills needed to meaningfully impact the patient community of the Mount Sinai Health System and to formally lead data science analysts, BI developers and report writers to contribute to this common mission. Other important attributes include experience managing multiple stakeholder expectations for both urgent and longer term analytic needs and oversight of a diverse group of teams. Responsibilities  Provide leadership and strategy around centralized analytics, BI development and Epic reporting   Oversee a centralized team of data science analysts, business analysts, BI developers, Epic report writers and data help desk analysts.   Oversee and improve as needed, a demand management and analytics development lifecycle, to ensure requests are received, properly vetted and prioritized, resourced, quality assured, deployed and adequately communicated.   Identify any critical skill gaps in existing staff and develop plans to upskill or mentor staff efficiently and effectively.   Develop metrics that measure the productivity and value to the organization of continued or expanded investments in analytics and reporting resources to ensure the growing demands of our increasingly data literate base of employees continues to be met.   Work closely with the data architecture, engineering and governance teams within enterprise data services to ensure processes and investments on data, tools and resources are well aligned.   Work closely with the senior director – data architecture and engineering to oversee the Data Help Desk including staffing and processes.   Provide leadership and be the point of escalation for major data and analytic use cases. Develop relationships with key stakeholders.   Provide leadership, domain knowledge and escalation for any Epic module implementations. Estimate resource needs to meet the demands for new analytics from new Epic functionality. These could include clinical, operational, rev cycle and Pop Health Mgmt domains.   Work with Epic report writers to maximize the use of delivered Epic tools (Radar, SlicerDicer, Reporting Workbench) while also developing skills and comfort to use tools beyond Epic (Tableau, R, Python, Dataiku) which can produce more value for the business user.   Contribute ideas, time and resources to development of our Data-Driven-Decision-Making academy. Develop opportunities and encourage staff to participate with and teach programs in the academy.   Work to ensure any algorithms developed, especially if related to machine learning models, are adequately vetted through the Mount Sinai AI Ethical Committee.   Work closely with other teams in DTP including the enterprise DBAs to ensure the database priorities are aligned.   Develop and manage a world-class team   Be a leader with a passion for data and analytics who can build credibility for the enterprise data services team within the organization.   Champion and advocate for the value of diversity, equity and inclusion taking action to increase workplace diversity by promoting and developing staff from under-represented minority groups.   Develop a diverse team ensuring high levels of employee engagement, operational performance excellence, and appropriate succession planning.   Lead the alignment of best-in-class analytics for the total enterprise including coordination with senior leadership.   Balance both leading a team and engaging directly with the work needed to accomplish the priority use cases.   Coach direct reports (2 directors currently) as they build and implement management strategies.   Create and foster career development and growth paths for team members in alignment with company and personal objectives.   Assist direct reports with ongoing prioritization and resource allocation to ensure that the crucial business initiatives are delivered.   Provide guidance on recruitment and career pathing for data and analytics resources.   Balance team resourcing and talent management.   Utilize leadership skills, problem solving and decision-making skills to facilitate and encourage participation of team members to meet objectives in congruence with approved standards and guidelines.   Routinely review pertinent job descriptions to ensure they are up to date with the duties being performed.   Assist with sourcing and recruiting candidates for analyst positions.   Enable and foster an agile and collaborative culture  Create and foster community of practice for data and analytics.   Drive change management and user adoption of enterprise data repositories and leverage standardized analytics.   Increase agility in identifying data issues and taking action to remediate.   Encourage user adoption of analytical tools and methods and to embrace data in strategic business decisions.   Create awareness, knowledge and conviction around data-driven practices and behaviors.   Participate actively as a leader within the Mount Sinai Health System  Serve as the Data Architecture and Engineering representative in Mount Sinai leadership teams, committees, etc.   Use a lens of equity in establishing and promoting policies and procedures.   Confront racist, sexist or other inappropriate behavior and challenge exclusionary organizational practices and serving as a role model to promote anti-racist behaviors.   Execute select strategic innovation initiatives as directed by the VP of Enterprise Data   Ensure that all regulatory and auditing guidelines are followed, and solid business practices are implemented.   Other duties as assigned  Requirements  BA or BS degree minimum, in a relevant field of study - Master’s degree preferred.   Must have experience with Epic’s Cogito reporting tools   At least ten (10) years of analytics and report development experience for a health provider, health plan or accountable care organization including: Epic reporting, clinical or financial decision support, medical economics, quality reporting, revenue cycle management, population health management or equivalent.   At least five (5) years of experience leading analytics or reporting teams   PhD, MD or DO program may be substituted for 3 years of experience   Strong data mining skills using tools like SQL, R, Python, SAS, etc.   Strong analytical skills, with the ability to perform complex analysis and make recommendations based on statistical inferences. Experience with a wide variety of analytical or statistical methods.   Strong working knowledge of Business Intelligence products (Tableau, SAS, MicroStrategy, etc.)   General working knowledge of cloud services and how they impact analytics and reporting.   Demonstrated ability to articulate goals, plan and implement processes to achieve those goals, identify/remediate risks, and meet deadlines.   Advanced interpersonal (e.g., mediating, mentoring, teaching) skills required to service internal and external clients effectively.   Self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to work independently, and to exercise independent judgment in developing complex techniques or programs in a dynamic environment.   “Executive presence” and the ability to quickly establish credibility within the organization and with customers and partners. Must have the managerial skills to work effectively across all functions and levels of the organization.   Proven skills in leadership of a significant organization, with a proven track record in delivering committed results in a complex and diverse environment   Skilled in navigating complex organizational relationships, with a strong track record of driving organizational cultural change. Politically astute; understands dynamics of relationships and will remain balanced and objective.   Effective and highly credible working relations with individuals at all levels of the organization, from entry-level to the medical staff.   A tenacious drive for results, utilizing sound project management, organizational, information systems and problem-solving skills. Must be able to hold the organization and individuals, including self, accountable.   A natural ability to effectively work with others in ways that fosters personal and professional ownership. Open, fair, and willing to engage others in issues that may potentially be controversial or unpopular.   Ability to take appropriate, calculated risks and can approach issues in an open-minded, innovative, and creative manner.   Ability to lead with equity and effectively work with others in ways that fosters personal and professional ownership; be open, fair, and willing to engage others in issues that may potentially be controversial or unpopular.   Ability to provide superior customer service to support our stakeholders and increase customer satisfaction   Ability to perform duties and responsibilities promptly and consistently with little direct supervision in planning and organizing his/her work.   Ability to objectively appraise and analyze the qualifications and performance of others as well as the ability to plan and performance of others as well as the ability to plan and direct their activities.   Attentive to the day-to-day issues impacting performance and have the self-confidence to be an effective delegator.   Ability to read, write and interpret business and technical documents.   Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Strength Through Diversity The Mount Sinai Health System believes that diversity is a driver for excellence. We share a common devotion to delivering exceptional patient care. Yet we’re as diverse as the city we call home- culturally, ethically, in outlook and lifestyle. When you join us, you become a part of Mount Sinai’s unrivaled record of achievement, education and advancement as we revolutionize medicine together. We work hard to acquire and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you can develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, can make an impact on quality patient care. Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story! Who We Are Over 38,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve. Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospital campuses, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Beth Israel Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai West (formerly Mount Sinai Roosevelt), Mount Sinai St. Luke’s, and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai. The Mount Sinai Health System is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate, exclude, or treat people differently on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.  EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans

title: AI Research Labs - Impact Research Scientist (Remote)
description:
Job Description: Join the ETS AI Labs, where we develop research-based, technology-enabled, user-obsessed AI solutions for education! The mission of the AI Lab is to advance educational and employment opportunities by providing tools and services that help individuals worldwide identify, efficiently progress toward, and meet their learning and career goals. We seek to lead the EdTech field in delivering efficacious learning tools built with users, backed by science, and offer efficiency, flexibility, and insights that support meaningful decision-making along education and workforce journeys. We execute on the values of equity, opportunity, quality, and agility. We practice these values by building teams of diverse perspectives, co-designing meaningful solutions with educators, learners, parents, employers, and job seekers worldwide, regularly measuring impact, and continually improving. The AI Research Lab focuses on the research and development of user-centered prototypes built on a foundation of learning and cognitive science principles that leverage interactive task design, machine learning, and data sciences to be integrated into various teaching, learning, and assessment solutions. The ETS AI Research Lab is seeking an Impact Research Scientist to research the impact and efficacy of innovative learning and assessment product prototype designs. The Impact Research Scientist role will work on a cross-functional project team and will be responsible for creating research agendas and roadmaps, planning and conducting research, and documenting research results to share with technical and non-technical audiences. Responsibilities: Design and execute qualitative and quantitative research that supports and advances product development efforts Identify key issues and insights from collected data and summarize findings and next steps Communicate statistical analyses, results, and recommend next steps to technical and non-technical audiences Work with learning scientists, engineers, software developers, and product owners in agile teams to support the efficient and effective development of product concepts and prototypes Develop and lead the coordination of an integrated research plan to evaluate the impact of the proposed solutions throughout the different stages of the product development life cycle Document research plans from development through implementation Ensure that all impact research studies conducted in the labs align with ethical and fairness guidelines Experience And Skills Education: A Ph.D. or Ed.D. in Educational/Psychological Research, Statistics, Evaluation, Assessment, or related field. A master’s degree with relevant experience would also be considered. Relevant Years of Experience: 3-5 years of independent research experience is preferred, but individuals with less or more experience will be considered for the appropriate level position. Desired Qualifications, Skills, and Abilities: Experience designing and implementing research or evaluation studies using qualitative and quantitative methodologies A strong focus on applied research Exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-paced environment Strong oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively disseminate the results of research to technical and non-technical audiences Experience effectively leading a project or team Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to work closely and collaboratively with people from a variety of professional backgrounds Experience with EdTech, product development, and agile development practices is a plus COVID-19 Requirements ETS requires all new hires to either certify that they have been fully vaccinated or request and obtain an exemption due to medical or religious reasons by their start date. EDUCATIONAL TESTING SERVICE is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Women and Minorities. EDUCATIONAL TESTING SERVICE is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. EDUCATIONAL TESTING SERVICE is a Drug-free workplace.

title: Junior Data Engineer - Secret Clearance
description:
Position Summary In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace. Work you’ll do We are looking for experienced Data Engineers to build and deliver innovative, game-changing mission-driven data pipelines. On this project, you will be responsible for leading the architecture and setup of hosted data lakes, as well as the ingestion pipeline and processing for large datasets, working closely with Agile software development team(s). This role includes responsibilities such as creating and managing schedules for data management (migration, integration, etc.) efforts, working with clients to validate migrated data, working with Agile development teams to understand changes and their impacts towards data migration efforts, among other tasks. The team Deloitte’s Government and Public Services (GPS) practice – our people, ideas, technology and outcomes—is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights. Qualifications  Active secret security clearance required   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future   1+ years of experience with extract, transform, and load (ETL) methods and tools   1+ years of experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines   1+ years of experience with SQL queries and JSON objects   1+ years of experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases, including PostgreSQL and MongoDB   Familiarity with microservice architectures   Interest in event streaming architectures, such as Apache Kafka   Prior professional services or federal consulting experience   Knowledge of data mining, machine learning, data visualization and statistical modeling   Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment with multiple stakeholders   Creativity and innovation – desire to learn and apply new technologies, products, and libraries  Ability to travel up to 10%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve. How you'll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.  Recruiting tips  From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte recruiters . Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you .  Our people and culture  Our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It enables us to leverage different ideas and perspectives, and bring more creativity and innovation to help solve our client most complex challenges. This makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work. Learn more about our inclusive culture .  Professional development  From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to build new skills, take on leadership opportunities and connect and grow through mentorship. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. As used in this posting, "Deloitte" means Deloitte Consulting LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Deloitte will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws. See notices of various ban-the-box laws where available . Requisition code: 106046

title: Strategic Account Executive
description:
About Kelp (part of Signal AI) - Who we are. Kelp, a Signal AI company, is the first actionable platform for corporate reputation. The company’s data analytics platform delivers industry reputation insights and benchmarks hundreds of companies— enabling executives to shift their strategies, capitalize on emerging opportunities, or mitigate new risks. Kelp makes communications and ESG strategy more focused, efficient, and data-driven. The platform digests hundreds of millions data points annually across hundreds topics specific to each client's reputation. Kelp technology dives deep into what drives positive reputation within industries spanning from Big Tech to CPG to Pharma, surfacing actionable insights that executives can use to target highly influential audiences with the right message, on the right channel, with the right cadence. Who are we looking for? Who are you? Kelp, the A.I.-powered platform for corporate reputation, is hiring a Strategic Account Executive. In this role, you will turn our first-of-its-kind Reputation GPS platform—which quantifies the reputation of hundreds of companies—into insights and storytelling that make companies smarter. You’ll dive into data, understand what’s shaping corporate reputation in dozens of industries, and communicate those insights to prospective customers. Your job is to have a finger on the pulse of what’s driving corporate reputation and contextualize the “why” behind the data for communications and marketing teams at Fortune 500 companies. It’s the perfect opportunity for people who love diving into the data, uncovering the exciting stories to tell, and presenting them with wit and personality. You’ll operate like a hybrid of a data journalist from FiveThirtyEight, a strategy consultant from McKinsey, and a project manager who runs an end-to-end process, from initial research to final presentation. In this role, you will: Lead new business processes from start to finish, operating autonomously and looping in colleagues across multiple offices. Learn prospective customers’ communications and corporate strategy through research; understand the in’s and out’s of several industries; and distill ideas on companies’ strengths, opportunities and pain points. Dive into the data to uncover and present insights about what drives reputation in easy-to-understand, compelling ways. Nurture relationships with prospective and existing clients, understanding their needs and how Kelp can elevate their reputation and shape their strategy. Author thought leadership on the topics, trends, and dynamics that shape reputation across industries—from DE&I to emerging technologies, and anything in between. Requirements Who are we looking for? Experience in PR or marketing agencies, corporate communications, or brand marketing. Superb PowerPoint ability, particularly for communications strategy and data insights. Passion for new business development, including sales outreach and pitches. Process organization and capacity to coordinate multiple teams across the globe. Curiosity about the business models of industries, organizations, and executives. Desire to explore the data, with a knack for translating raw information into actionable insights. Desired mentality: We’ll provide you with the most advanced analytics suite to make sense of millions of data points—but you’ve got a roll-up-your-sleeves mentality: You enjoy looking for the data points that tell stories executives don’t already know. Strong ability to translate and “TL;DR” your research into business insights for C-Suite leaders, enabling them to make clear business decisions. Attention to detail. (You don’t mind—or even enjoy—copy editing and wonder if “copy editing” should have a hyphen. You get excited by shortcuts to make processes easier, more standardized, and more user-friendly.) Excitement to visualize and cogently convey your findings for our customers. (We do have a designer, but we expect you to have a sharp sense for slides.) Confidence to act independently coupled with enjoyment of working within a team. Nice-to-have skills: Experience with dashboarding solutions like Power BI or Tableau. Excel and data literacy to “slice and dice” the data into your own pivot views. Experience in PR analytics and recommendations a plus. Our ideal candidate may have spent the last 3 to 5 years in a research, strategy or communications role, looking at quant and/or qual data to advise on communications, marketing, or brand strategy. You likely enjoy meeting new people, growing relationships, and bringing on new business or expanding a client’s portfolio. You may have worked at a PR and communications firm, in corporate communications, or in a market research company, management consulting firm, news organization, or advertising agency. Or you may have spent time in different organizational contexts, honing similar skills. Deep down, you’re ambitious, inventive, curious, and creative. You have had experience earning trust and growing relationships, within your organization and perhaps with clients. You intuit that executives want more simplicity, more gravitas, and more actionability than what most research offers. You know how big data can be manipulated with inherent bias, and you want to be hands-on in distilling valuable insight. Finally, you’re ready to join a more adventurous company, with the chance to learn and shape the future trajectory of technology and communications strategy. It will also be your opportunity to get closer to business strategy and product development, working closely with the founders of the business. You’ll be joining a fast-growing startup, ready to take on the thrills (and rewards) of a small structure set up to disrupt a market. Don’t meet every single skill or experience listed? Academic research has shown that women and people of other underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We know that diverse teams perform better so if your experience doesn’t fit perfectly but you’re excited about this role, we’d love for you to apply. We’re committed to building and fostering an inclusive environment where colleagues feel welcomed, valued and listened to - an environment where they thrive being their true selves. Benefits Hybrid Working Environment - we have a hybrid remote policy with 2-3 days remote per week, plus Summer & Winter fully remote blocks wherever works for you, including abroad. Unlimited holiday entitlement. Share options. Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Dependents Leave policies. Full benefits, including a 401k with employer match.

Pachyderm offers a commercial Enterprise Edition and an open source Community Edition. Pachyderm helps customers get their ML and AI projects to market faster, lower data processing and storage costs, and supports strict data governance requirements. Pachyderm is growing fast and still small, so joining means you are getting in right at the ground floor and that you will have an enormous impact on the success and direction of the company and product. title: AI/ML Software Developer
description:
Position Description Are you a recent graduate looking to begin your career with an organization with an unmatched reputation in terms of technical competence and offers a great life-work balance, with excellent benefits? If so, Dynetics can be the company for you. Dynetics, a wholly owned subsidiary of Leidos, we have offices across the United States engaging in the defense, aerospace, cyber, space, and commercial fields, We provide responsive, cost-effective engineering, scientific, and IT solutions. Our Sensor Systems Analysis and Engineering Department (SSA&E) team is looking for Entry- to Mid-level Software Developers with experience to serve as an  Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) Software Developers.  Become a part of a diverse team of Junior to Senior Software Developers, Engineers, and Scientists to create unique solutions for complex problems. Our team solves important problems that make a difference, supporting our customers in the current and future defense of our nation; primarily in the areas of sensor integration, testing, characterization, modeling, simulation, data analysis, and algorithm development for electro-optical / infrared (EO/IR) and acoustic systems. Specific Applications Of This Include  Aircraft survivability (infrared countermeasure program support and testing)  Image based navigation  Image processing, statistical analysis, and machine learning algorithm development  Gimbal modeling  Hardware-in-the-loop  Mechanical design and threat modeling  Missile signature modeling, prediction, and analysis  High performance and GPU-accelerated software development  Target detection, tracking, and discrimination You’ll work within an established and very skilled software team, developing and maintaining software leveraging artificial intelligence, machine learning, and accelerated processes to model, simulate, analyze, and visualize the above applications and more. Joining our team offers the opportunity to work with experts in their field and grow your career in an area that is appealing to you. You will quickly become an integral member of our team and be given the opportunity to take responsibility for challenging problems of your own. Because of this, we seek team members that are driven and engaged in their work while simultaneously demonstrating high character, given that you will often be working on sensitive and unique problems which require a high degree of trust from our customers. In addition, this position also allows opportunities to take on greater roles and responsibilities such as task lead, team lead, and technical lead—or opportunities for growth into management roles. A portion of the work in this position allows for you to have some flexibility of remote work, the software development portion for this position is primarily done in-person with the benefit of a higher degree of interaction and interconnectivity within the team leading to better results and a better overall work experience. Basic Qualifications Do you possess a bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline (computer science, engineering, mathematics, or physics)? If so APPLY! Are you an excellent communicator with great organizational skills? If you are?  APPLY! Do you pay attention to detail, and can demonstrate proficiency in the following? Object-oriented programming and software design Python Machine learning frameworks (Torch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, etc.) Version control Debugging Statistics If you’ve answered YES,  APPLY! If you are a US citizen and a resident of Huntsville, Alabama,  or  be willing to relocate to the Huntsville, Alabama area.  APPLY! Other Qualifications Experience and demonstrated skill in any of the following is also a plus: C++ Machine Vision or Image Processing Git DoD background Preference may be shown to qualified candidates who currently hold an active TS/SCI clearance. Security Requirements Candidate must be a US Citizen and possess (and be able to maintain) a Final Top Secret/SSBI Clearance  or  meet the eligibility to obtain (and maintain) a Final Top-Secret Clearance. Job Number 01.02.03-2022-10 Closing Date 10/30/2022 COVID Response In order to enter Dynetics facilities in the U.S. and to attend Dynetics events outside our facilities, employees are required to be vaccinated or have an approved exemption on file for COVID-19. In addition, we are receiving guidance from certain customers that onsite contractor personnel will need to be fully vaccinated to access customer facilities. If you are not vaccinated, please consider getting your COVID-19 vaccination as soon as possible. If you have any questions, please contact your Talent Acquisition POC.

title: Software Engineer - AI and Machine Learning (Remote)
description:
Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?” If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless. What We Do We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live. What You’ll Do As a Software Engineer in the AI and Machine Learning R&D organization, you will join a team of talented engineers working collaboratively to deliver innovative products, and solutions for different problems related to Natural Language Processing. You will contribute to projects spanning a diverse set of technologies targeted at both cloud, and on-premise deployments. You Will  Be comfortable developing software with browser, mid-tier (micro service) and database technologies.   Design and develop high quality, testable and scalable software solutions within established timelines.   Be aware of and adhere to R&D best practices and processes.   Actively involve other project stakeholders (e.g., managers, developers, user interface and visual designers, product managers) to ensure implementation satisfies functional requirements and is consistent with established R&D standards.   Participate in project scoping and scheduling; track progress of individual tasks and alerts stakeholders of issues blocking or preventing completion of task   Ensure the quality of the code you write through the development of automated tests (unit, performance, user interface).   Conduct code reviews to ensure integrity and cross-product consistency.   Work closely with testing by providing thorough reviews of the test plan and communicate when updates to the plan should be made to cover code changes related to enhancements, redesigns and/or bug fixes.   Maintain accountability for the entire life cycle of the code including support for both internal and external consumers.   In collaboration with technical writers, authors appropriate level of design and technical documentation that satisfies both internal and external consumers.   Work with multiple operating systems and anticipate technical anomalies and enhancements for various environments   Perform unit testing of software, fix "bugs", modify software design, as necessary.   Determines database compatibility and develops compatible code as appropriate.  What We’re Looking For  You’re curious, passionate, authentic, and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do   You have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related quantitative field   You have 5 or more years of experience contributing across the full Software Development Life Cycle   You’re well-versed in a broad set of languages such as Go, Java, React, JavaScript, Python   You have experience with some of the software tools such as Docker, Jenkins, Git, Gerrit, Hibernate, and Kubernetes   You have experience with Windows or Linux.   You have experience contributing at least one or more levels of the software stack.   You approach every task with a quality-first mindset  Additional Preferences (not Required)  You have experience with open-source container-orchestration systems like Kubernetes   You have experience with cloud architectures and at least one major public cloud provider.   You have experience with agile software development.  Other Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities  Exceptional aptitude for problem solving and debugging of complex multitiered software applications.   Ability to pivot quickly and seamlessly as projects and business needs dictate.   Detail oriented and well-organized with a strong ability to prioritize, plan, and execute tasks.   Highly skilled in written and verbal communications.   Comfortable working in a distributed, team-based environment  Why SAS  We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.   Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring.  Additional Information SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more:  Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law . Also view the supplement  EEO is the Law , and the Pay Transparency notice.   Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com . SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action. #Dice

title: AI / ML Solution Architect
description:
Are you looking to be a cog in a corporate machine? Someone who enjoys monotony? If so, then this  ISN'T  the role for you. But if you are looking for an opportunity to use AI to solve challenging problems, to collaborate with a team of like-minded achievers, enjoy the flexibility of working from home and periodically collaborating with your peers face-to-face, and to never be bored, then keep reading. In this role, you will lead the design and implementation of client solutions with a focus on machine learning, NLP, vision processing, and text analytics. As a creative problem solver, you will be an integral member of a team that helps clients address complex challenges using state-of-the-art solutions in constantly changing environments. In this fast-paced, client-facing role, you will leverage your existing AI skillsets, gain exposure to new skills and techniques as you grow your knowledge in this ever-expanding field, and use this knowledge to mentor others. If flexibility, collaboration, drive, and lifelong learner describe you, then this role just might be a fit. About Access Sciences Access Sciences is a unique place to work! We don't have the stuffy big corporate feel of bigger firms. The most unique aspect is that we are an employee-owned company. Our Employees Enjoy a Range Of Benefits, Including Opportunities for professional growth Profit sharing based on company performance Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) 401(k) with company match Medical, Dental, and Vision Flexible Spending Account Health Savings Account with company contribution Disability and Life Insurance, company paid Voluntary Life Insurance Paid Time Off, Holidays, and Sick Time Paid Volunteer Hours What Our Employees Have To Say Fun Place to Work "Working for Access Sciences was a great company to work for. It is a company that outsources its employees to other companies. I only worked for one company while employed at Access Sciences. I worked at a large oil and gas client as a business analyst. I gained great knowledge and skills. " Responsibilities Flexibility and adaptability are the keys to this dynamic role where your contributions will range from opportunity shaping, through solution architecture, development, implementation, and support. While each opportunity and project is unique, in this role you will: Collaborate with business development as we seek to identify and understand client challenges, and propose AI-focused solutions that meet those needs Support the creation of proposals by defining scope and estimating time, cost, and resource needs Deliver client presentations for orals and technical demonstrations Gather and validate solution requirements Analyze ML, NLP, vision processing, and text analytics techniques that could be used to solve a given problem and rank them according to success probability Develop models that address requirements, along with metrics to track their progress Analyze, identify, and validate contributing model features (data inputs) from structured and unstructured data sources Define any preprocessing / feature engineering needed for a given dataset Train models and tune hyperparameters Analyze model errors and design strategies to overcome them Deploy models to production Monitor model performance and identify / remediate issues caused by changes in business conditions, data drift, or other factors Contribute to development and operation of governance processes in support of client AI portfolios Stay current with AI research and toolsets and learn new techniques as the state of the art evolves Share your expertise and learnings to mentor colleagues  Travel locally or out of state, as needed for client-facing project activities, up to 25% Consult on multiple projects simultaneously while juggling unique requirements and timelines Job Requirements Bachelor's degree or equivalent Proficiency with a variety of data exploration techniques Proficiency with Python Demonstrable knowledge of machine learning, NLP, vision processing (especially image processing and object detection), and text analytics methods  Proficiency with ML and related frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, OpenCV, scikit-learn) Proficiency with one or more AI platform (e.g., Microsoft Azure AI, AWS Machine Learning) Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt to various audiences Previous customer-facing or consulting experience leading group discussions with senior stakeholders: presenting recommendations, strategies, proposals, and facilitating agreement or decisions. Nice-to-have Skills Experience with or exposure to knowledge graphs Experience with agile software development Experience with statistical tests, distributions, regression, maximum likelihood estimators, etc.  Strong math skills including multivariable calculus and linear algebra  Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., matplotlib, ggplot, d3.js., Tableau) Experience 3+ years of applicable experience with ML, NLP, vision processing, and / or text analytics techniques, toolsets, and production-quality solution development and deployment If this sounds like just the kind of flexible opportunity you are looking for, then please fill out our short initial application. Candidates who meet our initial screening will be immediately reviewed & moved forward in our hiring process which includes some tests and assessments. Good luck! Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Tenure Track Assistant Professor in Information Science (Data Science)
description:
Classification Title: Assistant Professor College/Division: College of Information and Communications Department: CIC School of Information Science Advertised Salary Range: Commensurate with experience Advertised Job Summary The School of Information Science (iSchool) at the University of South Carolina (UofSC) invites applications for a tenure-track faculty position at the Assistant Professor level to begin August 16, 2023. Successful candidates will be expected to expand on one or more of the following areas in Data Science:  Applied Data and Text Mining  Applied AI and Machine Learning (ML)  Critical Data Studies  User Experience, Information Architecture  Web and Mobile Application Development  Social Network Analysis  Cybersecurity Responsibilities  Participate in instruction, research, publication, grant writing, and other scholarly activities  Teach and develop courses in both face-to-face and online environments at undergraduate (BS in Information Science) and graduate students.  Candidates may be tasked with teaching and/or developing courses related to some of the following topics: web and mobile application development, programming languages (e.g., R, JavaScript, and Python), database management systems (e.g., MS Access and SQL , NoSQL), and data/text mining, user experience.  Mentor students for independent studies and doctoral dissertations  Provide service to the department, college, university, profession, and community The School of Information Science (http://www.sc.edu/study/colleges\schools/cic/library\and\information\science) Our diverse, engaged faculty and staff enjoy a dynamic and intellectually stimulating work environment within the school. In addition, a rich potential for collaborative and interdisciplinary connections exists across the university, for example, The U of SC Arnold School of Public Health, the College of Education, and our sister school the School of Journalism and Mass Communications. Examples of existing faculty research expertise include: information behavior and information practices of marginalized groups; misinformation and disinformation; equity, diversity, inclusion, and social justice; LIS Education; accessibility and disability studies; public libraries and cultural heritage institutions; diversity in children's literature; community literacy; school librarianship; knowledge management; international librarianship; social media analysis, big data, and text mining; copyright; medical and health informatics; data analytics; information visualization; health and medical librarianship; critical youth studies; information policy; digital inclusion; and, information access and information poverty. The School of Information Science is committed to the mission of the College of Information and Communications and the University of South Carolina to foster a diverse and vibrant academic environment, embrace diversity in its various forms and create a welcoming environment that encourages all to excel. College of Information and Communications The College of Information and Communications is home to two nationally recognized schools, the School of Journalism and Mass Communications and the School of Information Science. The college provides outstanding teaching, research, and community outreach. As such, it is one of only a few universities to combine its communications and information science programs, two rapidly evolving - and converging - fields united by a shared belief that information accessibility is the cornerstone of self-governance. The College has approximately 1,800 undergraduates, 500 graduate students, and more than 100 faculty and staff members. New assets available to faculty and students in both schools include The Social Media Insights Lab and the Biometric and User Experience Lab. Both are designed to facilitate the study of issues related to data, media, and their impact on society. The University of South Carolina The University of South Carolina in Columbia is the major research institution of the University of South Carolina system and its largest campus, enrolling approximately 35,000 students. The university offers over 320 degrees at the bachelor's, master's, doctoral and professional program levels. Founded in 1801, it is among America's oldest and most comprehensive public universities and is one of only 32 public universities to earn the Carnegie Foundation's top-tier designations in both research activity and community engagement. South Carolina's capital city is currently undergoing several urban revitalization projects and offers residents a growing range of artistic, cultural, and recreational opportunities. Advertised Minimum Qualifications An earned doctorate in Information Science or a related field is required by the start date of employment, but strong applicants who can convincingly demonstrate that they will complete the degree timely (e.g., by documenting a scheduled defense) will also be considered. We are able to consider applications at the early Assistant Professor stage for these positions. Position requires a clearly articulated research agenda, and enthusiasm for and excellence in teaching in multiple delivery formats. Full/Part Time: Full Time

title: Python Developer, GMOT
description:

title: Autonomous Vehicle Chief Solution Architect, Senior Manager - Managed AI
description:
Position Summary  Autonomous Vehicle Chief Solution Architect, Senior Manager - Managed AI   The Team  The Deloitte Connected and Autonomous Vehicle (CAV) team is catalyzing and shaping the Autonomous Vehicle (AV) market through a suite of turnkey, as-a-service solutions that deliver improved performance and lower total cost of ownership. These solutions will empower Automotive customers to realize their autonomy ambitions as efficiently as possible.  High Level Role  Responsibilities The Chief Solution Architect will be responsible for leading technical development on the following AV Development and Testing offerings The CAV team is hiring a Chief Solution Architect to lead the development and implementation of the as-a-service solutions. The initial focus will be progressing our AV Development and Testing offerings and then architecting our AV Simulation as a Service offerings.  Infrastructure as-a-Service   MLOps as-a-Service   Data Management as-a-Service   Synthetic Data Generation as-a-Service  Specifics  Design and implement efficient throughput, utilization and scalable environments (both in Cloud and On-Prem) running highly parallelized jobs across multiple clusters   Design for optimized performance and “push-button” automation for AI Model Training and Inferencing test runs including considerations for network switch & fabric, storage & caching, cluster orchestration, and run-time optimization   Lead the development of customizing an MLOps platform that is specific for AV use cases   Architect and implement data pipelines that efficient ingest petabytes of fleet car data into a central data lake while ensuring the proper indexing, data quality checks, and coarse labeling   Leverage third-party synthetic data generation software to be specific for AV   Architect solutions that resolve painpoints within the AV simulation space   Work directly with key AV customers to understand their technology and deliver the best solutions  Qualifications  Masters or equivalent experience in Computer Architecture, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field   8+ years of proven experience in designing and developing production level software that includes distributed backend systems, AI, and web application development   Must have the description:
About Pachyderm: Pachyderm is the leader in data versioning and pipelines for MLOps. We're building the data foundation that allows data science teams to automate and scale their machine learning lifecycle while guaranteeing reproducibility. With over $40 million in three rounds of funding from leading investors like Benchmark, Microsoft M12, and Y Combinator, Pachyderm is committed to building industrial strength capabilities for Data Centric AI. Pachyderm offers a commercial Enterprise Edition and an open source Community Edition. Pachyderm helps customers get their ML and AI projects to market faster, lower data processing and storage costs, and supports strict data governance requirements. Pachyderm is growing fast and still small, so joining means you are getting in right at the ground floor and that you will have an enormous impact on the success and direction of the company and product. Pachyderm has always and will always embrace a "Remote-first" approach to growing our team. This allows us to hire a diverse group of individuals across the country (and world!) while giving our team members the flexibility to work from anywhere. Being a member of The Pach means joining a supportive team that cares about you, values kindness and works hard to create an open and transparent workplace. The Role/Specific Responsibilities: Close new business through working qualified inbound & outbound sales opportunities Work closely with Sales Development & Sales Management to improve sales velocity, grow pipeline, hone messaging, request new content, and advise strategy as you deliver new business.  Provide prospect/customer feedback to Product & Marketing teams Efficient activity prioritization and independent decision making are critical skills Meet / exceed quarterly goals  Qualifications/Required Skills: You're ready to bring your skills to a startup You are customer centric, and results oriented 3+ years experience managing an entire sales cycle with an AI/ML, Data Science, DevOps, DataOps or related product.  A track record of exceeding 100% quota in a closing role selling to DataOps/Engineering lines of business in the Enterprise and Mid-Market segments  Strong existing network into a highly technical Data / ML oriented customer base  Strong understanding of business technical requirements, challenges and existing technology stacks You consistently communicate Pachyderm's differentiated product value and develop lasting client relationships You are team oriented, and you also take ownership and can get results independently Excellent communication and organization.  SFDC, Outreach, Zoom, GSuite  Benefits: Significant equity, 401k and full benefits (100% medical, dental and vision for employees, 50% for all dependents).  Flexible PTO - work/life balance is important and we want you to take time off to rejuvenate! Remote friendly- we were remote before remote was cool and we intend to continue to invest in a remote first culture.  Tons of fun swag and surprise packages sent to your doorstep.  Tech and office stipends - what you buy is yours to keep.  Education and donation stipends - we want to support your career growth and the community.  Supportive parental leave (see also: work/life balance).  Encouraged fun - game days, fun activities, zoom hangouts and more (and - when responsible - visits to our home base for team on-sites) We can't wait to meet you and hope you'll join our PACH!

title: Quality Systems Specialist
description:
at Bright Path Laboratories, Inc The Company Bright Path Laboratories, Inc. (BPL) is a leading U.S.-based advanced drug development and manufacturing company that has answered the call to recast America’s reliance on foreign pharmaceutical ingredients and medicines using patented AI-enabled continuous flow technology. Founded in 2017, BPL’s game-changing platform drives rapid synthetic route development and highly automated, controlled, and inexpensive deployment of scaled cGMP commercial manufacturing enabling the manufacture of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) and specialized medicines (e.g., orphan drugs to treat patients with rare diseases) here in the United States. It is estimated that the U.S. imports 80% of the APIs it uses for medicines and BPL is uniquely positioned to reduce our dependency on foreign suppliers and securitize America’s pharmaceutical supply chain. The Opportunity We are searching for a highly motivated Quality Systems Specialist to assume responsibility of Quality Assurance and cGMP compliance activities for the site quality management systems. This newly created role will report into our Head of Quality and be based at our site in Kannapolis, NC. Specific responsibilities will include, and are not limited to: Audit and maintain BPL’s quality management systems and ensure adherence to regulations and quality policies. Create and revise SOP’s, forms, templates, raw and material packaging materials specifications and finished product specifications. Support Head of Quality for continuous improvement of product quality, compliance, and performance of BPL operations. Conduct annual product reviews and validation documentation reviews. Support quality systems governance for deviations, CAPAs, change control and quality metrics. Manage the internal audit program and support all facility client audits and regulatory inspections. Serve as site Subject Matter Expert (SME) for deviations, CAPAs and effectiveness verification. Support quality assessments of internal operations to analyze compliance and assess risk. Execute supplier management activities including sending questionnaires and creating/maintaining an approved supplier list. Review batch records and manage the stability program. Compile site quality metrics for use in the continuous improvement of relevant site activities. Other duties as assigned. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in technical or business discipline; or the equivalent combination of education and progressive experience with increasing levels of responsibility in a cGMP environment. Minimum of 3 years’ experience working with quality management systems such as TrackWise or Master Control desired. Proficient with Microsoft Office suite of products. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Highly organized with a strong attention to detail. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Able to prioritize, manage time well, multi-task, and troubleshoot effectively. Ability to work effectively and collaboratively at a fast pace with cross functional departments to finalize time-sensitive deliverables. Compensation & Benefits Great colleagues Competitive salaries Stock compensation plan – you will be a Bright Path Labs co-owner Health, dental, and vision benefits Bright Path Labs is not currently offering visa sponsorships for any position. Please only apply if eligible to work in the U . S .  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or veteran status. description:
OpenClassrooms  mentors are freelance senior professionals . They help students succeed in their training programs, through weekly video calls of maximum one hour each. It’s a 100% remote mission. You can coach up to 2 students from the beginning. You should be legally authorized to work either in the United States without sponsorship (student visa not compatible)    The mentor's responsibilities To be a role model and share your industry know-how with students on a weekly basis, coaching them through their training programs. All of the educational content is created and made available through the OpenClassrooms platform. As a mentor your main tasks during weekly meetings will be to: Guide and advise your students in the completion of the projects within their training program. Inspire your students with your advice and experience in your field. Monitor your students’ progress throughout the mentoring sessions. Report problems and difficulties related to your students. Experience and Skills Required:   In the AI Engineer path, our students learn to use techniques such as Deep Learning to develop features such as chatbots or even navigation systems for autonomous vehicles. To do so, they must carry out professional projects, such as "Participate in a smart city contest" on which you accompany them.     You have a bachelor degree and at least 2 years of professional experience  as an  AI engineer     You master the exploration of data analysis, Azure, and python language   You know how to simplify complex concepts, set objectives and give constructive feedback.   You have a company structure or a freelance status (registered in your country of residence) or you are ready to create one.     Apply in 4 Easy Steps   Complete the mentor application form with an updated resume.   If your profile is selected, you will be invited to make a short video. This is an opportunity for us to learn more about your skills.   Your profile is selected! Send us the necessary documents to set up the contract: we take care of everything.   We send you your contract in a digital format, all you have to do is sign it, 100% online.     Know more about OpenClassrooms OpenClassrooms is a mission-driven company that makes education accessible to everyone, everywhere. 🌎 We are the leading online education platform in Europe and Africa, offering fully-accredited online diplomas based on the skills of the future. Each month, at least 300 000 free students from around the world connect to our platform, and we currently count more than 10 000 degree students. We are very proud to be part of the B Corp community (more than 3,500 companies that combine profit and general interest), and to have the Great Place to Work label. OpenClassrooms is also part of the Next40 group for the second consecutive year. We have recently announced a new fundraising of 80 million dollars. This will help us invest in our product, continue our growth and make education even more accessible across the world!   Why become a Mentor?   100% remote   Flexibility, as a Freelancer - Make your own schedule   Develop pedagogical skills   Increase your income   20% discount on OpenClassrooms training programs   Join a networking community of 3000 professionals   Recruit future colleagues!   Are you ready to help students succeed? Submit your application today!

title: Research Scientist (AI Ethics)
description:
Sony AI America, a branch of Sony AI, is a remotely distributed organization spread across the U.S. and Canada. Sony AI is Sony’s new research organization pursuing the mission to use AI to unleash human creativity. Sony AI works closely with Sony’s other business units, including Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC., Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc., and Sony Music Entertainment. With some 900 million Sony devices in hands and homes worldwide today, a vast array of Sony movies, television shows and music, and the PlayStation Network, Sony creates and delivers more entertainment experiences to more people than anyone else on earth. To learn more: https://ai.sony/ Sony AI America (SAIA)  is seeking highly motivated, self-driven individuals with expertise in AI Ethics - specifically Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability (FTA). We are currently looking for smart, enthusiastic people who want to join our team of world-renowned researchers as we push the boundaries of applying AI in support of human creativity. In this role, the successful candidate will research, develop and deploy fair, transparent, and accountable technology for image processing and other business areas. Sony AI America is a remote-work organization  – location is flexible . Responsibilities: Lead research projects in AI ethics, especially around Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability. Work closely with product and compliance teams to address AI ethics issues across Sony's diverse businesses. Work closely with a team of AI researchers and programmers in the U.S., Switzerland, and Japan on ambitious AI projects. Investigate new algorithms to solve fundamental AI ethics problems. Write code to support research, usually in Python, C++, and/or R. Write reports and give presentations for internal audiences. Write papers for and give presentations at academic conferences. Qualifications: Passion to develop cutting-edge AI ethics technology and deploy it through a multi-stakeholder approach. PhD or equivalent experience with a track record of relevant academic publications, patents, and/or open-source software related to AI ethics. Interdisciplinary researchers are highly encouraged to apply. Seniority will depend on number of years of work experience after PhD (or equivalent experience). Experience working with different AI ethics stakeholders, such as users and product, engineering, legal, and compliance business units. Experience in research on algorithmic fairness, accountability, and transparency. A track record of implementing software systems. Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills, including the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.  For more information and if you want  to apply for similar job openings in Japan or Europe , please visit https://ai.sony Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, military status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, genetic information, medical condition, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at careers@sonyusa.com or by mail to: Sony Corporation of America, Human Resources Department, 25 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10010.
