title: Data Engineer
description:
Position Summary In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace. Work you’ll do This person will design databases including modeling, diagramming, and creating scripts to create relational database tables, and scripts to help migrate and mitigate data. The data engineer will also contribute to ETL pipelines and data scraping. The team Deloitte’s Government and Public Services (GPS) practice – our people, ideas, technology and outcomes—is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights. Required Qualifications  3+ years of experience with data engineering, database design, and/or ETL development   3+ years of experience using ETL technology and SQL (SQL Server and SQL Developer)   3+ years of experience with data migration and/or data scraping   Active Secret s ecurity clearance required   Bachelor’s degree required   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future   Travel up to 25%  Preferred  Previous consulting experience   Python experience   Relational database experience   Recruiting tips  From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte recruiters . Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you .  Our people and culture  Our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It enables us to leverage different ideas and perspectives, and bring more creativity and innovation to help solve our client most complex challenges. This makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work. Learn more about our inclusive culture .  Professional development  From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to build new skills, take on leadership opportunities and connect and grow through mentorship. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. As used in this posting, "Deloitte" means Deloitte Consulting LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. title: Associate Scientist Computational Biology
description:
Company Overview Prime Medicine was founded to bring the promise of gene editing to patients. We use Prime Editing, a next-generation technology that can “search and replace” to restore normal genetic function almost anywhere in the genome. Prime Editing searches to find the precise place in the genome to edit and replaces the segment of faulty DNA with a correct copy of DNA. A single Prime Editor can correct the individual mutations found across patients, meaning Prime Editing can potentially address more than 90 percent of known disease-causing genetic mutations. We envision a world where this technology can cure, halt, and ultimately prevent genetic diseases, providing lifelong benefit to patients. Prime Medicine offers the opportunity to shape the future of gene editing and transform how medicines are used to treat disease. Realizing the promise of Prime Editing requires a talented team with diversity of viewpoints and expertise. We’re building a group of dedicated, scientifically curious individuals who are passionate about helping patients live longer, healthier lives. Position Overview: We are seeking a motivated computational biologist with broad skills in genomic analysis and scientific interpretation to join our team at Prime Medicine. You will partner closely with Discovery Research to develop hypotheses, design experiments, build bioinformatic methods, perform computational analyses, and apply machine learning where applicable. We seek mature individuals driven by their own scientific curiosity and interest in making a difference in patients’ lives. Responsibilities: Contribute to multiple stages of drug discovery by interrogating omics datasets with an emphasis on guide screens, machine learning, and off-target analysis Proactively find solutions to scientific challenges Show strong team spirit and focuses on finding collaborative solutions Develop and/or update algorithms and analyses Communicate findings, plans, publications internally and externally in scientific or technical journals and/or conferences Identify new opportunities in latest scientific literature Manage interactions with external collaborators, consultants Set clear priorities, manage many projects effectively Requirements: M.S. in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Biostatistics/Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Genetics, Molecular Biology or a relevant scientific field with direct experience in computational biology 1+ year(s) experience, preferably in a drug development setting Technical expertise in genomics, transcriptomics analysis Experience with statistical methods Good publication record Good coding skills using Python, R, git, Jupyter Familiarity with high performance computing, preferably on public clouds (i.e. AWS, GCP, Azure, IBM) Exposure with machine learning/AI methods and tools Demonstrated ability to work individually and collaboratively Evidence of maturity, self-awareness in team settings Strong written/verbal/listening/interpersonal skills Ready to roll up sleeves and get stuff done Prime Medicine is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.

title: Determined AI - Applied Machine Learning Engineer
description:
This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office. Job Description Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE. About This Role Come help us build the future of deep learning at Determined AI! Our customers are scientists and engineers working on the latest in autonomous driving, pharmaceutical research, and automated video analysis, among other things. As part of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, we’re installed in some of the largest computing clusters in the world, enabling cutting-edge deep learning teams to train better models in less time. We are seeking a skilled Machine Learning engineer; you will be one of our resident experts for machine learning and model development. Combined with an extensive knowledge of our Determined AI open-source platform, you will help our users solve a wide range of problems in machine learning development, from exploratory data analysis to model deployment. Additionally, you will collaborate with our engineering teams to ensure our software meets our users' needs. Finally, your understanding of the machine learning landscape will inspire our product and engineering direction to ensure our open-source platform continues to be at the cutting edge of MLOps. This position could be located anywhere in the US. Requirements Production-grade industry experience building and deploying machine learning applications for computer vision, natural language processing, text understanding, pattern recognition, recommendation/ranking systems, or similar. Proficiency in Python and at least one of the leading deep learning software packages: TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or MXNet. Strong experience presenting technical information to a technically diverse audience. Preferred Prior experience designing, implementing, testing, and shipping production-quality software in an industrial setting. The interest and ability to contribute to user-facing Python libraries to facilitate adoption of the Determined open-source platform. Familiarity with using and debugging open-source libraries used in enterprise infrastructure solutions such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Apache Spark. Experience in cross-functional or customer-facing roles. Determined AI, part of HPE, is dramatically simplifying the process of building deep learning models. Our open-source platform supports state-of-the-art hyperparameter tuning, seamless distributed training, and automatic checkpointing and resource scheduling, allowing scientists to focus on their research instead of infrastructure and boilerplate. What We Can Offer You Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth. If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers. Join us and make your mark! Find Out More About Us And Follow Us On https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Job Engineering Job Level Specialist Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities. HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Data Scientist II - Pathology AI (Remote)
description:
Job ID:25844 Location:450 Brookline Ave, Boston, MA 02215 Category:Research Laboratory Employment Type:Full time Work Location:Full Remote: 4-5 days remote/wk Overview We are seeking an intelligent, hard-working, and dynamic individual to serve as a data scientist focusing on Pathology AI within the AI Operations and Data Science Services group -- a group serving some of the most prominent research and clinical programs at the Institute, from basic to translational research, to clinical deployment, and operationalization. The group encompasses expertise in AI, data science, machine learning, NLP, computer vision, production deployment, cloud infrastructure, data engineering, project management standards, and data labeling. The group seeks to develop a highly interdisciplinary environment supporting our research, clinical and operational staff to advance the overall mission of DFCI which is to provide expert, compassionate care to children and adults with cancer while advancing the understanding, diagnosis, treatment, cure, and prevention of cancer and related diseases. As we widen our support of several crucial centers and programs at DFCI, we seek an energetic and motivated data scientist who will contribute to designing, implementing, and deploying computational image analysis pipelines to support the Institute’s various initiatives in digital pathology. The candidate will serve as the data science domain expert on highly interdisciplinary, collaborative projects, ranging from hypothesis-driven research projects to building institutional-scale computational infrastructure to enhance and improve the Institute’s capabilities across entire departments and centers. Key technical responsibilities will include training and evaluating ML models, building and maintaining data pipelines, and contributing to software tools developed internally and used by collaborators, and establishing machine learning and data management best practices. The successful candidate will also bring strong communication and collaboration skills, with proven experience working on large complex projects, meeting deadlines, and managing relationships with key stakeholders. This position is fully remote with flexibility to come onsite if desired. Please note that any qualified candidates must reside in MA, RI, or NH. Responsibilities The key responsibilities and requirements will be: Working with the area leader for Pathology AI to support their tasks in managing internal research clients and leading and executing projects end-to-end as required, as well as leading certain aspects of the Pathology AI area (e.g., Client management, certain technical projects, etc.) Consulting with scientists, identifying their needs from a data science and data infrastructure perspective, and designing and implementing plans and solutions to address these gaps Delivery of results for projects on-time and on-budget Working as part of the broader team to identify longer-term solutions that will improve quality, speed and efficacy of our current projects and programs Evaluating and benchmarking new libraries; prototype and pipeline development. Mentor and supervise junior personnel, scoping and delegating work to Associate Data Scientists and/or Data Science Interns and Trainees, as well as supporting them during their projects in order to deliver new and ambitious goals in the group Consistently track all activities in project management tools; work with Project Manager as required Demonstrate excellent soft-skills, such as excellent oral, written, and presentation communication skills Contribute to scientific manuscripts and presentations as required Possibly, attract new research clients Actively contribute to the growth of the AI Operations and Data Science Services group, in terms of scope, access, responsibilities, and new projects that are trusted with the group Support the I&A Department and the Institute as a whole, should be the baseline mentality Requirements : Deep AI / data science skills, at the interface between computer science and statistics MS in quantitative field such as data science, computer science, applied mathematics, or equivalent experience with evidence of impact in data science applied to real life problems (e.g., some quant master courses AND experience in data science internship) in research setting ideally within a clinical or research environment Experience with data science methodologies and techniques, (e.g., hypothesis testing, classification, regression, clustering, feature allocation, deep learning, time-series analysis, network modeling, feature selection/engineering)  Strong proficiency in Python. Key domains include: machine learning, image processing, distributed/high-performance computing, MLOps Strong knowledge of image processing and computer vision techniques Familiarity with Jupyter Lab, linux, and git Excellent communication skills, collaborative mindset, effective problem-solving skills, track record in serving a variety of diverse customers and projects Ability to work independently, prioritize, and manage people if needed, within an environment with ever changing priorities Qualifications Preferred Qualifications : Preferred 1 to 5 years of experience post MS or PhD Experience in project management and in client management is preferred Experience working with pathology images preferred (e.g., H&E, IHC, IF, spatial omics, volumetric imaging, etc.) Experience with theory and/or practice of microscopy is a BIG plus  Experience with design and development of open-source software/tools (software design best practices, unit testing, integration testing, packaging, documentation, etc.) is a plus Domain knowledge of cancer biology, histology, immunology, oncology, cancer genetics, is a nice to have At Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, we work every day to create an innovative, caring, and inclusive environment where every patient, family, and staff member feels they belong. As relentless as we are in our mission to reduce the burden of cancer for all, we are equally committed to diversifying our faculty and staff. Cancer knows no boundaries and when it comes to hiring the most dedicated and diverse professionals, neither do we. If working in this kind of organization inspires you, we encourage you to apply.

title: Software Engineer - ML/IOT/Embedded
description:
The Company Reality AI gives our customers the tools to make every product they build more intelligent. We do this by making machine learning model generation, data curation, validation all effortless for our customers. Reality AI has 15 US patents and 6 patents pending in the areas of feature discovery and machine learning as applied to sensor and signal problems. Our key differentiators involve automated feature, model generation as well as ability to run these models on really low-cost microcontrollers. From emergency vehicle detection and localization needed in autonomous cars to failure detection in industrial components, our use cases and applications are aplenty. We’ve worked with some of the largest brands in the world you might have heard of. With customers in several countries and offices in Columbia, MD, Sunnyvale, CA, Detroit, MI, and Tokyo, Japan, we’re a truly global company that is in an industry that’s just beginning to take shape. The Role This role requires someone with Python programming skills to write code that can run on single board computers (like the RaspberryPi) OR run on large servers. You will be expected to play a major role in architectural decisions, help prioritize and plan tasks, and write code that interfaces with sensors. The perfect candidate will be eager to collaborate, solve problems, and learn on the fly in a fast-paced, early startup environment. title: Marketing Director, AI, Gastrointestinal (Santa Clara or Remote)
description:
Careers that Change Lives The Marketing Director is responsible for developing and executing global market strategy for artificial intelligence (AI) across the GI portfolio with a focus on GI Genius and the associated innovation pipeline. This role includes the leadership of the AI marketing team including driving a highly disruptive innovation pipeline (in conjunction with external business partners) and market development activities across the globe. A Day in the Life Strategy  Lead execution of the commercial strategy for GI Genius and associated products/services including Genius Academy.   Create and refresh 5 year strategic global marketing plan.   Define market and product requirements for disruptive AI innovation pipeline in collaboration with external development partners.   Develop and strengthen in depth knowledge of the emerging and radidly evolving artificial intelligence market landscape.   Identify key global market expansion opportunities.   Provide recommendations and input to the GI Leadership Team representing the perspectives of the market, customers and other related stakeholders.  Team Leadership  Lead the marketing team to successful accomplishment of marketing Vital Few objectives.   Define the roles and responsibilities of the team for maximum output.   Ensure strong communication within the team and across the organization.   Provide on-going career and professional development to team members.   Manage financial resources within assigned budget to achieve key goals of strategy execution.   Sustain a team environment of collaboration, trust, achievement and high engagement.  Cross Functional Collaboration  Successfully partner and communicate with other functional leaders (including business development, R&D, clinical, regulatory, sales and finance) in the development and execution of marketing plans, with a major focus on GI Genius.   Partner with the Business Development team in analyzing potential organic and inorganic opportunities to support growth of the business.   Partner closely with WW regional managers in adapting global marketing strategy and executing regional plans.   Partner with Global Integrated Marketing and the Communications team to generate awareness of portfolio and develop engaging marketing materials and PR campigns, building advocacy with patients and providers.   Establish a practice of consistent communication across all global stakeholders.   Collaborate with external partners to deliver a robust pipeline of AI innovation into the market.  Market Development  Partner with functional leadership in developing go-to-market and market development strategies including operations, clinical, health economics and reimbursement and education.   Execute KOL strategy supporting new product development, publications, training and engagement on a global and regional level.   Establish strong relationships with influential healthcare professionals, societies and institutional decision makers including those in clinical and health economics.   Generate awareness of the GI AI portfolio and value propositions through omnichannel marketing including digital campaigns, web presence and convention strategy.   Employ market research to regularly assess market opportunities and trends.   Intimately understand the multi-stakeholder needs and key issues to successfully develop and position the AI portfolio in the marketplace.   ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS/SCOPE   :  The Marketing Director reports to the Sr. Director of Global Marketing and will play a key role on the Global Marketing Leadership Team. The Marketing Director will work across the global business unit functional leadership (sales leadership, R&D, finance, health economics and reimbursement and clinical.) Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required  10+ years experience with a Bachelors or 8+ years experience with a graduate degree in two or more of the following functions in the medical device space: product marketing, market development, and strategy and portfolio management.   8+ experience managing and leading teams  Nice to Have Proven success in marketing management and working collaboratively with a cross-functional team. Exceptional quantitative, analytical, written and verbal skills. Proven track record of planning and execution. Experience with global marketing either in or with global markets. Ability to balance development of strategy plus experience in bringing that strategy to life through execution. Executing in the shared service organization, strategic agility, managing vision & purpose, decision quality, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills. Key element is flexibility and ability to work independently. Ability to work in a hybrid home/office work environment. Ability to travel as much as necessary for position (up to 50% travel). About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Job Description: AI Research Lab – Research Coordinator Job Description: Join the ETS AI Labs, where we develop research-based, technology-enabled, user-obsessed AI solutions for education! The mission of the AI Lab is to advance educational and employment opportunities by providing tools and services that help individuals worldwide identify, efficiently progress toward, and meet their learning and career goals. We seek to lead the EdTech field in delivering efficacious learning tools built with users, backed by science, and offer efficiency, flexibility, and insights that support meaningful decision-making along education and workforce journeys. title: Business Development Representative
description:
About the Opportunity FutureFit AI is experiencing significant traction and demand for our SaaS B2B2C offering in both the Enterprise and Workforce Development spaces, and we are looking to bring on a talented Business Development Representative to help us capture and further accelerate that momentum. This is an extremely exciting opportunity for a high-energy, driven, and self-motivated individual to directly influence the success of the company in its next stage of growth while being at the center of innovation in workforce development and the future of work. Working closely with our Sales team, you will be responsible for prospecting customers and bringing in sales leads. You will play a critical role in the sales cycle and will often be the first contact that a prospective customer has with FutureFit AI. Whether interacting through email, on the phone, at an event or some other medium, you will make a positive first impression of FutureFit AI by being responsible for the first portion of a prospect’s sales journey. If you’re looking for a role with growth potential, this is the opportunity for you! Responsibilities Identify the needs and challenges of the prospective customer Become a subject-matter expert on FutureFit AI’s services, offerings, and community Manage the top of the funnel for FutureFit AI’s sales pipeline Gather, analyze, and present data and information from multiple sources to create reports that evaluate achievement of sales targets and objectives Define new processes and optimize existing workflows to ensure the Sales team consistently meets or exceeds its KPIs Schedule discovery meetings for sales representatives and prospects Make contact with potential new customers across a variety of channels - phone, email, social, chat Use prospecting strategies to lead initial outreach to prospects Location:  There is a preference (but not requirement) for this role to be based in New York City, but applications will be considered from anywhere in the US or Canada. Requirements:  Please ensure your application includes a resume. There is also a preference for those who have experience in or a passion for education or the future of work. Compensation & Benefits:  You can expect a competitive early stage startup salary commensurate with experience, as well as stock options, benefits, and unlimited PTO. About You The Business Development Representative role might be a good fit for you if: You’re excited about the opportunity to support a fast-growing technology startup You have experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales Development Representative or similar role for a B2B (or B2B2C) SaaS technology startup You are a strong communicator with excellent phone, writing, and listening skills You have the ability to uncover and understand customer needs You are experienced at qualifying opportunities You’re a natural problem solver - you’re constantly trying to optimize all situations You’re humble, teachable, and eager to learn You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment You are looking for a step up in autonomy and responsibility in your day-to-day work, with unlimited potential for growth in your role at a company over time Benefits We provide a generous benefits package to all of our team members, including unlimited PTO, health care, technology reimbursement, and flexible schedules. About FutureFit AI  FutureFit AI believes that the greatest challenge of the Future of Work is facilitating successful career transitions, and our mission is to address that challenge by using AI to transform the education and economic mobility of 100 million people in the next 10 years. FutureFit AI is a growing, well-funded, company focused on using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions. We bring innovation, creativity, and empathy to our work, and care deeply about the impact our technology can have on our customers and users. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation. ©  FutureFit AI All rights reserved, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We encourage people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to apply.

title: 2023 Graduate Director, AI and Machine Learning
description:
2023 MBA/Graduate Student - Director, AI and Machine Learning ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY: Continuous expansion in data volumes and their sources raises the bar for corporations to organize, manage, store and analyze data. At the same time, businesses are relying upon data for strategic insight, regulators are becoming increasingly data-savvy, and digital disruptors are forcing companies to change the way they operate. The complexity of business processes and transactional systems within modern global enterprises adds to the challenge. The independent, trusted professionals in FTI Consulting’s Data & Analytics practice are experts at using data to reveal underlying truths of business operations, and to support companies during regulatory inquiries and with commercial disputes. We specialize in creating bespoke analytics solutions for our clients across a wide range of engagement types, from litigation & disputes, compliance, financial crime, and fraud investigation application, to the development and deployment of cutting-edge tools and solutions. FTI’s Data & Analytics practice is looking for candidates with both a passion for data science, data engineering, and statistics, and the experience and expertise to lead complex project teams while understanding larger business and strategic considerations. Joining as a Director, you’ll have the chance to lead project teams, apply data science methods and analytics to solve complex operational, regulatory, and strategic challenges across a variety of industries to drive significant impact. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of regions, industries, and disciplines on key topics, while collaborating with leading subject matter experts across FTI. Ideal candidates should be looking for a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment, where intellectual curiosity and entrepreneurial mindsets abound. What You’ll Do As a Director in FTI’s Data & Analytics practice, you’ll be part of a rapidly growing team responsible for delivering day-to-day data analytics solutions to our clients. You will develop solutions and recommendations requiring a deep understanding of relationships among multiple internal and external data sources, complex modelling, and information sharing. Your primary responsibilities will include: - Managing work streams within a project, and effectively delegating responsibilities to junior team members. - Designing and executing the development of analytic solutions using a range of algorithms and tools as appropriate for the problem presented by the client. - Driving the application of rigorous data science methods and techniques across a range of industries and applications. - Overseeing the development of machine learning (ML) models through all the phases of the ML lifecycle, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation. - Identifying market opportunities for the application of the latest advancements in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to build, test, and validate predictive models. - Deploying algorithms to production to identify actionable insights from large datasets. - Coaching and develop data scientists and analysts. - Designing and implementing complex data models leveraging both external and internal client data to facilitate analysis. - Supporting the research and development of data and analytics assets used across project and solutions. - Providing core analytic development and data engineering work at the foundation of all projects. - Interacting on a day-to-day basis with FTI team members, client personnel, and advisors. - Preparing project documentation, visualizations and written analyses, reports, or presentations. - Nimbly juggling multiple client and internal priorities and switching between tasks, sometimes in a high-pressure environment. All of the above must be undertaken with a view to delivering quality output to our clients within established timeframes. How You’ll Grow Alongside opportunities to learn on the job from some of the leading professionals in the industry, FTI Consulting offers extensive internal and external training opportunities. Additionally, the candidate hired for this role will play a central role in the continued evolution of the Data & Analytics practice’s Artificial Intelligence (AI) and ML service offerings, trainings, and strategic roadmap.

title: Global Head of Development, Digital Health Care
description:
About the Role: Sanofi’s mission is to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. Sanofi is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. At Sanofi, we're building a team of brilliant individuals to drive the success of a new digital healthcare business to transform healthcare for all. People are the most critical ingredient to our success. Sanofi’s General Medicines Digital Healthcare Team conducts cutting-edge research in the health care space and incubates data-driven digital solutions which aim to improve patients’ health outcomes, clinicians’ experience, and reduce health care costs. We are actively incubating multiple concepts to improve the lives of patients globally, and we are seeking the best and the brightest to join this journey and change healthcare for all. Sanofi US is considering candidates both within and outside of the US and France regions. Company paid relocation is being offered for this role. What you will work on: Facilitate the digital healthcare team to against Sanofi General Medicines Digital Healthcare Strategy on a global basis Lead the development and delivery of the organizations digital and device product roadmap in alignment with the vision and in collaboration with the Sanofi digital team and the General Medicine’s commercial, medical, etc. teams Drive operational rigor, predictability, and excellence creating value for our users and customers Tie product strategy to business objectives, producing measurable results/business impact Leverage deep knowledge of the digital healthcare marketplace to differentiate Sanofi digital healthcare solutions Partner with commercial, regulatory, clinical, regulatory, quality, and legal leaders to identify opportunities, define requirements, map product development / approval processes, and delivery solutions Partner closely with Sanofi Digital and Digital Healthcare teams (product, UX, and engineering) to validate key with end user concepts, to develop solutions, and deliver those solutions to market Partner with Quality and Risk Management Offices to ensure full compliance with digital health QMS standards and to manage product risk  Education: A minimum of a Bachelors degree is required, preferably within Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or a Computer science degree or equivalent experience in software development for medical devices or health applications MS in mechanical, electrical engineering, PhD is preferred Qualifications: A minimum of 15+ years of professional experience as an evolving leader in the development of digital health solutions, medical and / or consumer health devices, and / or technology development Delivery of digital health or medical device from initial design through commercialization and regulatory approval, preference in cardiometabolic disease is required Experience in consumer health digital / device development with a large technology (e.g. IBM, Google, Apple, Microsoft, etc.) is preferred Global team leadership experience is preferred A keen ability to unite diverse perspectives to work toward a shared vision. Being able to work across borders and time zones. Data-driven decision maker, process-oriented, and fluency with outcomes reporting (clinical outcomes, SLAs, others) Deep understanding of current trends in conversational AI and Data Science in the healthcare space Comfortable working in a remote and independent environment This position may require up to 25% overall travel Creative and proactive problem-solver with a bias to action, positive attitude COVID-19 As a healthcare company and a vaccine manufacturer, Sanofi has an important responsibility to protect individual and public health. This position will require individuals to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as part of your job responsibilities. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law. DIVERSITY AT SANOFI At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. title: Founding Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About Us We dream about the perfect data world, and we are on a quest to make it a reality. Problem Batch and streaming data issues cost a company on an average of $15M (Gartner), and data in companies is increasing 60% - 100% every month! (IDG) The pain that companies are experiencing due to data quality, performance and governance issues is only going to get worse from here. Product Altimate AI is bringing in the shift-left paradigm to identify data issues earlier in the data lifecycle - at data sources, in Git - CI/CD, and in analytics / ML workflows. It uses cutting-edge AI/ML to understand the semantic meaning of data and leverages data contracts that cover data quality, performance, and governance. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to build a generational company in a huge multi-billion dollar market. Team We are silicon valley veterans who previously have created category-defining data and AI products that are loved by thousands of companies worldwide. We have experienced the journey of a small startup to IPO very closely. We have started on a similar journey again and are backed by some of prominent advisors and VC firms with multi-billion dollar portfolios. Why you should join Altimate AI Impact Influence the product roadmap and architecture decisions. Be the driver for building the engineering culture Take ownership of the systems that you build. De-Risked 3+ years of runway in the bank Backed by prominent investors in the enterprise space Active engagements with top-tier private and public companies Learnings Work closely with experienced founders and learn to build a startup from the ground up Active involvement with most of facets of the company gives an opportunity to improve skills beyond just engineering About The Role As a founding engineer at AltimateAI, you will play a foundational role in designing, building, and scaling our products and the team. We’re looking for exceptional Engineers to join the founding team in solving complex problems at the intersection of Data and ML. The Compensation Equity - 0.2% - 1.0% Cash - $100k - $180k Healthcare - medical, dental, and vision 401k plan Well-furnished office space with snacks, drinks, and amenities Time off - flexible vacation policy to encourage people to get out and see the world. Goodies - a new MacBook Pro and whatever hardware and software you need to get the job done. Seat at the table - come to work every day knowing your efforts will have a material impact in shaping the direction of the company. ABOUT You Ideally you have: 3+ years of full-time experience, ideally in a startup environment or building something end-to-end from scratch Web fundamentals of HTML, JavaScript, and CSS; proficient in one frontend framework like React, Angular, Vue Strong Python knowledge prior experience of architecting and managing complete systems – web applications, databases, cloud infrastructure, etc. Experience in dev-ops using AWS or Google Cloud (Bonus) Experience with Scalable API Backend using Python (FastAPI) (Bonus) 2+ years experience building ML/data products is a big plus (Bonus) Working knowledge of ML/deep learning Location This role is open to remote candidates with a preference towards those in the US or with some time-overlap with the US pacific time zone. We are located in the San Francisco Bay Area, California, and plan to gather with our remote teammates at least once per year. For remote folks, the compensation will be adjusted based on the local rates.

title: Data Scientist I - Pathology AI and Microscopy / Digital Pathology (Remote)
description:
Job ID:25845 Location:450 Brookline Ave, Boston, MA 02215 Category:Research Laboratory Employment Type:Full time Work Location:Full Remote: 4-5 days remote/wk Overview Data Scientist I  - Pathology AI and Microscopy / Digital Pathology We are seeking an intelligent, hard-working, and dynamic individual to serve as a data scientist focusing on Pathology AI within the AI Operations and Data Science Services group -- a group serving some of the most prominent research and clinical programs at the Institute, from basic to translational research, to clinical deployment, and operationalization. The group encompasses expertise in AI, data science, machine learning, NLP, computer vision, production deployment, cloud infrastructure, data engineering, project management standards, and data labeling. The group seeks to develop a highly interdisciplinary environment supporting our research, clinical and operational staff advance the overall mission of DFCI which is to provide expert, compassionate care to children and adults with cancer while advancing the understanding, diagnosis, treatment, cure, and prevention of cancer and related diseases. This position is fully remote with flexibility to come onsite if desired. Please note that any qualified candidates must reside in MA, RI, or NH. As we widen our support of several crucial centers and programs at DFCI, we seek an energetic and motivated data scientist who will contribute to designing, implementing, and deploying computational image analysis pipelines to support the Institute’s initiatives in spatial proteomics and other cutting-edge technologies at the intersection of imaging and molecular profiling. The candidate will serve as the data science domain expert on highly interdisciplinary, collaborative projects, ranging from hypothesis-driven research projects to building institutional-scale computational infrastructure to enhance and improve the Institute’s capabilities across entire departments and centers. The successful candidate will bring deep technical skills as well as strong communication and collaboration skills, with proven experience working on large complex projects, meeting deadlines, and managing relationships with key stakeholders. Responsibilities The key responsibilities and requirements will be: Working with the area leader for Pathology AI in order to support their tasks in managing internal research clients and leading and executing projects end-to-end as required, as well as leading certain aspects of the Pathology AI area (eg, Client management, certain technical projects, etc.) Consulting with scientists, identifying their needs from a data science and data infrastructure perspective, and designing and implementing plans and solutions to address these gaps Delivery of results for projects on-time and on-budget Working as part of the broader team to identify longer-term solutions that will improve quality, speed and efficacy of our current projects and programs Evaluating and benchmarking new libraries; prototype and pipeline development. Excellent communication and effective problem-solving skills, track record in serving a variety of diverse customers and projects Ability to work independently, prioritize, and manage people if needed, within an environment with ever changing priorities Mentor and supervise junior personnel, scoping and delegating work to Associate Data Scientists and/or Data Science Interns and Trainees, as well as supporting them during their projects in order to deliver new and ambitious goals in the group Consistently track all activities in project management tools; work with Project Manager as required Demonstrate excellent soft-skills, such as excellent oral, written, and presentation communication skills Contribute to scientific manuscripts and presentations as required Possibly, attract new research clients Actively contribute to the growth of the AI Operations and Data Science Services group, in terms of scope, access, responsibilities, and new projects that are trusted with the group Support the I&A Department and the Institute as a whole, should be the baseline mentality Requirements : Deep AI / data science skills, at the interface between computer science and statistics MS in quantitative field such as data science, computer science, applied mathematics, or equivalent experience with evidence of impact in data science applied to real life problems (eg, some quant master courses AND experience in data science internship) in a research setting ideally within a clinical or research environment Experience with data science methodologies and techniques, e.g. hypothesis testing, classification, regression, clustering, feature allocation, deep learning, time-series analysis, network modeling, feature selection/engineering.  Strong proficiency in Python. Key domains include: machine learning, image processing, distributed/high-performance computing Strong knowledge of image processing and computer vision techniques Familiarity with Jupyter Lab, linux, and git Qualifications Preferred Qualifications : Preferred 1 to 5 years of experience post MS or PhD Prior experience with spatial omics STRONGLY preferred (e.g., CODEX, MERFISH, CyCIF, seqFISH, etc.) Experience with design and development of open-source software/tools (software design best practices, unit testing, integration testing, packaging, documentation, etc.) Cloud computing experience (e.g., GCP) Domain knowledge of cancer biology, immunology, oncology, cancer genetics, is a plus At Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, we work every day to create an innovative, caring, and inclusive environment where every patient, family, and staff member feels they belong. As relentless as we are in our mission to reduce the burden of cancer for all, we are equally committed to diversifying our faculty and staff. Cancer knows no boundaries and when it comes to hiring the most dedicated and diverse professionals, neither do we. If working in this kind of organization inspires you, we encourage you to apply.

title: AI/ML - Machine Learning Engineer - Siri and Language Technologies
description:
Summary   Do you want to leverage your ML skills and NLP domain knowledge to play an important role in the next revolution of Natural Language Understanding/Conversational AI? Would you like to join the team that’s creating groundbreaking conversational assistant technologies that already helps millions of people get things done on daily bases? Join the Siri Experience team at Apple!   Key Qualifications   5 years of professional work experience applying machine learning to real-world problems, and crafting scalable and effective data solutions. Excellent programming skills in Python or Scala Excellent data analytical skills. Strong attention to detail. Proven track record to dive into data to discover hidden patterns and conduct error/deviation analysis Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills. Good domain knowledge in at least one of the following: NLP, information retrieval, data mining Good experience with Big Data systems such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive, ..etc Good knowledge in statistical methods such as Bayesian Statistics Passion for continuing to learn state-of-the-art techniques in ML/Data science   Description   As a Machine Learning Engineer within Language Technologies you will define new approaches for evaluating ML based systems, conversational AI, and model interpretability. You will run experiments, statistically interpret data with a mind on causation, data visualization, plus designing, building, and evaluating models. You will work with large amounts of real-world data to analyze and propose changes to Siri user experience. You will ensure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, data wrangling, etc. Your expertise in defining and measuring the online and offline end-to-end metrics will help communicate, evaluate, and iterate on state-of-the-art deployed models and predictors. This position offers the right person a chance to play an important role in the next revolution in machine learning and Natural Language Understanding/Conversational AI. You will contribute to a product that is redefining computing. You will be part of a team that’s crafting groundbreaking conversational assistant technologies for both large scale systems and new client devices. You will work with the people who built the intelligent assistant that already helps millions of people get things done. This is a fast-paced role with high visibility, impact, and ensures we build the most advanced AI systems in the industry.   Education & Experience   BS/MS or Ph.D in Computer Science or related field   Role Number: 200357271

title: Principal/Senior AI Researcher Security
description:
Title: Principal/Senior AI Researcher Security           Group: Wipro AI research Group         Number of positions:1         Band: C2/D1         Location: US/ Europe/India           About the Team         You will be joining a highly talented AI research team organization, working with the VP and Director of AI research. AI research team partners with leading academic institutions and product leads to answer some of the fundamental research questions in AI with huge industry impact. The team also supports also support other teams in evaluating/building AI products, where the team help provide applied transitional AI research to answer important yet fundamental business questions to support Wipro's AI vision.             Core Responsibilities:          Engage with engineering and business partners to understand requirements and map to research plan for AI initiative within Wipro       Develop, collaborate with academia and industry AI research partners, and take ownership of an AI research pillar           Act as a subject matter expert, keeping up with the latest research to obtain academic and industry trends/insights in the AI application to security and privacy protection fields.               Build a roadmap for implementing AI applications to security and privacy protection.           Performing analysis of cutting-edge AI pipelines and proposing recommendations on how they could be integrated within the Wipro AI ecosystem       Handling research-impacting changes gracefully and providing clear and timely communications           R&D and prototyping of new AI based technologies. You will be interact with experts in these areas on a regular basis.             Required Qualifications         You have a Master/PhD degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering       You should be able take tough problems in the research domain and shape them towards enterprise applicability.       Significant experience working with AI and ML frameworks such TensorFlow, Pytorch, etc. as well as Big Data Technologies such as Spark, streaming technologies and applying large scale Machine Learning techniques within these technologies.       Prior experience preparing data for analysis, building AI/ML on large scale platforms, and helping to drive innovation into the cutting-edge AI/ML process/offerings.       Should have worked on solution using AI-based security techniques to detect malware, adversarial attack / deep fakes ,etc       Should be able to study infrastructure, cloud deployments. Identify risks and propose mitigations using AI and secure tool chains )       Your written communication is clear, and you have the ability to distill sophisticated ideas into accurate and easily understandable takeaways will be keys to your success.                 Helpful Experience:                 Cybersecurity certification              Solid understanding of the following technologies:       AWS data services       Snowflake       Matillion or other ETL/ELT tools       Tableau               You are familiar with the frontend layer of BI tools and understand the key elements of a phenomenal analytical user journey.       Significant experience with modern big data technologies such as Spark, Cassandra, Drill, and related platforms.       You are experienced with cloud-based development processes and automation.       You have strong instincts and judgment in analyzing requirements       You have practical experience with relational and non-relational databases, and pride yourself on writing performant, easy-to-read SQL.       You are as comfortable working with git, the command line, and dev environments as you are collaborating with business partners at all levels of seniority to understand their data needs.             Rewards:            High performance culture promoting recognition, rewards and professional development            Competitive base salary coupled with attractive role-specific incentive plan           Comprehensive benefits program                   Why Wipro Applied AI Research?                 Wipro AI lab is dedicated to AI research, intended to benefit the society and social causes at large. Join us in this journey to tackle an extraordinary set of scientific and engineering challenges and make a larger impact.

description:
Requirements: Experience in the voice-over/voice acting industry - a must Native English speaker - a must Experience in creative script writing / directing - an advantage Experience in voice casting, dubbing - an advantage Experience with Audio editing software - an advantage Experience working in a startup company - an advantage Multi-lingual - an advantage. About Deepdub: At Deepdub we believe that everyone deserves to have access to content in their own language. Our web-based platform translates and dubs using AI and at scale. We plug into the post-production process of content owners and take complete ownership of all of their localization needs. We are shaping the future of international entertainment experiences. In his distinct deep voice, think of Morgan Freeman speaking in Hebrew, Spanish, German, etc. Cool, right? Our strong, winning teams are built based on our four core values: having fun, being professional, being nice to each other, and self-empowerment. Are you ready to deep into our revolution? You will work closely with research and development departments to assist Deepdub in all creative aspects of tech advancements as well as tools and application. Work with other departments in the company (research and development) to provide creative insight as well user feedback on Deepdub application and other tools. You’ll know you’re a good fit if you: Tech savvy Have order and organization skills, ability to make decisions and raise flags when required Have strong communication skills, worked as part of a team and also know to own a project Love to create and want to be a part of something big A few more reasons to join us: In Deepdub everyone is special! If you, like us, prefer watching TV and movies in the highest quality viewing experience there is, your place is with us!

title: AGILE Innovation Postdoctoral Fellow
companyName: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
description:
Posting Information Posting Details Department  Institute Convergent Science - 624500 Posting Open Date  10/21/2022 Application Deadline Open Until Filled  Yes Position Type  Postdoctoral Scholar Position Title  AGILE Innovation Postdoctoral Fellow Vacancy ID  PDS003637 Full-time/Part-time  Full-Time Temporary Hours per week  40 FTE  1 Work Location  Chapel Hill, NC Position Location  North Carolina, US Hiring Range  $56,000 - $65,000 Proposed Start Date Estimated Duration of Appointment  36 Months Position Information Primary Purpose Of Organizational Unit The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill ( UNC ) seeks to expand the scale and scope of its impact on society by translating discovery into solutions through invention, innovation, and enterprise. To accomplish these goals, the university will develop and mobilize new teams of researchers, designers, experts, and entrepreneurs and provide the support and infrastructure needed to help these teams succeed. UNC seeks to foster a comprehensive innovation ecosystem that embraces the whole institution and its external partners, and that provides information, services, and resources to faculty entrepreneurs in a systematic way along the arc of discovery-invention to technology-transition. The UNC Institute for Convergent Science ( ICS ) is a key component of that ecosystem. Using a three-lane innovation framework articulated as ‘Ready, Set, Go,’ ICS supports the journey from innovative idea to transformational product, technology, or solution through a problem-centered approach that draws together innovators from diverse disciplines to address real-world issues. Located in Carolina’s premier science research facility, the UNC Genome Sciences Building, ICS brings the best commercialization processes to the $1.15 billion UNC research enterprise. Position Summary We are seeking a postdoctoral associate to join our team in the Engineering Innovations Lab ( EIL ) to assist with our projects related to Next Gen nano-sensor DNA and RNA sequencing and particle counting. Specifically, we are developing hardware, automation systems, and algorithms in support of this work. This position will be mainly associated with signal processing software and algorithms for detection and classification of these nanoparticles. Along with standard filtering techniques, we are currently utilizing PCA (Principal Component Analysis) to classify particle types based on multi-variate data. We will soon be investigating various AI/ML (Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning) methods for classifications. Ultimately, the AI/ML methods will be encoded for embedded processing within stand-alone instrumentation. EIL also designs low-noise, high bandwidth electronics for particle detection. These projects are funded through a commercial sponsored research project as well as through FDA / NIH grant funding. The projects form a joint collaboration between UNC , KU, LSU , Wake Forest, and our commercial partners. In addition, we are part of an interdisciplinary umbrella organization, the Center of Biomodular Multi-Scale Systems for Precision Medicine (https://cbmm.ku.edu/). The candidate will have the opportunity to work with world-renowned scientists from each of the collaborating organizations. The individual hired into this position will be a member of the Institute for Convergent Science ( ICS ) Innovation Postdoctoral Fellow Program (https://convergent.unc.edu/) and will have the opportunity to participate in professional development activities such as performing customer discovery, market research and patent landscaping and supporting proposal development projects. There is flexibility to tailor the experience to the career goals of the fellow, depending on availability of suitable projects/initiatives. This fellowship offers unique training in translational science while also developing commercialization and project leadership skills. Fellows are also encouraged to participate in existing experiential training programs including the UNC Venture Catalyst Program and the I-Corps program. Fellows will have access to UNC CareerWell courses (including Market Research, Team Collaboration, Technology Commercialization Fundamentals, Applied Project Management) offered by The Graduate School. The fellow will also have access to mentoring from KickStart Entrepreneurs-in-Residence and its advisory network and is invited to participate in KickStart events and workshops. Minimum Education And Experience Requirements A Ph.D. in biomedical engineering, materials engineering, or related discipline. Required Qualifications, Competencies, And Experience  Programming ability including one or more of these languages: Python, MATLAB , and/or LabView.  Familiarity with standard data analysis techniques, including standard statistical methods.  An interest or background in AI/ML algorithm development, especially for time-series data. Preferred Qualifications, Competencies, And Experience  Real-time signal processing experience  FPGA and/or embedded programming  Basic knowledge of ADC (Analog to Digital Conversion) methods.  As a plus, some hardware development background (can be at the hobbyist level) including circuit design, PCB layout, electronics troubleshooting, use of standard T&M (Test and Measurement) instruments. Special Physical/Mental Requirements Special Instructions For information on UNC Postdoctoral Benefits and Services  click here Quick Link  https://unc.peopleadmin.com/postings/243077 Posting Contact Information Department Contact Name and Title  Rachel Prasek, HR Consultant Department Contact Telephone or Email  rachelp@unc.edu Postdoctoral Affairs Contact Information If you experience any problems accessing the system or have questions about the application process, please contact the University’s Equal Employment Opportunity office at (919) 966-3576 or send an email to equalopportunity@unc.edu. Please note: The Equal Employment Opportunity office will not be able to provide specific updates regarding position or application status. Equal Opportunity Employer Statement The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, race, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Software Engineer - Data Systems
description:
At Coactive AI, we are empowering data practitioners and data-driven teams to unlock insights in unstructured image and video data. This visual data increasingly captures everyday life from our online experiences on e-commerce sites and social media to guiding the cars we drive and monitoring the plants we eat. This year, unstructured visual data accounts for more than 82% of all internet traffic. This metric is up from 75% in 2017. We make this unstructured visual data useful by bringing it into the world of SQL and the big data tools that teams already love. Coactive was founded by experts who shaped the fields of high-performance deep learning and data-centric AI. We have the scars from building and working with the first generation of modern machine learning systems at Google, Meta (formerly Facebook), Pinterest, eBay, Lyft, and other leading organizations. Through our decades of experience, we have developed a playbook to democratize the toughest parts of machine learning systems; no PhD required. As a software engineer, you will work coactively with the best in ML and data systems, building the foundation for understanding unstructured image and video data. What you'll do: Build production-grade data systems that you'll be proud of Tackle challenging problems at the intersection of machine learning and systems Collaborate with a world-class team of engineers, researchers, and scientists Shape engineering best practices and company culture as we grow What we look for: BS (or higher) in Computer Science or related fields, or equivalent experience.  3+ years of production-level experience in one of: Python, Java, C++, or similar language Experience developing data intensive systems that power critical business processes Experience working on enterprise software or cloud native platforms.  Experience with security and systems that handle sensitive data Equally comfortable working on a white-board, pair programming, or presenting to small groups Good knowledge of SQL What you can expect from us: 100% medical, dental & vision coverage for you Medical, dental & vision partially covered for your dependents 401K Unlimited PTO An allowance to set up workstations however you want A supportive environment. We build products, but we develop people.  Social events ranging from happy hours and hiking to board game nights and games of Mario Kart.  We embrace and celebrate the diversity of our employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Senior Computer Vision Engineer
description:
We are hungry, we are foolish, we are up to revolutionize the built environment! We are backed by incredible and renown investors who strongly support our vision to create a pure A.I. driven solution that structurally assesses spaces. We are born out of MIT where both founders graduated from. We’re technology and analytic savvy folks. We are all self-driven, highly motivated innovators who are all thinking our business forward. We are looking for like-minded people, who are passionate about computer vision, the built environment, and about getting your hands dirty! Job Description : We’re looking for an experienced, detail-oriented individual to join our team and work in a startup environment. This is an opportunity to apply your cross-functional skill sets, creativity, and experience in advanced computer vision and machine learning to solve exciting product development challenges with a multidisciplinary high caliber team. This is a high-visibility position within our fast-growing company and the assumption of increased responsibilities overtime is expected. Example Tasks Design highly scalable, large enterprise software solutions with computer vision Develop, test, and implement creative, efficient solutions for complex perception problems to create digital 3D models and environmental maps of interior spaces Port, implement and optimize analytics and deep learning algorithms using special-purpose computing architectures. Train and retrain AI systems Contribute to expanding our intellectual property portfolio. Perform technical performance benchmarking and analyses to support engineering decisions. Deliver new technology with high levels of performance, reliability, and usability Deep dive on key development and architectural decisions Participate in design reviews. Skills & Experience Masters and/or PhD in Engineering, Technology, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related quantitative field 2+ years of industry or post-doctorate or academic applied research experience in Deep Learning, Computer Vision, or related fields 2+ years experience programming in Python or related programming language 3+ years of experience developing computer vision algorithms for business applications and deep learning models. Ability to work on a diverse team A desire to work with some of our most demanding and discerning customers Nice To Have Experience and/or familiarity with the subjects of 3D modeling/graphics Strong record of patents and innovation or publications in top-tier peer reviewed conferences or journals Benefits We are in to revolutionize the built environment and we are on a pretty good track. You will work in an extremely intellectual environment. Even in a virtual environment, we maintain a team spirit, intellectual curiosity, and fun. We are early and well enough funded to work on the hard things that matter in accomplishing our vision. On top of that, we offer: Equity eligible for this position Employee Stock Purchase Plan Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance, including expert medical opinion Healthcare and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts Flexible paid time off (unlimited or accrued vacation and sick leave) To Apply Please submit a current resume, cover letter, and links to any additional information such as online portfolio, projects, GitHub, LinkedIn, etc. to  apply@hostalabs.com

title: Technology Strategy Consultant
description:
Position Summary In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace. Work you’ll do Deloitte's Strategy and Analytics organization is looking for an analytics minded individual to own the development of our analytics dashboards. The outputs will be used to drive enforcement activity in the cargo and trade domain, specifically targeting misclassification, transshipment, and undervaluation. The practitioner will engage with users, build visualizations, and drive adoption for users across the country. The team Deloitte’s Government and Public Services (GPS) practice – our people, ideas, technology and outcomes—is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The GPS Strategy offering leads strategic planning & portfolio management and reporting & monitoring workstreams. This includes day-to-day client interaction and leads to the creation of relevant resources and materials (such as strategic plans, roadmaps, etc.) and work products (such as development of performance metrics, tracking dashboards, etc.) in order to successfully implement client vision. Required Qualifications  Minimum of an Active Top Secret/SCI Security Clearance Required   Bachelor’s degree required   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future   2+ years of experience with data analytics and tools such as Python, R, SAS, Tableau   2+ years of experience in government technology consulting  Preferred  Strong written and verbal communication skills   Strong organizational skills   Ability to work with both technical and functional resources   The ability to collect and interpret user requirements into tangible visualizations.  How you'll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.  Recruiting tips  From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte recruiters . Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you .  Our people and culture  Our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It enables us to leverage different ideas and perspectives, and bring more creativity and innovation to help solve our client most complex challenges. This makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work. Learn more about our inclusive culture .  Professional development  From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to build new skills, take on leadership opportunities and connect and grow through mentorship. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. As used in this posting, "Deloitte" means Deloitte Consulting LLP, a subsidiary of Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Deloitte will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws. See notices of various ban-the-box laws where available . Requisition code: 101316

title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineering Subject Matter Expert (SME)
description:
