Redhorse specializes in developing and implementing creative strategies and solutions with private, state, and federal customers in the areas of cultural and environmental resources services, climate and energy change, information technology, and intelligence services. We are hiring creative, motivated, and talented people with a passion for doing what's right, what's smart, and what works. Position Description Redhorse Corporation is seeking an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineering Subject Matter Expert (SME) to assist in building enterprise applications of artificial intelligence, managing on-site deployments, execute focused, customer-oriented solutions with dynamic input from disparate user groups. Primary Duties and Responsibilities for this position include: Work on, or lead, a cross-functional team to develop and implement Al algorithms that can help solve novel DoD problems requiring new architectures, legacy networks, and user base unaccustomed to AI/ML tooling Apply modern engineering techniques to develop decision support software prototypes Propose and execute novel, cutting-edge research in Al-enhanced decision systems Evaluate Al solutions in the context of sponsor requirements and produce actionable recommendations Minimum Basic Requirements for Skills, Experience, and Credentials include: US citizen with TS/SCI US government clearance. Applicants who are not US Citizens and who do not have a current and active TS/SCI security clearance will not be considered for this role Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering discipline related to artificial intelligence 8+ years impactful experience in Al-relevant fields, such as machine learning, deep learning, multi-agent systems, planning, and data science Demonstrated ability to articulate Al-specific challenges and identify gaps Interest in rapidly responding to new problems across a variety of domains Excellent communication written and verbal skills to articulate challenging technical concepts to both lay and expert audiences Ability to work independently to learn new technologies, techniques, processes, languages, platforms, and systems Ability to work independently and as a member of cross-functional teams Experience with programming languages such as C++, Python, JS, Java Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering discipline related to artificial intelligence Track record of successful deployment of AI-enhanced decision systems that have been used by key decision makers Executive Order Requirement: While currently on HOLD, Redhorse recognizes that we may need to comply with Executive Order 14042 which requires Federal Contractors to ensure all U.S. new hires be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. title: Tech Support Specialist
description:
EarthCam  is the global leader in providing webcam content, technology and services. Founded in 1996, EarthCam provides live streaming video, time-lapse construction cameras and reality capture solutions for construction, transportation, healthcare, education, tourism, sports and entertainment industries. EarthCam’s patented technology provides the highest resolution imagery available, and has documented over a trillion dollars of construction projects around the world. We are seeking a Technical Support Specialist for first level support. This role is responsible for the day to day operations of our technical support group, with emphasis on customer support and satisfaction. Responsibilities Provide first level support on incoming phone calls Manage daily/weekly reporting as assigned Field incoming help requests from end users via telephone, email and tickets in a courteous manner Record, track and document the requested problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and actions taken, through to the final resolution Deliver service and support to end-users via phone, email or live chat Interact with customers to provide and process information in response to inquiries, concerns, and requests about products and services Gather customer’s information and determine the issue by evaluating and analyzing the symptoms Follow standard processes and procedures Identify and escalate priority issues and redirect tickets to appropriate resource Follow up and make scheduled call backs to customers where necessary Qualifications Minimum 1 year in enterprise support/service delivery; college degree or technical school is a plus Understanding of networking Understanding of Linux a plus Proper phone etiquette Build rapport and elicit problem details from help desk customers Ability to speak and write clearly and accurately Ability to work in a team environment Willingness to co-operate with others and work towards the success of the team Multi-tasking capabilities What We Offer The EarthCam package includes excellent salaries, bonuses, benefits, and constant opportunities for development – designed to create an entrepreneurial, invigorating and satisfying environment. Our benefits include: Health insurance (Single coverage 100% paid for by company) Dental and vision insurance 401K Plan (with aggressive company matching) Paid time off, plus paid holidays Regular free breakfasts, lunches and snacks In-house yoga sessions Bicycles to ride around campus Team BBQs and annual company Olympics EarthCam is the global leader in providing webcam content, technology and services. Founded in 1996, EarthCam provides live streaming video, time-lapse construction cameras, and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) for AI-powered visual asset management. EarthCam leads the industry with the highest resolution imagery available, to empower building information modelling (BIM) and Virtual Design Construction (VDC) teams with actionable visual data. EarthCam's innovations include the world’s first outdoor gigapixel panorama camera system, and the first ever 5G construction camera. EarthCam has documented over a trillion dollars of construction projects around the world. The company is headquartered on a 10-acre campus in Northern New Jersey.

title: Deloitte Consulting - Applied AI Summer Associate
description:
Position Summary Why work at one company when you could work with almost every company to solve the world’s biggest problems? At Deloitte, you can work across industries, technologies, and sectors, with people from every corner of the world. So don't just work in tech, healthcare, finance, or retail. Work everywhere — right here at Deloitte. Passionate about artificial intelligence? Energized by business transformation? Ready to take your academic education to the next level? Join our Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) practice and bridge the theoretical with the practical in our immersive, fast-paced work environment. Applied AI Consultants can leverage their data analytics, technology, and AI skills to advise clients, cut through complexity, and inspire data-driven decisions in a collaborative team setting. Work you’ll do Applied AI Summer Associates Will As an Applied AI Summer Associate, you will have opportunities to make an impact on a broad range of transformative projects for our clients. A designer will apply human-centered design processes as a tool to produce effective communications and solutions throughout client engagements Collaborate with cross-functional teams of product managers, software engineers, data scientists, designers, and subject matter experts to help document requirements. Think critically and develop models for visualization, interaction, sensor, machine and voice or mash ups of new and existing data sources. You can capitalize on our cross-industry presence to find your niche and begin building your individual brand. This person should have strong analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to solve complex problems and communicate findings. The Team The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data science, analytics, robotics, and AI technologies combined with the design thinking methodologies with a deep understanding of the user to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio leads our clients through strategic choices and transformations ahead of disruption by driving competitive advantage through humans with machines. important tools in today’s business world are experience and resources . At Deloitte, you’ll find plenty of both. We believe in equipping our people with some of the best resources available and offering the experience, education, and opportunities you’ll need at various stages of your career to be technologically fluent. As a new Consultant, you will attend a series of onboarding programs to develop foundational knowledge, build essential core consulting skills, and cultivate an in-depth understanding of Deloitte Consulting’s methodologies. Before hitting the ground on your first project, these programs will also offer the opportunity to apply your new knowledge and skills in a simulated environment modeled after real-life client engagements. Beyond the formal training, you will be part of the national Consultant community, which fosters opportunities to add additional dimensions to your experiences through internal initiatives, programs, and events such as skills-based service trips, local office learning events, and internal innovation challenges. title: Data Engineer
description:
Position Summary In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace. Work you’ll do This person will design databases including modeling, diagramming, and creating scripts to create relational database tables, and scripts to help migrate and mitigate data. The data engineer will also contribute to ETL pipelines and data scraping. The team Deloitte’s Government and Public Services (GPS) practice – our people, ideas, technology and outcomes—is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights. title: Senior Applied Machine Learning Scientist
description:
About Virgo Our mission is to improve patient outcomes and clinical workflows in healthcare by developing automation and AI tools for endoscopy. Virgo is the leading cloud video capture, management, and AI analysis platform for endoscopy. Since launching in 2018, we have helped physicians from leading medical centers including The Mayo Clinic, Northwestern University, and Mass General Hospital capture over 300,000 endoscopy videos — the largest dataset of its kind. Now, we are expanding Virgo to create the leading clinical trial platform for diseases involving endoscopy. Our initial focus has been inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), where we are already helping leading trial sponsors increase patient recruitment by over 5x. Since launching, Virgo has helped physicians capture over 400,000 endoscopy procedure videos — the largest dataset of its kind. We are only scratching the surface of what can be achieved with this growing dataset from a machine learning perspective. The Senior Applied Machine Learning Scientist will guide the strategy and development of Virgo's machine learning efforts. Their responsibilities will include: Collaborating with team members from prototyping to production Working with our product and clinical teams to define how ML can solve clinical and workflow challenges associated with endoscopy and clinical trials Establishing needs for data annotation and scalable strategies to meet those needs Completing end-to-end ML projects inclusive of scoping, defining metrics, wrangling our data, feature engineering, model development, deployment, and production performance monitoring Keeping up-to-date on the latest research and developments in machine learning, particularly related to video ML methods, unsupervised learning, and medical imaging Building a high caliber ML team Qualifications: 5+ years of applied ML experience, healthcare experience is a bonus Deep knowledge and expertise in ML and computer vision fundamentals, particularly with methods for video Proficiency with Python, SQL, git, scikit-learn, h.264, ffmpeg, and at least one ML framework (preferably TensorFlow) Ability to communicate ML concepts to a non-technical audience The Sr. Applied ML Scientist will be evaluated on their ability to make significant advancements in Virgo's ML strategy and products. They will also be responsible for creating and executing a strategy to build our ML team for sustained long-term growth. Virgo was a fully distributed team before the pandemic started, and we intend to remain distributed for the foreseeable future. Because of this structure, strong written communication skills, time management skills, and personal accountability are very important to us. Virgo provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Benefits Competitive Salary and Equity Compensation Health Care (Medical, Dental & Vision) Additional Health Benefits (One Medical, Teladoc, Talk Space, Health Advocate) HSA/FSA 401k Life Insurance (Basic & AD&D) Unlimited PTO (suggested minimum 14 days) Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity) Fully Remote New Laptop $500 Work from Home Budget

title: VP, Product Owner - Conversational AI (DT)
description:
By joining Chubb's Digital Transformation team as a VP Product Owner – Conversational AI you will play an instrumental role in developing and implementing the strategy for how we utilize and scale Conversational AI capabilities throughout our business. You’ll ensure that a global approach is used to create, implement, and operationalize strategy leveraging common approaches and technologies with business and technology partners. What could this entail? You’ll serve as the key advocate for current and future POCs and implementations that improve business results. You’ll strategize and plan to operationalize and deliver solutions that include but aren’t limited to chatbots and other AI solutions, all to facilitate enhanced customer experience and outcomes. And you’ll have the opportunity to leverage your expertise in the conversational AI space to evangelize its utilization across the business, build relationships with stakeholders, core IT, business partners and vendors and drive large-scale digital transformation through conversational AI. In This Role, You Will Establish Conversational AI strategy, create a multi-year business plan, and execute strategy Onboard, package and operationalize technology that can be used by the enterprise Partner with enterprise architecture and IT to develop platform strategy that fits the organization Execute successful POCs and pilots to demonstrate technology, platform and strategy fit Partner with Global business stakeholders to develop pipeline of conversational AI opportunities Prioritize, plan, and ensure timely execution of created pipeline Promote adoption of new platform Manage technology and delivery vendors Location & Travel:  This is a globally focused role. With that in mind, we anticipate travel of up to 25%. And while our preference is for you to be based in our Jersey City office, we are open to you working out of our office in New York City as well. Qualifications 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Business Analytics/Insights, or Digital Products 3 + years of leadership experience driving technology or digital strategy 2+ years of experience in Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language processing, Machine learning, Chatbot and virtual assistant  Experience working in an Agile delivery model Experience with driving decision making and developing digital strategy Experience in insurance and financial services industry Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Ability to work and influence decisions in a matrix environment and build effective partnerships Experience in delivering digital and technology solutions Able to participate in multiple assignments with overlapping delivery dates in a fast-paced environment In Jersey City, NJ the pay range for the role is $128,500 to $215,000. The specific offer will depend on an applicant’s skills and other factors. This role may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program. Chubb offers a comprehensive benefits package, more details on which can be found at https://careers.chubb.com/global/en/north-america. This range is specific to Jersey City, NJ and may not be applicable to other locations. About Us Chubb is a global leader in the insurance industry and provides an extensive suite of products to a wide range of clients. Delivering superior coverage, craftsmanship, and customer experience has always been at our core, and will continue to be as we modernize what insurance does and how we deliver it, all while protecting what our customers value most. Major initiatives are underway at Chubb to build on our strengths and expand Chubb’s reach in the digital insurance space. This means data-enriched processes and real-time insights embedded across our value chain, design thinking and an “engineers of everything” mentality, and a world-class customer experience that sets us apart. We are also reimagining our ways of working to be more adaptable and flexible through agile principles and investing in skillset development and tools for a digital age. What We Bring Dynamic Hybrid – flexible work arrangements Competitive offer packages which include a competitive base salary bonus and equity (for applicable roles) Employee stock purchase plan (15% discount) Comprehensive benefits that start day 1 Retirement savings plan (Chubb contributes 9% on your behalf) Investment in education program- Tuition reimbursement program Charitable gift matching programs Mentorship programs to help you grow your career EEO Statement At Chubb, we are committed to equal employment opportunity and compliance with all laws and regulations pertaining to it. title: AI/Computer Vision Engineer & Project Manager
description:
Please Apply Here https://vermeer.homerun.co/ai-computer-vision-engineer-project-manager About The Position My company, getvermeer.com, is building technology for automatic change detection and reconstruction in 3D photogrammetry maps. The ultimate goal is to be able to not only detect if a given part of the environment is different from the last time it was mapped, but also create a navigation plan that allows the drone to take pictures in an optimal position to perform the reconstruction offline in photogrammetry software. Our main customer right now is the DoD. We have won 5 large contracts in our first year working with this customer and we are about to close a large round of investment. We have just raised several million dollars from a VC fund founded by Defense experts who started a billion-dollar DoD company. This has given us a lot of confidence in our business and products. We are looking for someone with prior experience in Deep Learning for 2D and 3D data, Computer Vision, and Image Processing. Practical experience with change detection algorithms is desirable. SLAM/State Estimation experience is a plus. We are a small team, building a very cool product, you will have a lot of room for growth and to make an impact. What You’ll Be Doing In The Position Develop state-of-art systems for solving real computer vision challenges. Conduct applied research to determine the best approaches and techniques to different aspects of the problems faced. Optimize models and algorithms for deploying on embedded devices. Perform verification and validation of the developed algorithms. We have ~6 projects going right now, we are looking for someone not just to be a software developer, but also work on managing this project. Must be a US Citizen - this is a project for the US DoD. Preferred Qualifications At least 4 years experience working with real challenging Computer Vision problems. Preferably with R&D related tasks. Experience working with change detection algorithms in images and/or full motion video. Proficiency in Python and C++ Proficiency on common Deep Learning libraries such as Pytorch and Tensorflow, applied to real projects. Detailed understanding of common Computer Vision and Machine Learning algorithms. Ability to learn fast and include latest academic publications and scientific advances to the problems at hand. Experience with SLAM and or other state-estimations techniques is a plus. Experience with VR/AR is a plus. What You Bring To The Table You have strong empathy for peers, direct reports, and customers You have excellent communication skills and the ability to motivate behavior change You’re adaptable and open to changing processes when it’s right for your team, your organization, and the customers you serve Vermeer is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Vermeer are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without attention to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Vermeer will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Vermeer encourages applicants of all ages.

title: Product Manager
description:
The Vic.ai platform is reshaping how the world does B2B transactions: tracking business data used to be manual, now it's autonomous; reasoning about business data used to be report-oriented and simplistic, now it's real-time and statistically sophisticated. How do we do it? Leading-edge AI, highly-crafted UIs, and deep product thinking tying it all together. We're a Series B funded company, and are fortunate to have some renowned investors and partners: Costanoa Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, GGV Capital, and ICONIQ Capital. We are a remote-first company, with a HQ in Manhattan, New York. Our company is rethinking how B2B transactions and financial intelligence works....a mind-meltingly large market. We're a talented, hard-driving team led by experienced entrepreneurs. If you're an enthusiastic, detail-oriented, curious disruptor, come build with us, you'll fit right in. Role The Product Team understands our customer as well as they understand themselves. We inhabit their problems, reason through impact on our business, pick the right problems to tackle, devise next-gen solutions, drive until they become reality, and measure to learn. The Vic.ai team is small and exceptional, and you'll be plugging in to drive a pillar of our product. So you'll need killer ability to build abstractions for problems, enabling you to turn complexity into structure, thus allowing you to reason through to a solution. And you'll need leadership, marshaling a team (designers + engineers + support + sales) to make that solution real. What You'd Do…. Drive a pillar of our product. That means you inhabit customers' problems, figuring out which problems we should focus on next and why. You'll reason through our business and product strategy.  Make a solution real. Then, you'll use deep product thinking to devise a solution to a problem. Collaborating with designers and engineers, you'll make the solution real. Collaborating with support and sales, you'll make the solution impactful.  Lead from the front. You'll plug into a small and talented team of people, and you'll be expected to lead from the front. That means diving into details, providing testing support, assisting an engineer with debugging, all of it. We learn fast, we build fast, we stay low ego, we keep our eye on results.  You'll report directly to our VP of Product, and serve as a partner as we establish product thinking as a critical function of the business.  If you fit the following, you'll love building with us…. You have 2+ years of Product Management experience.  You've taken at least 1 product from conception to delivery.  You can't get enough of Product Management. You can start your day explaining the logic of a user flow to an engineer, shift to interviewing a customer about a new problem domain, shift to testing a new feature, shift to reviewing analytics for a recently released feature with a designer, shift to setting strategic direction with a Product colleague, shift to….  You're an autodidact, reading blogs, research reports, UX breakdowns….you're always learning, always improving.  What We Offer.... An exciting work environment operating at the forefront of AI technology development Competitive salary and equity 401K, health/vision/wellness perks (including health insurance coverage option 100% free for the employee AND family and perks like ClassPass and CitiBike!) The opportunity to work remotely, including workstation setup Generous maternity and paternity leave Generous vacation time, family- and travel-friendly environment Team building events & awesome swag Team- and employee-focused culture. As a remote-first company, we offer in person retreats to employees multiple times a year. We value gathering to celebrate accomplishments, work together in person, and enjoy team building activities! Check out the fun @vicdotai on Instagram, and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date on our AI tech and new career opportunities.  Acceptance and inclusion for everyone is at the heart of our company. We strive for diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects the entire  Vic.ai  community. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
At Compose AI, we help people type less and live more. Isn't it crazy that people are still typing every word of every letter on 99% of the websites and programs they use every day? That's why we built the best-in-class autocomplete, but we didn't stop there—Compose AI also lets you rewrite your sentences in different tones or styles and can even generate whole paragraphs and other pieces of copy. We are a fast-growing team backed by YCombinator, Craft Ventures, Sequoia, along with founders from Kayak, Hubspot, Vercel, and Honey. Join us in our mission to make AI an extension of the human. Job Description As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Compose AI, you will own projects from 0 to 1 as we continue to launch new products and features. This is not the typical ML engineer role. We are working on core innovations to the way people use their computers on a day-to-day basis. Reinventing the way people interact with text can be subtle and precise, and there are often no instruction manuals for how to do so. You will be creating unique NLP / ML models that push what is currently possible. For example, working on creating a personalized model for every customer in a cost-effective way. Doing personal question answering. Fulfilling users’ requests before they even ask. Neural search, etc. Requirements 5+ years experience with ML Experience with NLP (Natural Language Processing) Strong communication and documentation skills Excited about rolling your sleeves up on solving difficult engineering problems TensorFlow, Torch Mathematical background Ability to productionize models Ideal Candidates Experience working at an early-stage startup (< 25 employees)

title: Deloitte Consulting - Applied AI Consultant
description:
Position Summary Why work at one company when you could work with almost every company to solve the world’s biggest problems? At Deloitte, you can work across industries, technologies, and sectors, with people from every corner of the world. So don't just work in tech, healthcare, finance, or retail. Work everywhere — right here at Deloitte. Passionate about artificial intelligence? Energized by business transformation? Ready to take your academic education to the next level? Join our Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) practice and bridge the theoretical with the practical in our immersive, fast-paced work environment. Applied AI Consultants can leverage their data analytics, technology, and AI skills to advise clients, cut through complexity, and inspire data-driven decisions in a collaborative team setting. Work you’ll do Applied AI Consultants Will As an Applied AI Consultant, you will have opportunities to make an impact on a broad range of transformative projects for our clients. A designer will use human-centered design approach to develop artifacts that communicate processes, strategies and solutions throughout client engagements Collaborate with cross-functional teams of product managers, software engineers, data scientists, designers, and subject matter experts to lead and document requirements. Strategize, architect, position, design, develop and deploy enterprise solutions which include Artificial Intelligence components to produce effective communications throughout client engagements such as Chatbots, Virtual Assistants, Machine Learning, and AI Services (e.g. Vision/Image, Textual/Language processing). Think critically and develop models for video, voice, weblog, sensor, machine and social media data sources or mash ups of new and existing data sources. Guide junior resources and review the quality of their deliverables in addition to coordinating with the senior members to set the right client expectations. You can capitalize on our cross-industry presence to find your niche and begin building your individual brand. This person should have strong analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to solve complex problems and communicate findings. The Team The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data science, analytics, robotics, and AI technologies combined with the design thinking methodologies with a deep understanding of the user to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. title: AI/ML Tech Lead

**This position is Hybrid in NY** AI/ML Tech Lead, NY Department Overview: The Chief Data Office (CDO) is seeking a Tech Lead focused on delivery of next generation data solutions, specifically around the automation and modernization of overall content sourcing, extraction, storing and delivery using AI models & techniques. The candidate must have a proven track record in AI/ML and expertise in developing cutting edge solutions.  This role is part of the Emerging Tech Group. This is a formative opportunity to influence and innovate as part of the new CDO function. In this role, the Tech Lead will work as part of the squad focusing on delivering cutting edge AI/ML based sourcing and extraction application.  The ideal candidate will have a solid background and understanding of present-day AI/ML capabilities, has developed and deployed various AI/ML based models with significant business impact. Familiarity with credit rating agency operations and the credit ratings business model is a strong plus, or more generally, experience in financial services is desirable.  Specific Emerging Technology team objectives are: Lead AI/ML/Automation technology and vendor relationships AI/ML/Automation technology implementation at the enterprise level (in partnership with business and product owners) Enterprise data science products, processes, and solutions (predictive models, model governance and quality) Lead and support other enterprise-level initiatives Role Description:  Develop and support various modeling activities as part of the content sourcing, extraction initiative; provide guidance and best practices to other modeling teams Provide thought leadership and strategic direction to Data Scientists and ML Engineers for the initiative Develop enterprise-level modeling capability for AI/ML based models as part of the content sourcing, extraction initiative Translate business objectives into staged technical plan Anticipate technical obstacles and plan accordingly Skills & Experience: 10+ years of experience in a comparable quantitative modeling or analytics role working as a senior tech lead/data scientist, ideally in the financial sector Demonstrated experience in applying statistical and machine learning techniques in the financial industry Thorough understanding of architecture and system design Expertise with the credit ratings business and the workflow of a credit ratings analyst  Hands-on experience as a senior data scientist or data engineer  Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills for interacting and collaborating with other leaders and associates throughout the organization  Master’s degree, or equivalent in Data Science, Machine Learning, or Data Engineering  Familiarity of various tools like AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MongoDB, Redis/Memcached Knowledge of applications of AI/ML within the Financial Services sector, particularly Credit analysis and markets

title: Data Engineer
description:
In addition to the responsibilities listed below, this senior individual contributor position is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on digital data and placing gained insights within the context of other transactional, member, and market data; guiding and collaborating on the implementation of requirements with developers and/or database teams to ensure accurate data collection; developing learning agendas and measurement plans based on Objectives & Key Results and KPIs; and validating, transforming, and visualizing the business value of digital data through effective communication of insights to key decision makers across functional areas.  This position is also responsible creating and publishing reports focused on digital data insights, utilization, and trends; performing analyses using both basic (e.g., regression, time series, etc.) and advanced statistical methods (e.g., random forest, decision trees, propensity score matching), using business-centric tools (e.g., Excel, SAS, etc.), and the latest programing and software packages (e.g., Python, R, TensorFlow, etc.) to address business questions, issues, and opportunities; consulting on digital data and metrics with regional and business stakeholders; creating and managing digital activity datasets and reporting databases; and supporting A/B and multivariate test plan initiatives.   Essential Responsibilities:     Completes work assignments and supports business-specific projects by applying expertise in subject area; supporting the development of work plans to meet business priorities and deadlines; ensuring team follows all procedures and policies; coordinating and assigning resources to accomplish priorities and deadlines; collaborating cross-functionally to make effective business decisions; solving complex problems; escalating high priority issues or risks, as appropriate; and recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities.   Practices self-development and promotes learning in others by proactively providing information, resources, advice, and expertise with coworkers and customers; building relationships with cross-functional stakeholders; influencing others through technical explanations and examples; adapting to competing demands and new responsibilities; listening and responding to, seeking, and addressing performance feedback; providing feedback to others and managers; creating and executing plans to capitalize on strengths and develop weaknesses; supporting team collaboration; and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback.   Develops requirements for complex process or system solutions within assigned business domain(s) by interfacing stakeholders and appropriate IT teams (for example, Solutions Delivery, Infrastructure, Enterprise Architecture) and leading junior team members in the development process as appropriate.   Leverages multiple business requirements gathering methodologies to identify business, functional, and non-functional requirements (for example, SMART) across multiple business domains.   Develops and documents comprehensive business cases to assess the costs, benefits, ROI, and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) of proposed solutions.   Provides insight and supports the evolution of applications, systems, and/or processes to a desired future state by maintaining a comprehensive understanding of how current processes impact business operations across multiple domains.   Maps current state against future state processes.   Identifies the impact of requirements on upstream and downstream solution components.   Provides recommendations to management and business stakeholders on how to integrate requirements with current systems and business processes across regions or domains.   Identifies and validates value gaps and opportunities for process enhancements or efficiencies.   Supports solution design by providing insight at design sessions with IT teams to help translate requirements into workable business solutions.   Identifies and recommends additional data and/or services needed to address key business issues related to process or solutions design.   Participates in evaluating third-party vendors as directed.   Supports continuous process improvement by participating in the development, implementation, and maintenance of standardized tools, templates, and processes across multiple business domains.   Recommends regional and/or national process improvements which align with sustainable best practices, and the strategic and tactical goals of the business.   Qualifications:   Basic Qualifications:   Experience:     Minimum two (2) years data analysis, survey research, and/or applied research experience.   Minimum one (1) year digital data analytics experience.   Education:     Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, CIS or related field and Minimum six (6) years experience in IT consulting, business analysis, or a related field. Additional equivalent work experience may be substituted for the degree requirement.   License, Registration and Certification:     N/A     Additional Requirements:     N/A   Preferred Qualifications:     One (1) year artificial intelligence or machine learning experience.   One (1) year experience with statistical software programs (e.g. Python, R, STATA)   Three (3) years experience working for a health care organization   Three (3) years experience working for an IT organization   Two (2) years experience working on projects or programs requiring the integration of cross-functional technology and/or business solutions.   Two (2) years experience in workflow analysis, including the use of modeling software (e.g., Visio).   Two (2) years in a leadership role working with project or technical teams.   Two (2) years experience in business case development and analysis   Two (2) years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director level and above)   Four (4) years consulting experience in hospital operations.   Four (4) years consulting experience in clinical administration.   Four (4) years consulting experience in health plan administration.   Masters degree in Economics, Applied Mathematics, or Statistics.   Masters degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, CIS or related field   Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) or other comparable business analyst or IT consulting certification   Employee Status: Regular  Travel: No  Job Level: Individual Contributor  Job Type: Standard

title: Associate Engineer, Artificial Intelligence
description:
Analog Devices (ADI) has just over $9 billion in revenue with offices around the world. As a global leader in the design and manufacturing of analog, mixed signal, power management and DSP integrated circuits, ADI is known for helping to solve its customers’ toughest engineering challenges. With a commitment to engineering for good, ADI strives to create a more sustainable future, while also focusing on its employees through mentoring programs, employee networks and continuous learning opportunities. At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. You will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible. Job Description Summary Analog Devices is committed to investing in our people and their growth. One way we can do this is by establishing a cutting-edge Entry Level Hiring program. This program features high impact professional development, opportunities to drive meaningful projects that are directly tied to business goals, and unique executive exposure. Our duty is to develop the next generation of talent in our communities and provide them with a pathway to apply their academic skills in the real-world. At ADI, our early career hires will learn from the brightest minds who are dedicated to their growth, development, and success. From an industry perspective, incoming new career hires are surrounded by employees that represent the best of the best minds in their respective fields. Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible! ADI has released the absolute lowest power AI processing engines to the market, allowing machine vision to happen nearly instantly and with almost no energy consumer. We are seeking a motivated machine learning engineer to provide support for these products,building reference designs and supporting customers as they move from evaluation to production. Job Description Responsibilities include, but not limited to:  Build, test, document, and release example AI models for ADI hardware Support customers as they develop AI solutions on our processors Develop documentation and tools to make development on our AI solutions simpler Research and participate in "tiny ML" areas, applying academic learnings to our products Minimum Qualifications BS or equivalent in Computer Science with Machine Learning experience Multiple machine learning projects, particularly in machine vision and with CNNs or other deep learning models Education Work Experience: Non - Manager Pay Rate Type Salary Eligible for Relocation:  Yes Eligible For Work Visa Sponsorship Yes This position may require a deemed export control license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations; including but not limited to US Government International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), US Export Administration Regulations (EAR), or US Treasury Regulations. If required, placement is contingent on Maxim’s ability to apply for and obtain an export control license on your behalf. ADI is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious creed), sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veterans, and/or military status and any other categories protected by applicable law.

title: Content Management Associate - Remote
description:
Pager delivers a "doctor in your family" healthcare experience by making it simple for consumers to connect with the trusted experts they need to make the right healthcare decisions. Through AI-enabled technology, Pager brings consumers, nurses, doctors and other members of the care team together through secure chat, voice and video chat, all in one place. We partner with healthcare organizations to deliver seamless, tech-enabled services and solutions for a consumer experience that leads to better decisions, outcomes and healthier lives. Started in 2014 and based in New York City, Pager is led by seasoned technology and healthcare entrepreneurs to redefine the way that consumers interact with their healthcare. The Content Management Associate is responsible for creating and maintaining internal and client process and policy documentation. This position will require collaboration, project management and superb organizational skills. This individual will work with stakeholders across the company to ensure all content is updated quickly and to address any identified gaps or changes for accuracy and understanding. RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversee all content creation and maintenance of intranet spaces Update internal training documentation as processes and resources change, including job aids, policies and resource material Project manage all updates to client policies on a quarterly basis and support Beeper's URAC accreditation process Partner with subject matter experts and stakeholders in order to build, maintain and improve upon internal processes Research and apply best practices to ensure the structural organization of Confluence is easy to access and intuitive.  Gather feedback and develop content improvement strategies to streamline work processes and ensure all stakeholders are aware of content changes.  Oversee special projects related to content management Work collaboratively with Trainers in ensure policy and process material is in alignment with training material Step in to support training efforts, including creating and leading training initiatives on an as needed basis REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in related field (Writing, Communications, Journalism, etc) 2-3 years of professional editing/writing experience, including policy and process documentation  Extremely organized and methodical approach to handling content Able to bring structure to content gaps and uncertainty  Able to communicate complex topics effectively, in simple and easy-to-understand language through quality content Passionately detail-oriented, with a keen eye for accuracy  Excellent grammar and spelling, able to write at a college level Self-starter and able to work independently, even in frequently-changing situations Quick learner and able to efficiently balance competing priorities well in a fast-paced work environment Skilled in cross-team communication and collaboration PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: Experience in using an intranet and/or content management systems Experience in start-ups and healthcare operations Experience in conducting audits  Experience in training delivery and building training material  Experience in video and audio editing Fluency in Spanish is a plus At Pager, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Quality Specialist
description:
Standard AI has transformed retail as we know it. With the first autonomous retail solution that works in any existing store, we enable customers to walk in, grab what they need, and walk out - without waiting in line or stopping to pay. The company's computer vision solution is the only one that can be quickly and easily installed in retailers' existing stores, representing a giant leap forward for retail tech that enables retailers to rapidly deliver amazing new shopping experiences to customers. Standard has launched dozens of stores alongside Circle K, Compass Group, and others and have hundreds more on the way. We're the most well funded in our space, backed by some of Silicon Valley's leading investors including SoftBank, CRV, Initialized, EQT, Draper Associates, and Y Combinator. We are looking for a Data Quality Specialist, specializing in documentation. This role will help the Data Quality Program Manager with ensuring that external data annotation vendors have all the training materials and documentation they need to ensure to deliver high quality annotations to our machine learning teams on time. This role will also collaborate with our machine learning teams to document QA workflows and common error checks used to evaluate annotations returned by external vendors. What you'll do here: Collaborate with stakeholders to find scope & requirements for their projects Work inter departmentally & internationally to produce and maintain documentation on how to annotate various projects for annotators Help ensure machine learning datasets are delivered on time by proactively solving potential roadblocks Evaluate and improve workflows through data-driven evidence Act as an editor to ensure consistency across training documentation and improving internal documentation Identify error trends and provide feedback on annotation quality to external vendors Become proficient and an expert in Standard's internal tooling stack Who you are: Core computer skills (Google Docs, Slides and Sheets, Gmail, Slack, Confluence, Jira, etc.) Ability to take a complex system and explain it clearly to a non technical audience Strong written and verbal communication skills and experience working with content in multiple mediums.  A self-starter who thrives in an autonomous and remote work environment.  Comfortable making judgment calls for edge cases while writing Able to work irregular hours to have weekly meetings with key stakeholders Why you might want to work with us: We take care of you and your family with health, vision, and dental insurance You will have the option to contribute to a 401k.  You're excited to work on a product that will impact almost any consumer, almost anywhere.  Standard is a remote-first company. We trust you to get your job done in the location that works best for you.  We dress casually. Some of us wear slippers in the office. In current work-from-home standings, we're super comfy.  We believe in a culture of learning, and want to keep building our skills, experiences, and capabilities.  We offer flexible work schedules. We trust our team to know how they will do their best work.  We're family-friendly. We want our teammates to focus on what they need to do when they need to do it.  We offer very competitive compensation, including equity in Standard, to every one of our employees.  Standard provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

title: AI/ML - Machine Learning Engineer - ML Systems Evaluation Engineering
description:
Summary   Would you like to play a part in building the groundbreaking platform, frameworks and metrics that ensure the ML Model quality from a plethora of products at Apple? Drive the quality of the User Experience, accuracy of ML models, and work with the people who build the machine learning systems that help millions of people get things done. Join the very high impact and rapidly growing Machine Learning and Systems Evaluation Engineering team at Apple! We are looking for engineers with a passion for using machine learning to create intelligent applications. Be part of a highly accomplished, deeply technical and close-knit team working closely with machine learning systems, you will create tools that are used by millions of people. You will design and implement new algorithms and techniques for working with machine learning models, and collaborate with the most innovative product development teams in the world. This team builds the replay, simulation and evaluation platform that enables product teams across Apple to develop machine-learning solutions that power amazingly intelligent user experiences. In this role, you will build the tools, infrastructure and enable hill climbing on ML Models running on client / edge devices. This role requires prior experience on developing native frameworks and some familiarity with ML. You will also have the opportunity to engage with exciting new-product teams around Apple, and use your skills to solve challenging technical problems in our next generation products that will delight millions of people.   Key Qualifications   5+ years of professional work experience in software development. Strong programming and software engineering skills. Experience building native frameworks on iOS (preferred) or Android. Experience working with ML pipelines and products. Experience in Python. Strong organizational skills and experience working with multiple stakeholders. Ability to develop long term vision and execute strategies at scale. PREFERRED: Knowledge of statistics based testing approaches, ML training pipelines and accuracy improvements of ML systems. Experience on using ML inference on edge devices. Experience in fast-paced, agile work environments. Prior Experience with Objective C and/or Swift.   Description   You will research and develop innovative ML strategies for challenging problems that will affect Siri in future Apple products. You’ll look at the user interactions we want to achieve, propose algorithmic solutions, choose the right datasets and design the optimization metrics for your innovations. You’ll bring these innovations to life by working alongside your software development partners to take them all the way to production. You are self-motivated, excellent problem solver, a go-getter. You are quick to build relationships and work well with change and ambiguity. You have strong programming skills with tried experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering advanced algorithmic solutions.   Education & Experience   BS/MS in Computer Science or related field   Role Number: 200359433

title: NMR/MRS Scientist
description:
THIS JOB IS AVAILABLE IN THE USA AND EUROPE. IDEALLY THE CANDIDATE WOULD BE BASED AROUND LOS ANGELES, CA USA OR ABLE TO VISIT PERIODICALLY. ACCESS TO NMR LABS NEARBY THE CANDIDATES BASE WILL BE NECESSARY. Hybrid / remote work arrangements are welcomed. Do you want to be on the team that changes how we all track our health and gives everyone the power to know how they are doing? Our healthcare start-up is seeking a scientist with deep NMR (Nuclear Magnetic Resonance) and Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (MRS) experience to lead and shape the research and development program. You would be helping to define and create our consumer-facing health scanner. You would be guiding other team members on NMR & MRS techniques, innovations, machine requirements and measurement realities. You would also conduct independent research on metabolomic measurements for future use-cases and applications. Your knowledge of all things MR & spectroscopy will help the team understand the technical, scientific and practical considerations to navigate in realizing our products. About you: You would have: A PhD or equivalent in a field closely related to NMR & MRS applications; A strong familiarity with and ideally expertise in NMR hardware Experience with bio-fluids, bio-samples and related biological or clinical measurements using NMR;  Familiarity with metabolomics and metabolite measurements  Experience working with diverse technical teams.  If that sounds like you, then you are a rare talent, and we want to hear from you. We will consider a range of flexible work arrangements as long as the mission of the job and the company are fulfilled. About us: At ViBo Health, our goal is to transform personalized medicine by providing dynamic and actionable information based on direct and relevant metabolomic measurements. We will do this through our innovative health scanner and AI-driven software. Our scanner will be a table-top device intended for high-traffic locations such as pharmacies, gyms, university campuses, airports, workplaces, etc. The customer will put a hand into the device which reads spectra from multiple locations along the wrist, and results will be returned on our health dashboard app. Responsibilities: You will be responsible for: Leading NMR & MRS-related measurements and experiments Managing collaborations on metabolomic measurements Training and mentoring teammates on aspects of MR science and technology Working collaboratively to define technical requirements of the product Company Profile We are a motivated, experienced and international team of top performers Our offices are located on the UCLA Campus in Los Angeles, CA, USA and at the IPN in Coimbra, Portugal We believe in developing products and solutions that transform healthcare and benefit the largest number of people possible We believe in compensating team members fairly and having them grow and benefit along with the value growth of the company Read more at www.vibo.health  At ViBo Health we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. ViBo Health believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.  Requirements Qualifications: Has a PhD in engineer, biological or physical sciences with a focus on Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR), or equivalent work experience Has a strong algorithms and data analysis background Enjoys working as part of a team Ideally has experience with medical devices Benefits Hybrid, remote and other work arrangements will be considered in location throughout the US and Europe.

title: Strategy and Operations Lead (AI-Enabled Ophthalmology Diagnostic Solution)
description:
About Aegis Ventures Aegis Ventures is a next-generation startup studio that partners with entrepreneurs and industry leaders to originate, launch, and scale transformative companies. The Aegis platform brings together market-shaping ideas, permanent growth capital, and ambitious individuals who are driven to solve major societal problems. We aim to build companies with the capacity for vast impact, with an initial focus on two key areas: artificial intelligence and virtual care. Within these verticals, Aegis seeks to create companies that use technology to transform healthcare quality, access and cost, focusing on innovations that promote seamless continuity of care, patient empowerment, and better-informed clinical decision-making. About The Role Aegis Ventures and Northwell Health have recently partnered to create healthcare AI and virtual care companies. To date, our partnership has assembled a team of exceptional cross-functional leaders including expert clinicians, data scientists, technologists, commercial experts, and investors who have ideated and prototyped solutions that form the basis for exciting new health tech ventures. As we further expand, we are looking for a high-performing Strategy and Operations Lead (S&OL) to join one of our confidential portfolio companies focused on AI-enabled diagnostic solutions that use the eye as a window to healthcare. As our portfolio companies refine business planning and pursue strategic growth, the S&OL will accelerate the company’s progress through these stages. This individual will be the dedicated quarterback overseeing key aspects of the company’s early-stage milestones, including refining our solutions to identify product-market fit, working with key project stakeholders to validate and operationalize business plans, onboarding senior management, and managing strategic projects. This role is an ideal growth opportunity for those who are galvanized by the prospect of taking novel, industry-shaping initiatives from early stage to scale and who aspire to develop a highly differentiated skillset around taking emerging businesses to the next level. Responsibilities Lead daily project management to ensure working teams (e.g., commercial, technical, product, legal, branding, marketing) achieve their milestones Partner with stakeholders to refine the technical solution to achieve product-market fit and operationalize the company’s business plan Partner with Aegis studio talent leadership to support onboarding of the global management team for the company Coordinate across different workstreams to ensure the timely launch of the company Build iterative hypotheses through gathering and analyzing information from a wide variety of sources and use findings to synthesize actionable insights Develop and present cohesive, well-structured, presentations and memoranda that synthesize qualitative and quantitative findings Partner with key Northwell clinical and non-clinical stakeholders to advance company milestones Own relationships with key external stakeholders including vendors and others partners to advance the venture creation process Candidate profile 5+ years of experience, with leadership in early-stage startups and/or healthcare innovation preferred (e.g., strategy and operations, consulting, investing) Experience working in medtech and regulated medical devices preferred but not required Experience working with large healthcare provider settings including but not limited to acute care, ambulatory care clinics, and primary care clinics Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s in related field equivalent to experience Understanding of the US healthcare system, trends, and business preferred Foundational experiences in analytical and conceptual complexity with a track record of developing frameworks for tackling new and unfamiliar research areas Strong written and verbal communicator with the ability to synthesize information to guide-decision making An active listener and humble team player seeking to continuously learn and grow from those around them What you'll gain Highly competitive compensation package, including a strong base salary, performance-based bonus, and the chance to earn upside Top-tier health, vision, dental, and commuter benefits Generous monthly health and wellness reimbursement Unparalleled exposure to new business building at the intersection of artificial intelligence and healthcare The opportunity to help solve the industry’s most difficult and pressing problems, collaborating with world-class experts from healthcare academia and industry The chance to work with a highly talented, close-knit, team of world-leading mentors across clinical, technical, product, commercial, and investment backgrounds, who can act as a support network and sounding board throughout your entrepreneurial journey Could this be you? If you are a high-energy, strategy thinker, with an entrepreneurial disposition and a willingness to leave no stone unturned we would like to hear from you. This role will be based in New York City.

title: Partner Manager
description:
About Us Description Innovation is fuelled by the power of possibilities. Till recently, it was virtually impossible to innovate because building software needed tech know-how. It was simply too expensive, too complex and too risky. That’s why 78% of all software projects failed. We’re flipping software development on its head and kicking out the notion that you need to be an expert or participate in boot camps to learn how to build your own app. Builder.ai’s platform lets you order your software app for the problem you’re trying to solve. Our AI-powered assembly line brings together Lego-like reusable features and experts from around the world to bring world-class ideas to life. Our human-assisted AI platform helps anyone build, run & scale tailor-made software. Everyone from the bakery in Riyadh and nursery in London, to large fortune 100 companies like the BBC or Pepsi. Life at Builder It’s a place where everything moves at lightning speed and it’s certainly not for the faint of heart. We celebrate diversity and push everyone to do more with less, while creating and championing a culture that empowers everyone to experiment, push boundaries and learn by doing. Every Builder runs to our core value system of HEARTT (Heart, Entrepreneurship, Accountability, Respect, Trust & Transparency) and we’re always looking for team players with a point of view, a sense of humility and a let’s-get-stuff-done attitude. Our scale-up is at the intersection of a quirky startup where designers and machine learning specialists work on problems together and savvy commercial teams working with finance folks to invent new business models. #WhatWillYouBuild The Opportunity We are on the lookout for an exceptional Partner Manager to join the North American partnerships team. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining a portfolio of channel partners and to drive the efforts toward partner retention and growth. The role requires to work collaboratively across multiple stakeholder groups, including sales, marketing and growth teams. You will use your current experience to drive partner development, referrals, pipeline and seek new opportunities within an account. We are seeking a candidate who demonstrates a growth mindset, a data-informed approach, strong collaboration skills, and a steadfast drive to deliver results. The role will be hands-on; with an agile and lean team, there will be lots of execution, lots of learning and a lot of room for growth. This role will work directly with the head of partnerships in the US as a part of the US revenue team. Key Responsibilities - Maintain relationships with existing partners to ensure no news goes unshared and no opportunities go unexplored Identify and assess new partnership opportunities for growth and maintain a robust pipeline of potential opportunities. Coordinate joint GTM efforts with relevant internal stakeholders including within sales, marketing and growth teams Become the expert on Builder Studio Pro to present the platform to existing and potential partners on how the solution can help to drive revenues, improve efficiencies Represent Builder.ai at relevant events and conferences to drive potential partner engagements Support the Head of Partnerships in the creation and execution of the partnership strategy and pipeline targets. Requirements You’re interested in this role because you: Enjoy building and nurturing trusting relationships and have demonstrated doing that with relevant stakeholders in partner organizations. Like to think outside the box when it comes to problem solving and find ways to make our partners successful. Have a curious mind, and are eager to learn about all parts of the organization. Are a team player, and passionate to work and learn from others as well as generate results.  Communicate effectively and have a high attention to detail. Thrive in situations where you own relationships and initiatives fully, paying mind to internal and external stakeholders. What We’re Looking For 4+ years of experience, with at least 2 years of experience as a Partner Manager or Relationship Manager at a B2B software company, managing a portfolio of partners. Experience creating and owning creative marketing initiatives with external organizations.  Familiarity with B2B software sales cycle, and how to use partners to nurture leads, progress opportunities, and accelerate closing. Experience meeting and exceeding revenue and growth goals. Familiarity with CRM, PRM, marketing, and account mapping tools.  Benefits Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, vision and 401k plans Performance-based bonuses and stock options Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays Generally flexible working hours A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

title: Director of Product, Fintech
description:
The Vic.ai platform is reshaping how the world does B2B transactions: tracking business data used to be manual, now it's autonomous; reasoning about business data used to be report-oriented and simplistic, now it's real-time and statistically sophisticated. How do we do it? Leading-edge AI, highly-crafted UIs, and deep product thinking tying it all together. We're a Series B funded company, and are fortunate to have some renowned investors and partners: Costanoa Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, GGV Capital, and ICONIQ Capital. We are a remote-first company: our people occupy all 4 US timezones, and 2 EU timezones. We have an office in Manhattan, New York. Our company is rethinking how B2B transactions and financial intelligence works....a mind-meltingly large market. We're a talented, hard-driving team led by experienced entrepreneurs. If you're an enthusiastic, detail-oriented, curious disruptor, come build with us, you'll fit right in. Role The Product Team understands our customer as well as they understand themselves. We inhabit their problems, reason through impact on our business, pick the right problems to tackle, devise next-gen solutions, drive until they become reality, and measure to learn. The Vic.ai team is small and exceptional, and you'll be plugging in at the Director level to build and own the fintech solution in the Vic.ai product. Because you'll be leading our build of a payments solution, you'll need deep know-how in building fintech payments. And you'll need leadership, marshaling a team (designers + engineers + support + sales) to make that solution real. What You'd Do…. Build payments in the Vic.ai product. You'll inhabit customers' payments problems. And help reason through our fintech business and product strategy.  Make the payments solution real. Collaborating with designers and engineers, support, and sales, you'll make the payments solution impactful.  Own building the next generation of finance tools: from corporate cards and expense management, to bill payments and accounting integrations.  Lead from the front. You'll plug into a small and talented team of people, and you'll be expected to lead from the front. That means diving into details, helping a designer ideate UX, providing testing support on a new feature, all of it. We learn fast, we build fast, we stay low ego, we keep our eye on results.  You'll report directly to our VP of Product, and serve as a partner as we establish product thinking as a critical function of the business.  If you fit the following, you'll love building with us…. You have 5+ years of Product Management experience, spent building fintech payments solutions. This is a hard requirement. Our team needs someone who's built payments products before, and loves building payments products.  You can't get enough of Product Management. You can start your day explaining the logic of a user flow to an engineer, shift to interviewing a customer about a new problem domain, shift to testing a new feature, shift to reviewing analytics for a recently released feature with a designer, shift to setting strategic direction with a Product colleague, shift to….  You're a self-learner, reading blogs, research reports, UX breakdowns….you're always learning, always improving.  What We Offer.... An exciting work environment operating at the forefront of AI technology development Competitive salary and equity 401K, health/vision/wellness perks (including health insurance coverage option 100% free for the employee AND family and perks like ClassPass and CitiBike!) The opportunity to work remotely, including workstation setup Generous maternity and paternity leave Generous vacation time, family- and travel-friendly environment Team building events & awesome swag Team- and employee-focused culture. As a remote-first company, we offer in person retreats to employees multiple times a year. We value gathering to celebrate accomplishments, work together in person, and enjoy team building activities! Check out the fun @vicdotai on Instagram, and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date on our AI tech and new career opportunities.  Acceptance and inclusion for everyone is at the heart of our company. We strive for diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects the entire Vic.ai community. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Partner Manager
description:
About Us Description Innovation is fuelled by the power of possibilities. Till recently, it was virtually impossible to innovate because building software needed tech know-how. It was simply too expensive, too complex and too risky. That’s why 78% of all software projects failed. We’re flipping software development on its head and kicking out the notion that you need to be an expert or participate in boot camps to learn how to build your own app. Builder.ai’s platform lets you order your software app for the problem you’re trying to solve. Our AI-powered assembly line brings together Lego-like reusable features and experts from around the world to bring world-class ideas to life. Our human-assisted AI platform helps anyone build, run & scale tailor-made software. Everyone from the bakery in Riyadh and nursery in London, to large fortune 100 companies like the BBC or Pepsi. Life at Builder It’s a place where everything moves at lightning speed and it’s certainly not for the faint of heart. We celebrate diversity and push everyone to do more with less, while creating and championing a culture that empowers everyone to experiment, push boundaries and learn by doing. Every Builder runs to our core value system of HEARTT (Heart, Entrepreneurship, Accountability, Respect, Trust & Transparency) and we’re always looking for team players with a point of view, a sense of humility and a let’s-get-stuff-done attitude. Our scale-up is at the intersection of a quirky startup where designers and machine learning specialists work on problems together and savvy commercial teams working with finance folks to invent new business models. #WhatWillYouBuild The Opportunity We are on the lookout for an exceptional Partner Manager to join the North American partnerships team. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining a portfolio of channel partners and to drive the efforts toward partner retention and growth. The role requires to work collaboratively across multiple stakeholder groups, including sales, marketing and growth teams. You will use your current experience to drive partner development, referrals, pipeline and seek new opportunities within an account. We are seeking a candidate who demonstrates a growth mindset, a data-informed approach, strong collaboration skills, and a steadfast drive to deliver results. The role will be hands-on; with an agile and lean team, there will be lots of execution, lots of learning and a lot of room for growth. This role will work directly with the head of partnerships in the US as a part of the US revenue team. Key Responsibilities - Maintain relationships with existing partners to ensure no news goes unshared and no opportunities go unexplored Identify and assess new partnership opportunities for growth and maintain a robust pipeline of potential opportunities. Coordinate joint GTM efforts with relevant internal stakeholders including within sales, marketing and growth teams Become the expert on Builder Studio Pro to present the platform to existing and potential partners on how the solution can help to drive revenues, improve efficiencies Represent Builder.ai at relevant events and conferences to drive potential partner engagements Support the Head of Partnerships in the creation and execution of the partnership strategy and pipeline targets. Requirements You’re interested in this role because you: Enjoy building and nurturing trusting relationships and have demonstrated doing that with relevant stakeholders in partner organizations. Like to think outside the box when it comes to problem solving and find ways to make our partners successful. Have a curious mind, and are eager to learn about all parts of the organization. Are a team player, and passionate to work and learn from others as well as generate results.  Communicate effectively and have a high attention to detail. Thrive in situations where you own relationships and initiatives fully, paying mind to internal and external stakeholders. What We’re Looking For 4+ years of experience, with at least 2 years of experience as a Partner Manager or Relationship Manager at a B2B software company, managing a portfolio of partners. Experience creating and owning creative marketing initiatives with external organizations.  Familiarity with B2B software sales cycle, and how to use partners to nurture leads, progress opportunities, and accelerate closing. Experience meeting and exceeding revenue and growth goals. Familiarity with CRM, PRM, marketing, and account mapping tools.  Benefits Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, vision and 401k plans Performance-based bonuses and stock options Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays Generally flexible working hours A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place
