title: Founding Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About Us We dream about the perfect data world, and we are on a quest to make it a reality. Problem Batch and streaming data issues cost a company on an average of $15M (Gartner), and data in companies is increasing 60% - 100% every month! (IDG) The pain that companies are experiencing due to data quality, performance and governance issues is only going to get worse from here. Product Altimate AI is bringing in the shift-left paradigm to identify data issues earlier in the data lifecycle - at data sources, in Git - CI/CD, and in analytics / ML workflows. It uses cutting-edge AI/ML to understand the semantic meaning of data and leverages data contracts that cover data quality, performance, and governance. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to build a generational company in a huge multi-billion dollar market. Team We are silicon valley veterans who previously have created category-defining data and AI products that are loved by thousands of companies worldwide. We have experienced the journey of a small startup to IPO very closely. We have started on a similar journey again and are backed by some of prominent advisors and VC firms with multi-billion dollar portfolios. Why you should join Altimate AI Impact Influence the product roadmap and architecture decisions. Be the driver for building the engineering culture Take ownership of the systems that you build. De-Risked 3+ years of runway in the bank Backed by prominent investors in the enterprise space Active engagements with top-tier private and public companies Learnings Work closely with experienced founders and learn to build a startup from the ground up Active involvement with most of facets of the company gives an opportunity to improve skills beyond just engineering About The Role As a founding engineer at AltimateAI, you will play a foundational role in designing, building, and scaling our products and the team. We’re looking for exceptional Engineers to join the founding team in solving complex problems at the intersection of Data and ML. The Compensation Equity - 0.2% - 1.0% Cash - $100k - $180k Healthcare - medical, dental, and vision 401k plan Well-furnished office space with snacks, drinks, and amenities Time off - flexible vacation policy to encourage people to get out and see the world. Goodies - a new MacBook Pro and whatever hardware and software you need to get the job done. Seat at the table - come to work every day knowing your efforts will have a material impact in shaping the direction of the company. ABOUT You Ideally you have: 3+ years of full-time experience, ideally in a startup environment or building something end-to-end from scratch Web fundamentals of HTML, JavaScript, and CSS; proficient in one frontend framework like React, Angular, Vue Strong Python knowledge prior experience of architecting and managing complete systems – web applications, databases, cloud infrastructure, etc. Experience in dev-ops using AWS or Google Cloud (Bonus) Experience with Scalable API Backend using Python (FastAPI) (Bonus) 2+ years experience building ML/data products is a big plus (Bonus) Working knowledge of ML/deep learning Location This role is open to remote candidates with a preference towards those in the US or with some time-overlap with the US pacific time zone. We are located in the San Francisco Bay Area, California, and plan to gather with our remote teammates at least once per year. For remote folks, the compensation will be adjusted based on the local rates.

title: AI Research Scientist
description:
Our mission at Duolingo is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. But we’ve got more left to do — and that's where you come in! Duolingo is the most popular language-learning application in the world, with over 500 million users and over half a billion exercises completed daily. Beyond our core learning product, we have also entered into literacy with Duolingo ABC and English proficiency testing with the Duolingo English Test . We are passionate about educating our users, making fact-based decisions, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. We offer meaningful work, limitless learning opportunities, and collaboration with world-class minds. Come brighten your life and over half a billion more! As an AI Research Scientist, you will apply your background in AI and machine learning to invent the technologies that will define the future of education in areas such as personalization, natural language processing, speech, and so on. In many cases, this means identifying entirely new research problems, or synthesizing work that spans several fields. You will find opportunities to improve existing systems – or reinvent them completely – to tackle Duolingo's unique data. We are a fun and motivated team, building intelligent software used by millions of people around the world every day. You Will... Conduct cutting-edge AI research that pushes forward the field of education Work with a multi-functional team of award-winning designers, researchers, engineers, and others to build new research-based product features Assist in mentoring junior scientists and engineers Contribute to the broader research community by publishing and presenting about your work A few example projects include: The Duolingo English Test ( TACL paper ) Novel bandit algorithm for mobile notifications ( KDD paper ) Shared task on translation & paraphrasing ( ACL paper ) Novel model of vocabulary forgetting ( ACL paper ) You Have... PhD in machine learning, AI, computer science, or a related technical field Experience implementing ML systems in Python, Java, Scala, or C/C++ (i.e., not just R or MATLAB) Outstanding interpersonal communication and organizational skills Contributions to research communities and efforts, including publishing papers at conferences such as ACL, CVPR, EDM, ICML, NeurIPS, etc. Exceptional Candidates Will Have... Familiarity with educational and/or assessment technologies Experience mentoring or managing junior scientists or engineers Strong publication record We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please contact your recruiter. We aim to return to office, and as such are requiring all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and have received any booster doses as recommended by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Responsibilities Include Develop data extraction, annotation, auditing pipeline to improve MT data annotation efficiency and quality Develop large scale data processing pipeline in distributed computing environments Document development for data asset management Development of annotation project strategies, interfaces, and guidelines Serve as an interface for feedback and questions from annotators back to MT engineers. title: Computer Scientist, AI
description:
SRI International's Computer Science Lab (CSL) builds, assesses and defends vital computer systems that affect all of our lives. We study the logical foundations of scalable systems beyond the scope of traditional testing or simulation, and we create and apply high-level tools for rigorous mechanical analysis. CSL is looking to hire a Computer Scientist to conduct research and development in machine learning with a focus on safe, robust, responsible, and ethical AI (related research described at https//nusci.csl.sri.com/). Actively participate in existing and new projects for government and commercial clients Co-developing research ideas and leading the experimental evaluation of these ideas Documentation in technical reports and research papers Some travel will be required to project sites and conference venues Ph.D. in Computer Science or related area Expertise in machine learning Strong CS/Math or aligned background with research in AI/ML Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, advanced prototyping, and software development skills to experimentally evaluate deep learning algorithms Strong publication track record For Colorado residents, the salary range is $92,192 - $190,140. Salary ranges for this role will vary and are based on several factors, including geographic location, market competitiveness and equity amongst internal employees in similar roles. SRI has a competitive benefits package, to view details please go to https//www.sri.com/resources/benefits/. SRI International, an over 75-year strong pioneering research institute, has a rich history supporting government and industry. Our innovations have created new industries, billions of dollars in market value and lasting benefits to society. SRI is organized around broad disciplines and capabilities, with research and development divisions and labs to groups who excel at identifying new opportunities, developing products and creating custom solutions. Our organization is driven by impact - delivering unique solutions for the world's important challenges and transforming ideas into reality for clients and partners.

title: HR Business Partner
description:
At Pony.ai, excellence is at the core of our company. Every detail counts as we work to deliver a safe, reliable, and cost-effective autonomous driving platform to the public. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in developing and deploying state-of-the-art vehicle technology. You will have every opportunity to grow and develop as our company grows. Join us on this exciting journey as we bring the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence to the future of transportation. We are looking for a HR Business Partner who will work with the leaders across the functions and sites to ensure Pony is a great place to work for all our employees. This role is both hands-on and strategic and provides expertise in the areas of employee relations, workforce planning, performance management, culture development, compensation, employee retention, coaching/development, conflict management and ad hoc projects as necessary. You will be passionate about your work and take pride in helping deliver positive change every day! Responsibilities Roll up your sleeves to execute a full range of HR duties from high-level strategy to program design to problem-solving.  Build credibility and trust among employees. Resolve employee concerns through compassion, a systematic approach, clear documentation and follow-through. Be the owner of a series of HR activities to scale the company's core culture and values through rapid growth.  Advise, coach and guide management to develop positive employee engagement capability and leadership skills. Consult and advise on succession planning, talent reviews and driving the annual merit planning cycle. Collaboration with all HR functions across multiple sites to build world class initiatives In partnership with leaders, develop workforce plans that ensure our success for the long term. Support leadership to develop the culture and drive employee engagement by optimizing our employee engagement participation and feedback systems. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in relevant work experience. 3+ years’ experience in a HR Business Partner or other HR role including coaching, employee relations, recruiting, compensation, training and HR project management or program implementation. Excellent communication skills and ability to coach, influence, and partner with various levels of employees Demonstrated experience in organizational development, change management, coaching and communications. Proven planning and organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to handle multiple tasks. Be innovative, collaborative, and driven to achieve the results . Ability to relate to people at all levels of the organization. Proficiency in Chinese is a plus. About Pony.ai Pony.ai, Inc. (“Pony.ai”) is a start-up located in Silicon Valley and China that is pursuing an ambitious vision for autonomous mobility. Ranked Top 10 on CNBC Disruptor 50 List, we aim to bring safe, sustainable, and accessible mobility to the entire world. We believe that autonomous technology can make our roads exponentially safer for travelers. Founded in late 2016, Pony.ai has been a pioneer in autonomous mobility technologies and services across the U.S. and China, spearheading public-facing Robotaxi pilots in both markets. The company is currently valued at $8.5B and some of its major investors include Toyota, Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan, Sequoia Capital China, and IDG Capital. Pony.ai has formed partnerships with leading OEMs including Toyota, GAC Group, FAW Group, etc. We believe our work has the potential to transform lives and industries for the better. You will have every opportunity to grow and develop as our company scales globally.

title: Chief Technology & Product Officer
description:
Role: Chief Technology & Product OfficerReports to: Chief Executive OfficerLocation: RemoteHours: Full-timeAbout TrevorThe Trevor Project is the world's largest suicide prevention and crisis intervention organization for LGBTQ young people. We are a non-profit that provides 24/7 life-saving support via phone, text, and chat. We also operate the world's largest safe space social networking site for LGBTQ youth and run innovative research, education, and advocacy programs. We've been saving lives every day for over 20 years.Overview of the roleAs Chief Technology & Product Officer, you will be accountable for ensuring that all of The Trevor Project's products, technologies, and services are serving the overall mission of ending suicide among LGBTQ youth. You will accomplish this by overseeing a growing team of more than 65 professionals across three units: Product & UX, Engineering & AI, and IT & Security. In your position, you will be a strategic leader, visionary, and advocate, who not only supports the organization as it scales across the US, but will also be a key leader as The Trevor Project scales its life-saving services globally.Who you areInspirational. You can bring people together, take time to listen, and rally groups and individuals around directions and priorities.Strategic. Precious resources and a big mission - ensuring we're operating efficientlyUser centric. You obsess on the needs of our users, including youth, counselors, staff, Organized and efficient. You know how to manage complex projects. You drive processes forward effectively, on time, and with an eye on all the details that go into successfully achieving goals.Collaborative. You understand that the best way to meet and exceed goals is through outstanding teamwork. Flexible. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and working through competing priorities. You understand that needs will shift and you champion change for your team. Builder. You're excited about the opportunity to take the status quo as just a starting point, then implement best practices and continually innovate. Camera ready. You communicate clearly and concisely. You can engage with a wide variety of audiences and are comfortable speaking to the press and at conferences. Passionate. You care about LGBTQ youth. You care about saving lives. You want to come to work and feel inspired every day. You want to change the world. Fun. The work we do is very serious, but that doesn't mean we don't have fun. We know how to have a good time and you should too. What you'll doOversee three growing departments with more than 65 staff, including Product & UX, Engineering & AI, and IT & Security, managing resourcing and hiring, and providing mentorshipSupport international strategy in determining optimal path to serve LGBTQ youth globally with our technology systemsServe as a partner to our Clinical Operations and Growth team to scale our crisis services domestically and abroad, constantly iterating and improving our systemsMake strategic decisions regarding technology strategy with expansion to each knew country, identifying resource needs and advocating for them accordinglyPartner with our Clinical Operations team to constantly iterate on our leading-edge platform and continually improve the user experience for youth, volunteers, and staffExpand our digital crisis services globally to LGBTQ youth in countries around the world, supporting with our launch in Mexico in 2022 and continuing to other countries in the strategic plan of the organization within the next 5 yearsSpeak at leading conferences and to the press about The Trevor Project's technologyOther tasks, duties, or special projects as assignedBenefitsGenerous vacation and holidays (like a full day off to celebrate Harvey Milk Day!), including three half-day Fridays during the summerComprehensive health insurance, including coverage for various gender affirmation surgeries (and we pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental, and life)Flexibility to work from anywhere in the U.S. (we provide the technology, a monthly internet reimbursement and a reimbursement to outfit your work-from-home space!)Fun virtual office environment and passionate team Online Subscription to Headspace, a digital meditation platformMeaningful work at an organization that is saving the lives of LGBTQ young people across America every dayThe Trevor Project is an equal opportunity employerYour applicationWe're excited to hear from you! To join Team Trevor, please upload a resume and cover letter. Applications without cover letters will not be considered. Use this as an opportunity to convey why you want to be the next Chief Technology and Product Officer at The Trevor Project!PDN-978ac4f9-94cf-459f-9edd-b9cc85cfe65c

title: Chief Product Architect
description:
(Full Time with our client) What You'll Be Doing Reporting to the Head of Product, Services, & Solutions, you'll guide the CX industry forward through empowering our culture of continuous improvement while partnering with our go to market teams to delight our customers. You'll create new and innovative client facing products and services, transform our technology enabled services toolkit, and ensure alignment to business objectives to grow client's position in the marketplace. On a Typical Day, You'll   Drive innovation & engineering of client facing products and services by identifying strategies, opportunities and new technologies, and developing new capabilities to serve those opportunities. Work closely with executives and technology groups while managing a small set of technical sharpshooters developing POC's & MVP's to enable, create differentiation, and build value within our service delivery, such as: Conversational AI to enhance omnichannel customer engagement  Virtual agent desktop/DaaS, workplace & employee experience technology RPA focusing on increasing agent productivity  AI/ML with predictive analytics  Keep a pulse on the market, research and identify new and emerging technologies that will enhance the business operating efficiency and support growth. Evaluate technologies and determine strengths and weaknesses of technology architecture, implementation, and suitability. Provide strategic technical expertise, influence the development of the CX technology strategy and collaborate with existing technology groups to drive the execution. Define and execute the technology roadmap with agility while developing and implementing technology solutions and infrastructures with a solid foundation to scale globally. Participate in technology programs including leading new offer definition / demand, shaping technical development programs and ensuring that the unique capabilities of a vertical or region are aligned to the overall global strategy. Interface with critical customers and represent Client's Engage technology offerings to support increased revenue. Develop strategic relationships resulting in increased value of the organization. Communicate technology positions to industry analysts, key customers, partners, and the press to clearly position Client's Engage as a leading organization in the CX industry. Help establish a culture of innovation and continuous learning to encourage employees to drive and adapt to new technology solutions in their daily work environments. Why You? What You Bring  Experience architecting and engineering CX and cloud-based technologies and applications Experience with all forms of CX / customer experience technologies including Conversational AI, RPA, machine learning, AR and video, voice analytics, WFM and QA software, desktop as a service, messaging and digital channel engagement, etc.  Knowledge and experience with large global scale workforce management and contact center operations and overall CX industry is an added advantage Knowledge of telephony and network infrastructure Working knowledge and understanding of platform and application integration techniques, including APIs, integration platforms, etc.  Experience with tools to make front-line associates more productive such as knowledge management platforms, real-time coaching, and real-time associate assist tools  Experience working in a variety of the industry's concepts, practices and procedures Experience working with strategic planning at a senior level Experience working with management implications of various forms of financial data Experience working in a matrixed environment Experience creating custom applications from scratch  Fifteen or more years of related experience Bachelors' degree in information technology, computer sciences, business administration or related field preferred Interpersonal And Leadership Qualities Being Sought The successful candidate is a natural self-confident change agent who can motivate and stretch an organization to achieve stronger results through continuous innovation and transformation.  An individual with the ability to keep a pulse on the market by keeping abreast of technology trends and new developments in the industry, continuous learning and immersing in an environment with people from different backgrounds that can provide insight into emerging solutions. Agile leader who moves with urgency, creating a culture where agility is the norm, but is thoughtful about considering input from the team and building platforms with strong foundations that can scale globally. Creative thinker that can connect seemingly unrelated questions, problems, or ideas into creative solutions. The successful leader asks thoughtful questions that challenge common practices. The successful candidate should be a hands-on / in-the-weeds leader with a successful track record. While the role is a key member of the leadership team, he/she must bring a "player/coach" attitude, with a natural inclination to "lead from the front". A decisive individual with a "big picture" perspective and a strategic mindset with an inclination towards action, possesses ability to anticipate business and competitive trends and to respond effectively to take advantage of opportunities. An intelligent and articulate leader who is obsessed with creating customer value and a positive employee experience. Possess the ability to communicate effectively and publicly represent the company with the team, vendors, internal and external clients in sensitive and highly visible circumstances. Possesses strong technical skills and business acumen; results-oriented, well-organized, and self-directed individual with a strong work ethic and willingness to commit to achieving plan objectives. Brings excellent judgment and problem-solving skills to analyze and interpret complex situations and prioritize a variety of opportunities to maximize resources and impact. Constantly seeking out new technology tools, methods and procedures that are applicable to the business a willingness to take a fresh look at entrenched procedures and search for a "better" answer, relentlessly focused on continuous improvement. You create an environment where global teams are engaged, cultural differences are respected; and act as a role model for talent in the company in alignment to our company values.

title: Product Designer
description:
As the first Product Designer on the Aquarium team, you will be responsible for driving design on our core product: an application for machine learning teams to visualize their datasets and collaborate on operational workflows. With a machine learning product, we have the challenge of bridging deeply technical concepts with very human processes. Our users range from PhDs in computer vision, to experts in their niche industry, to operations team members focused on efficiency. Their problems are equally varied – agriculture, robotics, social media, insurance, and recycling are a handful of the industries our customers work in. The ideal candidate is a designer with strong systems thinking and communication skills, who can think beyond pixels and design for the full offline experience. You will also help drive design across the company, from establishing internal design systems to helping build a strong design culture. Your work will directly enable machine learning teams across all industries to deploy machine learning models that work in production, from small startups to large enterprises. **What you will do** Own your design process end to end, from initial flows and prototypes through final high-fidelity implementation. Design user experiences that extend across multiple roles and offline interactions in customer organizations. Work closely with the product and engineering teams on our product direction, strategy, and execution. Establish and grow our internal design systems. Help with hiring and establishing a design culture within Aquarium **What you should have** 3+ years as a Product Designer, or similar experience in a UX / UI / HCI related field A customer-success focused mindset. You empathize with and understand customer problems, and come up with creative solutions to solve their problems. Experience working within small teams, startups, or other rapidly growing organizations is a plus. Experience designing for B2B, machine learning, data infrastructure, or similar products is a plus. **About Aquarium** Machine learning is eating the world. However, though it’s easier than ever to build a prototype of an ML system, it’s still extremely difficult to build, maintain, and improve ML systems in production to solve real world problems. Aquarium helps teams ship better ML models faster to enable the next generation of revolutionary AI applications. Aquarium is backed by top investors including Y Combinator and Sequoia Capital. Our customers span many industries, from robotics to agriculture to construction. We’re looking to grow our team with awesome people who’ll shape the future of Aquarium -- both as a product and as a company.

title: Senior Product Manager - AI/Data
description:
Sr. Product Manager – AI/Data It’s an amazing time to join Sarcos, a leading robotics company undergoing significant growth. As an undisputed industry leader in dexterous robotic systems, Sarcos is creating technology to empower people. We don’t replace human productivity, we enhance it, by making people stronger, keeping them safer, and getting to places people couldn’t, or shouldn’t, otherwise go. We don’t just build robots. We build new possibilities for the real people getting it done. Sarcos brings together the brightest minds in robotics to provide creative options to carrying out the world’s most dangerous tasks. We place a large emphasis on collaboration & teamwork, because the problems being solved are extremely challenging and require contributions from people with expertise in a wide variety of disciplines. If you’re interested in working on the forefront of robotics with a creative team of great people, come join us! Sr. Product Manager – AI/Data Sarcos is looking for a technical product manager who has experience driving the definition and delivery of AI and Data-based products and services. The product manager will define the data management platform to support backend operations and services for Sarcos products. S/he will also work with the technical leadership to define and drive the strategic vision for AI within Sarcos’ product line and capture it accordingly into the product roadmap. The product manager will work closely with cross-functional leads to deliver planned products to market on time and within budget. The product manager will work closely with our Engineering, Design, Marketing, Finance teams, and Partners to ensure success aligned to company OKRs. Role/Responsibilities : Define AI and data strategy working closely with Sarcos technical leadership. Produce MRD/PRDs for relevant technical product lines. Define the AI and data roadmap, business requirements, measures of success, and features for assigned products and services Define product metrics to measure and ensure the success of our data platform and associated services Define customer benefits and clarify user priorities to drive decision making Partner with key stakeholders across Sarcos to continue to collect requirements, understand pain points to build and maintain portfolio strategy and roadmap Work with the architecture and engineering teams to prioritize short-term and long-term goals Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding for markets, competition, and user/customer requirements. title: Software Engineer, Perception
description:
Who We Are Argo AI is a global self-driving products and services company on a mission to make the world’s streets and roadways safe, accessible, and useful for all. Our technology is built to enable commercial services for autonomous delivery and ridesharing in cities. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world’s top consumer brands, we’re working block by block, city by city to empower people and businesses to be more successful. We’re individuals driven by strong values to solve complex problems together. Come join us to reimagine the human journey. Meet The Team Argo AI is tackling one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence: autonomous vehicles. We develop and deploy the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and computer vision to enable safe, accessible, efficient, and cost-effective transportation for all. The challenges are significant, but we don’t shy from hard, meaningful problems - we aim to make science fiction reality and the world a better place. The Perception division is responsible for converting raw data collected by our many sensors - camera, lidar, radar, and more - to semantically interpretable information that the rest of the vehicle platform system can use to make control decisions, permitting the vehicle to drive itself. Perception spans a huge breadth of the work we do here to enable autonomous machines: everything from merging classical computer vision insights with state-of-the-art machine learning, sensor fusion, state estimation, lidar processing, depth sensing, and calibration to data management, logging, computational acceleration, system-level libraries, mapping algorithms, and support for our custom lidar solution. Perception operates at a pivot point for the company - we work cross-functionally with stakeholders from every major part of the company, but are especially active at the hardware/software interface, where we are the primary customers of the sensor suite on Argo AI’s vehicles. We seek talented individuals who can contribute our mission of converting photons into understanding. Candidates should be capable of designing solutions to challenging and open-ended problems, including the ability to understand the problem and design space, explore the research literature, and evaluate the merits of multiple competing proposals. Come change the world with us. What You’ll Do Develop software solutions to practical challenges in autonomous vehicle perception. Exact specialty depends on the specific subteam you are placed with. Stay up to date with the state of the art in various perception fields and use this knowledge to help guide new features and architecture. Work closely with our cross-functional partner teams to integrate new features and accelerate our overall company roadmap. Evaluate the performance of your work using a metrics driven approach, and work to design new metrics and evaluation tools/procedures as needed. Your work will be essential to fielding a fleet of autonomous vehicles across multiple cities, and you will have direct exposure to real world data, feedback, and the satisfaction of having contributed to a state-of-the art autonomous vehicle.  What You'll Need To Succeed Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field  Demonstrated knowledge in one or more of the following areas or related: machine learning as applied to computer vision, sensor fusion, state estimation, probabilistic graphical models, depth sensing and geometric reconstruction, multi-sensor calibration, object classification, computational acceleration, 3d extended object tracking, temporal fusion, multimodal sensing, temporal modeling of state, or differentiable systems. A successful track record of developing and deploying real-world solutions. Strong problem analysis and solving skills. Nice To Haves Masters / PhD with computer vision or machine learning focus, or equivalent experience. Experience with spatiotemporal machine learning model development, depth sensing, or in-the-field sensor calibration. Direct experience with Level 4 self-driving cars. What We Offer You High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance Competitive compensation packages Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan with immediate vesting Employer-paid group term life insurance and the option to elect voluntary life insurance  Paid parental leave Adoption & Surrogacy Assistance Program Paid medical leave 30 day paid sabbatical upon 5 years of employment Unlimited vacation Complimentary daily lunches, beverages, and snacks Pre-tax commuter benefits Monthly wellness stipend  Professional development reimbursement Employee assistance program Discounted programs that include legal services, identity theft protection, pet insurance, and more Company and team bonding outlets: employee resource groups, quarterly team activity stipend, and wellness initiatives Our Background Argo AI was founded in 2016 by industry experts with extensive experience building robotic systems for commercial applications. Our once-small team has since grown into an over 1,700-person strong company with strategic partnerships with some of the world’s leading consumer brands. With global headquarters in Pittsburgh, we operate in eight cities across the U.S. and Germany in areas where self-driving technology can have the biggest impact on improving safety, traffic, and transportation equity. At Argo AI, we believe that embracing differences delivers superior results. We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to an inclusive environment for all employees.

The Junior Graphic Designer will be responsible for resolving a wide range of design challenges ranging from digital display ad creation, presentation design, print/digital marketing, event production, and website updates. The Junior Designer must also be able to work in a fast-paced environment, quickly and efficiently developing best practices for the position. Reporting to the Art Director, the Junior Designer is a key member of the marketing team, working across all parts of the company; including sales, product development, technology, and operations. What You'll Do: Create and manage sales and business development decks including media and pitch kits.  Maintain and help create social media assets Create and manage production of marketing materials for events, including internal and external promotional, trade shows and other events.  Manage visual and information design of web properties, ensuring accurate and consistent messaging appropriate to the site.  Qualifications: 0-3 years of agency, corporate, and/or ad tech design experience.  Strong organizational, planning, and time-management skills, with a proven capacity to prioritize and perform time-sensitive tasks Strong understanding of design, typography, composition, hierarchy of information, and color theory.  Must be extremely detail-oriented, and be able to think strategically about both short and long-term solutions Possesses superior problem-solving, collaborative, and decision-making skills Ability to work independently as well within the team Excellent communicator who can effectively share creative insights across all the company's teams while reporting regularly to executive and senior management Bachelor's degree (or equivalent work experience) Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (PS, AI, ID, AE and PR), Google Slides, Google Sheets, Microsoft Powerpoint, and Excel.  DSLR photography, video, Wordpress and animation experience is a plus! Portfolio presentation is expected; include URL to the portfolio website.  A plus if you are Wordpress certified and have website development skills Join Us:  adMarketplace has been named as one of the best places to work in New York City by Built In and Crain's- the latter of which have recognized us the past three years straight! AMP is currently experiencing triple digit growth, and it's never been a better time to join our team! We offer a robust continuing education program, management training, regular company-wide lunch and learns, and well-defined career paths to ensure all our employees have an opportunity to grow. title: A/AI Agility Coach
description:
The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy team member with working knowledge in project execution, agile development methodologies, systems engineering, and/or AI and analytics to support multiple AI product teams for the business. In this role you will be part of the LAIC portfolio consisting of a variety of skilled colleagues including full stack developers, data engineers, machine learning / AI specialists, product managers, data scientists, and other agility mentors. Your focus will be on team operations and project execution for the AI Consulting Team. The team is focused on exploiting small, innovative, and agile teams to rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the Lockheed Martin. You will work with senior leadership and the teams to facilitate their operations and enable them to deliver maximum value to the enterprise. This role will span both technical and leadership skill areas. Example technical work might include:  To develop and maintain a process and system of visualizing, understanding, and monitoring a comprehensive view of all consulting engagements  Investigate integrations between new tools and data that could be of value to the team  Develop and communicate a systems-level understanding of the customer needs  Speak on behalf of the team or customer to the other to develop common understanding and expectations Leadership And Agility Responsibilities Can Include Activities Such As  Host, facilitate, continuously evaluate, and improve upon regular team ceremonies and business rhythms  Prioritize and coach high customer empathy  Foster and drive team culture by teaching and championing agile practices  Coordinate specific team events  Understand, utilize, and communicate team metrics  Recognize and elevate when leadership support is needed (staffing decisions, priority setting, systematic pain point alleviation)  Act as a protector/advocate/defender of the team’s mental health and scope  Recognize and distinguish between culture and process problems and aid in the resolution of either  Collaborate with other agility coaches and scrum masters within the LAIC to learn and leverage the experience and knowledge of your peers No formal Scrum Certification is required but rather the ability to internalize and practice agile philosophies in a dynamic and rapidly evolving environment. More important than any one specific skill is an eagerness to jump in and conduct safe experiments to continuously improve the work experience for AI Consulting team members

title: Senior AI Research Scientist
description:
At Mendel, we are enabling different stakeholders in healthcare to make better decisions by learning from the journey of every patient— from a physician deciding on the best treatment for a patient to a pharma company discovering the next blockbuster drug. In creating depth and breadth for a patient's health record journey, Mendel enables the right care delivered at the right time to the right person. This is an incredible opportunity to join a unique vision to improve healthcare using AI technology. Our standards are high, but the reward of building the infrastructure of a new product is higher! This position is located in San Jose, CA. Who you are: You hold an MS or a PhD in computer science specialized in an area of AI/ML You have 7+ years of experience with a MS or 2+ years of experience with a PhD You have hands-on experience in one or more of the following areas: NLP, NER, relation extraction, graph neural networks, or close enough research topics You have incorporated your AI models into products used by customers You are inspired by our mission to improve healthcare through technology You have a track record of being an A player. We define an A player as a candidate who has at least 90% chance of achieving a set of outcomes that only the top 10% of possible candidates could achieve Bonus points: Expertise in research areas like NLU, semantics, ontologies, symbolic AI, and hybrid AI You have worked on any products or projects in the healthcare domain You have worked at a startup before.  Excellent software engineering skills Experience in managing a team of AI/data scientists Why should you join our team: Benjamin Franklin once said: "If you would not be forgotten as soon as you are dead, either write something worth reading, or do something worth writing." — at Mendel you can do the latter. There are two things more devastating than learning that you or your loved ones have a terminal illness; getting the wrong treatment or not finding any. At Mendel, we are on a sincere mission to solve many never-solved-before technology challenges that can enable prescribers and drug makers to do their best Mendel is a very collaborative environment. You will be taking ownership of your work and collaborate directly with different teams to see it going into production and used by customers. At the same time, you will be mentored by world class AI scientists, software engineers, and clinical and business leaders. Hear from our team here

title: AI/ML Evangelist and Technical Marketing – Product Management
description:
AI is already improving our lives in all imaginable areas, many of which require AI to run on edge devices for reasons including practicality, cost, and privacy. However, in the AI industry today there is still no good solution available to design efficient models targeting increasingly diverse edge hardware platforms. As a result, it takes repeated manual design and training iterations for models to be deployed, which in turn demands an extraordinary level of energy and engineering time for AI to reach production. OmniML is a well-funded early-stage startup targeting these big gaps. OmniML is backed by established VCs and world-leading researchers and industry experts. Founded by professor Song Han, MIT EECS professor and experienced start-up founder, Dr. Di Wu, former Facebook engineer, and Dr. Huizi Mao, co-inventor of the “deep compression” technology coming out of Stanford. OmniML makes major ML tasks 10x faster and 30% more accurate on different edge devices. The core product offering is a training platform that automates model co-design, training, and deployment targeting GPUs, AI SoCs, and even tiny MCUs. Our technology has already demonstrated significant gains in model performance and cost reduction in the initial collaboration with large customers in multiple vertical markets. To embark on the journey, we are looking for bold leaders and strong technical individuals who share our vision and can grow together with us. You will be part of the founding team creating AI/ML software that will help hundreds of customers deploy powerful AI on 250+ billion edge devices. More specifically, we are looking for: The AI/ML technical evangelist role will be a key position within the product management organization. You will be the first technical evangelist at OmniML. You will spend most of your time focused on promoting OmniML technical capabilities to the AI/ML community and a portion of your time helping the engineering product teams on product development work. Responsibility Build and foster developer communities focused on technical machine learning topics and AI optimization application Deliver solutions to machine learning developers: code samples, demos, quick-hit videos, etc Create technical content: blog posts, webinars, videos, guides, white papers, and interviews Grow self-sustaining and scalable open-source communities (online and offline) and user groups Report up to the Product Management team and help define new requirements based on user communities and customer feedback Build online and offline AI/ML demos Grow a strong developer following on social media and other developer forums Evangelize the development of ML user community tools and services Work at times directly with customers and prospects to deliver technical demonstrations and presentations Present technical sessions at conferences, workshops, and online events Analyze the effectiveness of community advocacy and continually strategize and iterate Get things done! Requirement 3+ years of experience in a Technical Evangelist, Technical Marketing, Sales Engineer role (or similar) at an Enterprise AI, Data Analytics, Application Performance Management (APM), IT Operations Analytics (ITOA) company A Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Information Systems, or related field 2-3 years of experience developing demos, webinars, videos, technical collateral, and presentations Outstanding written and verbal communications skills with the capacity to explain and translate complex technology Some familiarity with programming languages including Python or data science tools Able to coordinate across many teams and perform in a fast-moving startup environment Bonus Points Already have a strong reputation and following in AI/ML developer community Experience in startups or high-growth companies, or desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment Meaningful AI/ML-related social presence with engaged followers Advanced degree in Computer Science/Data Science A job description is never the full picture so please reach out to our recruiting team at hr@omniml.ai and let’s have a conversation. We’re excited to meet you.

title: Head of Global Sales
description:
Described as the "Uber of Content", Social Native is a marketplace technology company that empowers marketers to create, source and optimize authentic visual content in the most efficient way possible. Leveraging the world's first AI-powered creative platform, brands such as Unilever, Adidas, L'Oréal, Crocs and Nestlé Waters partner with Social Native to improve the performance of their paid and organic social strategy with a combination of Influencer Marketing, Custom Content, and Content Editing solutions. With our acquisition of Olapic, we're changing the way marketers evaluate, refine and optimize their visual content strategy. This move solidifies our goal of delivering an all-in-one platform providing brands with data-driven insights, scales content creation, measures the impact of their work, and optimizes content for even greater results. To help support our rapid growth, we're actively searching for a Head of Global Sales who has a proven track record overseeing sales teams, building strategic partnerships at a global level, developing strategies for market penetration including new and existing client development and creating comprehensive go to market strategies for new and existing product lines. Reporting to the VP of Global Revenue, this position will have full management oversight of our new business, commercial sales team. This position will need to be expert in integrating people and developing strong sales forces. Further, will also help assure that the company is building and implementing processes, building strong data driven performance metrics, revenue analytics and required marketing and other support needs to achieve high performance results. Responsibilities: Lead and ensure performance, strategy, and alignment of the Sales organization Monitor revenue pipeline and leads, adjusting as necessary to create sustainable growth Collaborate with finance, product management, and marketing on messaging, pricing strategies, and business models to achieve revenue goals Identify and resolve issues across the marketing/sales and account management functions Stay well-connected with customers to ensure broad market needs are being incorporated into the product development and enhancement cycle Partner with other members of the executive team to execute the current corporate strategic plan, and develop future plans Ensure that the marketing function is meeting requirements to support and improve the individual client experience and strategy Monitor the marketplace and analyze opportunities, providing competitive analysis, strategies, and tactics Help maximize reach and efficiency by adding new, scalable partners in a strategic way Build and foster creative teams committed to continuing our culture of innovation Requirements: BA/BS in Business and/or Marketing. MBA or equivalent advanced degree ideal. Experience: 6+ years of Marketing Technology or similar industry experience, ideally with 3+ years of experience within the E-Commerce, Content Marketing or Influencer Marketing space 4+ years in sales leadership roles, driving and implementing revenue growth, managing and building sales teams, ideally on a global scale Proven track record of growing revenue through new product development, marketing, branding, and partnerships in both domestic and international business opportunities Proven experience developing and executing business strategy Ability to craft and execute a business strategy History of decision-making based on business metrics Inspirational leadership style and hands-on approach Preferred Qualifications: Strong technical experience with Salesforce and other commercial tools Strong analytical and organizational skills Excellent written and oral communication skills Perks: One of the best perks about Social Native is working with amazing talented people! Come see what it's like to work at a fast-paced, venture-backed tech startup. We are looking for smart, driven, fun people that are eager to take ownership of exciting projects and be a part of building something great. Attractive health, dental and vision insurance coverage Competitive compensation structure including equity  401(k) retirement plan Unlimited vacation policy Flexible work hours Casual work environment and fun work culture!

description:
About Pachyderm: Pachyderm is the leader in data versioning and pipelines for MLOps. We're building the data foundation that allows data science teams to automate and scale their machine learning lifecycle while guaranteeing reproducibility. With over $40 million in three rounds of funding from leading investors like Benchmark, Microsoft M12, and Y Combinator, Pachyderm is committed to building industrial strength capabilities for Data Centric AI. Pachyderm offers a commercial Enterprise Edition and an open source Community Edition. Pachyderm helps customers get their ML and AI projects to market faster, lower data processing and storage costs, and supports strict data governance requirements. Pachyderm is growing fast and still small, so joining means you are getting in right at the ground floor and that you will have an enormous impact on the success and direction of the company and product. Pachyderm has always and will always embrace a "Remote-first" approach to growing our team. This allows us to hire a diverse group of individuals across the country (and world!) while giving our team members the flexibility to work from anywhere. Being a member of The Pach means joining a supportive team that cares about you, values kindness and works hard to create an open and transparent workplace. title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
description:
Are you an extraordinary leader that will help save lives by accelerating mission readiness? Can you build a team, coalesce it around a shared vision and help it perform at its best to enable our customers’ mission success? Do you appreciate the importance of agility, affordability, disruptive technologies, outcome-based solutions, and a talented team that can reimagine the future? If so, keep reading! At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, we are driven by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and visionary thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training and education. Come and experience your future! This Position Will Require Technical Leadership To This position is for a driven, energetic first line manager for approximately ten engineers supporting leading edge research and development to accelerate the application of data analytics, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Machine Learning (ML) for military training solutions. The role requires a resourceful and persistent technologist willing to reach out to other projects and organizations to ensure successful execution of the projects. The selected candidate will be at the forefront of defining what is possible, building the team, and shaping future investment and growth in this emerging field.  Lead IRAD projects, including the planning, reporting, earned value management, etc. Understand/document/define the data that could be available  Define a data architecture to collect relevant training data in order to provide training result insights and train AI/ML algorithms.  Evaluate trades for data analytics, AI/ML solutions  Collaborate with the RMS Data Analytics Team, LM Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC), and Corporate Engineering & Technology Ultimately, the selected candidate will index and identify current or potential data sets and apply AI/ML techniques to synthesize that data into actionable information for our products and programs. Management responsibilities include coordinating recruitment, developing training plans, working with employees to develop career plans and employee performance monitoring and reviews. The selected individual will be responsible for guiding the team through a cultural transformation from classical engineering groups to a combined Integrated Engineering team. As an Integrated Engineering Manager, you will be expected to facilitate the deployment and use of best practices, tools, and processes on our programs and work with the Engineering Program Managers (EPMs) and Integrated Product Team (IPT) Leads to ensure projects are staffed properly and the organization’s staff is meeting all business commitments.

title: Network Threat Researcher
description:
eSentire® is the global leader in Managed Detection and Response (MDR), keeping organizations safe from cyber attacks that technology alone cannot prevent. Our 24x7 Security Operations Center (SOC), staffed by elite security analysts, hunts, investigates, and responds in real-time to known and unknown threats before they become business disrupting events. We want to cut through the hype and overblown claims surrounding AI and ML to help our customers successfully tackle their biggest challenges utilizing human expertise at machine scale. We value each person’s unique contribution, so if you love to solve difficult problems--together--eSentire is the place for you. eSentire has been recognized in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™  and Fast 500™, Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers, and Gartner’s Market Guide for Managed Detection and Response. For more information, visit www.eSentire.com and follow @eSentire. Network Threat Researcher eSentire is looking for highly capable individuals to be part of our Tactical Threat Response team.eSentire is a recognized industry leader and one of Canada’s Fastest-Growing Tech company. We work in a collaborative and innovative work environment with brilliant and passionate people who strive and encourage others to do their best. Join us to gain rewarding and developing career experience with the ability to grow and make an impact from your work.  THE OPPORTUNITY  The successful candidate will report to the Manager of Tactical Threat Response and be responsible for end-to-end threat detection in our network service.The Tactical Threat Response (TTR) team creates proprietary security content, detectors to alert on threats and runbooks to streamline investigations. TTR is made up of dedicated security experts that manage the entire content creation process, which is informed by observations from our Security Operations Center (SOC), outputs from the other teams within the Threat Response Unit (TRU) and the MITRE ATT&CK framework. The TTR team manages the security content development roadmap to ensure our services keep up with the threat landscape. Responsibilities  Identifying, organizing, and processing new novel detection techniques   Triaging new detectors   Detector development   Deployment and Support   Ongoing tuning and maintenance   Network subject matter expert  Desired Skills  Threat Modeling: Understand how adversaries will attack cloud infrastructure, what their goals may be, and where detection opportunities exist   Security Data Analysis and Analytics: Know where valuable security data exists, how to sift through the data, apply analytics, and create actionable alerts   Investigation Theory: Ability to take an alert and define repeatable investigation steps that support a security outcome   Threat Hunting: Understand adversary behavior, develop a hypothesis, design hunts, and interpret the results   Process oriented: Experienceunderstanding, following, updating, and creating repeatable instructions for day-to-day activities   Independent self-starter: Experience independently generating ideas, developing a plan, and executing on that plan  Requirements  Understanding and experience with network attacks, adversary goals, and investigating incidents using network data   Experience analyzing network data and developing rules that may require you to use regex, YARA, Sigma, or any other enterprise grade technology or formats   Experience threat hunting using session data or raw pcaps   Experience interpreting and writing Suricata rules   Experience documenting investigation strategies or developing incident reports   Knowledge of attacker tactics, techniques, and procedures and how these activities manifest in network data   Ability to review threat intelligence and design rules and investigations   Knowledge of operating systems and networking   Knowledge of Incident Response/Forensics applied to network data   WORK CONDITIONS   Work will be remote 9 to 5 office hours.   The position does not require the availability for on-call rotation, extended travel, or 24/7 shift coverage.   In case of emergency working hours might be modified.  As a condition of employment, this position is subject to the successful completion of pre-employment screening including references, criminal background and credit history checks We thank all applicants in advance for applying. title: Sr. Developer Advocate (MLOps/ML/AI)
description:
About Pachyderm: Pachyderm is the leader in data versioning and pipelines for MLOps. We're building the data foundation that allows data science teams to automate and scale their machine learning lifecycle while guaranteeing reproducibility. With over $40 million in three rounds of funding from leading investors like Benchmark, Microsoft M12, and Y Combinator, Pachyderm is committed to building industrial strength capabilities for Data Centric AI. Pachyderm offers a commercial Enterprise Edition and an open source Community Edition. Pachyderm helps customers get their ML and AI projects to market faster, lower data processing and storage costs, and supports strict data governance requirements. Pachyderm is growing fast and still small, so joining means you are getting in right at the ground floor and that you will have an enormous impact on the success and direction of the company and product. Pachyderm has always and will always embrace a "Remote-first" approach to growing our team. This allows us to hire a diverse group of individuals across the country (and world!) while giving our team members the flexibility to work from anywhere. Being a member of The Pach means joining a supportive team that cares about you, values kindness and works hard to create an open and transparent workplace. Job Summary Pachyderm is looking for a Sr. Developer Advocate (see also Developer Relations Manager) to be the face of Pachyderm to our community and users. You'll work across marketing, content, evangelism, and product teams to write new content and engage with users and prospects online. You'll establish strong relationships with data scientists and ML Engineers around the world in a scalable way, by crafting great resources to help them build with Pachyderm, including open source demos, code samples, documentation, how-to guides, blog posts, and demo hours. You'll foster developer communities, championing their interests and translating their feedback into actionable product insights. Primary Job Responsibilities Create content to educate, inspire, and equip technical audiences with tools and techniques that make them better at their craft.  Collaborate with different teams, guest authors, customers and content partners, to come up with topic ideas.  Work with the community team to develop and engage the Pachyderm Slack community, listening to feedback and rewarding community members for their participation.  Engage with external contributors and communities on topics related to Pachyderm.  Organize community and evangelism events.  Communicate user requirements and provide input to product management on feature enhancements and future product direction.  Required Skills 2+ years of technical writing experience.  Basic knowledge of Python or other programming languages.  Proficient in producing DevRel content (blogs, dev demos, youtube tutorials).  Superb written and verbal communication skills, with extensive experience in public speaking and/or technical writing.  Maintains a strong and credible presence in online platforms or social media channels relevant to developers, developer tools, data scientists, ML/AI Engineers, and other technical professionals.  Entrepreneurial and self-driven. You thrive at solving open-ended problems, social engineering, engaging individuals on their interested and teaching/expressing your own Ability to rapidly come to consensus with colleagues. Strong opinions, loosely held. No ego Amigo! You are comfortable and skilled at communicating to and gaining traction with audiences of all sizes from meetings with the CEO, to customer meetings, external events and all hands meetings.  Experience in Data Science, AI/ML, Kubernetes, Docker, or other open source software is a strong plus.  Benefits: Significant equity, 401k and full benefits (100% medical, dental and vision for employees, 50% for all dependents).  Flexible PTO - work/life balance is important and we want you to take time off to rejuvenate! Remote friendly- we were remote before remote was cool and we intend to continue to invest in a remote first culture.  Tons of fun swag and surprise packages sent to your doorstep.  Tech and office stipends - what you buy is yours to keep.  Education and donation stipends - we want to support your career growth and the community.  Supportive parental leave (see also: work/life balance).  Encouraged fun - game days, fun activities, zoom hangouts and more (and - when responsible - visits to our home base for team on-sites) We can't wait to meet you and hope you'll join our PACH!

title: AI/ML/Data Scientist
description:
When you join the growing BILH team, you're not just taking a job, you’re making a difference in people’s lives. Job Type Regular Scheduled Hours 40 Work Shift Day (United States of America) AI/ML/Data Scientist Job Description Job Summary:  The Data Scientist will be an MEng, PhD, or someone with similar educational or work experience who has both conceptual/theoretical and practical/hands-on expertise in data science, artificial intelligence, machine learning (includuing deep learning), and related areas and is highly motivated to contribute to scientific and engineering advances in a fast paced, high caliber, and entrepreneurial acadmic setting. Essential Responsibilities  Devise, test, and implement algorithms for high-throughput data.  Contribute to the generation of standard protocols and intellectual property.  Design and implement computer algorithms, potentially including supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods, deep learning (autoencoders, transformers, geometric deep learning, dynamical systems, model decomposition), etc. Required Qualifications Master's degree in AI, Machine Learning, Data Science, Math, Eng, Phys or related field required. Doctoral degree in AI, Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering, Physics, Math or related field preferred. 0-1 Years Related Work Experience Required. Expertise with Python libraries like Tensorflow/Theano/Keras, Numpy, Scipy, Pandas, Matplotlib, and Seaborn. Fluency in Unix/Linux environments, Python and ideally other standard bioinformatics tools (e.g. R, Perl, C, bash/csh/zsh, CUDA, OpenGL), ideally including hands-on experience with parallel processing. Demonstrated expertise in computational analysis of large data sets, ideally in imaging. Advanced technical computer skills as required for technical support specific to functional area and related systems. Preferred Qualifications Hands-on expertise with statistical descriptions of complex systems (e.g. energy, entropy, moments, etc.) and their theoretical underpinnings. Prior experience with/training in medical imaging. Experience building web applications/portals (e.g. Shiny Server or Python analogs). Competencies Decision Making:  Ability to make decisions that are guided by general instructions and practices requiring some interpretation. May make recommendations for solving problems of moderate complexity and importance. Problem Solving:  Ability to address problems that are varied, requiring analysis or interpretation of the situation using direct observation, knowledge and skills based on general precedents. Independence of Action:  Ability to set goals and determines how to accomplish defined results with some guidelines. Manager/Director provides broad guidance and overall direction. Written Communications:  Ability to summarize and communicate in English moderately complex information in varied written formats to internal and external customers. Oral Communications:  Ability to comprehend and converse in English to communicate effectively with medical center staff, patients, families and external customers. Knowledge:  Ability to demonstrate in-depth knowledge of concepts, practices and policies with the ability to use them in complex varied situations. Team Work:  Ability to act as a team leader for small projects or work groups, creating a collaborative and respectful team environment and improving workflows. Results may impact the operations of one or more departments. Customer Service:  Ability to provide a high level of customer service to patients, visitors, staff and external customers in a professional, service-oriented, respectful manner using skills in active listening and problem solving. Ability to remain calm in stressful situations. Physical Nature Of The Job Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally in carrying, lifting, pushing, pulling objects. Sitting most of the time, with walking and standing required only occasionally FLSA Status Exempt As a health care organization, we have a responsibility to do everything in our power to care for and protect our patients, our colleagues and our communities. Beth Israel Lahey Health requires that all staff be vaccinated against influenza (flu) and COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Learn more about this requirement. More than 35,000 people working together. Nurses, doctors, technicians, therapists, researchers, teachers and more, making a difference in patients' lives. Your skill and compassion can make us even stronger. Equal Opportunity Employer: MALE/FEMALE/VETRANS/DISABILITY/GENDER IDENTITY/SEXUAL ORIENTATION.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the role   The Professional Services Data Analyst position is aligned with the GS&PS Professional Services and Contingent Resource Management Team to generate, consolidate and analyze Procurement data and deliver spend and operational insights. The position will work in a collaborative team environment, with independent duties. The Data Analyst role will support the team to ensure data integrity and provide checks and balances via dashboard visualization and reports for data quality and oversight. In addition, the Data Analyst role will work with the Data and Tools team and the Professional Services team to gather reporting requirements to help define the data structure for any new sources of Procurement data, reporting and dashboarding capabilities. Responsibilities include,but are not limited to supporting the data and tools team in the development of the GS&PS operational, savings and spend dashboards, provide data analysis, documenting processes, working with the business to gather data/reporting/dashboard requirements, supporting business reporting requests and resolving data anomalies as identified. The Professional Services Business Analyst will also be responsible for supporting ad-hoc projects to execute on insights provided.     About the role   What you need to know:     Understand GS&PS processes, tools and the data collected in those processes   Support reporting requests, dashboard and data visualization development and data validation   Support administrative tasks and projects, as required.   Work with Professional Services team and Data and Tools team to analyze, define and document data/reporting requirements   Work with Data and Tools team to support reporting and dashboard development requests and validation of reports and dashboards   Performs other duties as assigned or requested   What were looking for:     5+ years as a business data analyst role, including reporting and dashboard development   Minimum of 2 years of experience in the Sourcing, Contract Management and Purchasing (Preferred)   Experience with dashboard development and data visualization within a Business Intelligence Platform (Power BI/Tableau/Qlik Sense)   Advanced Microsoft Office Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables, macros etc)   Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Access)   Familiarity with SAP, Ariba and Fieldglass applications   Strong negotiation, analytical, decision making, problem resolution and organizational skills.   Experience working with data warehouses, auditing data and identifying data anomalies & root causes   Client Servicing - ability to anticipate client (internal and external) needs and act proactively   Ability to manage multiple deliverables   High sense of ownership and responsibility to all stakeholders to ensure work quality.   Strong communication skills

title: AI Engineer
description:
Job Description This Artificial Intelligence Engineer opportunity is part of our Operational Transformation and Intelligent Automation Team. As an AI Engineer on our team, you will work with key systems across the PBM, HCB and Retail businesses, evaluating the latest technologies, designing, and delivering “art of the possible solutions” to improve operations and enhance member and client satisfaction. You will be a key member of our team, helping provide strategic solutions, evaluate processes and technologies, and develop AI applications to deliver production solutions to meet CVS goals and objectives. Some of the responsibilities you will have include:  Working with a team of professionals that examine end to end processes and design automation solutions using the latest technologies.  Working with third party technology providers and internal IT application and infrastructure teams to ensure timely delivery of the solution with a high degree of quality.  Performing calculations and applying computer skills to design and develop relevant software.  Collaborating with the project management office to ensure project reporting and escalation.  Technical presentations to key leadership and stakeholders.  Evaluation of Technology/Vendor Selection.  Analyzing data to uncover trends/patterns.  Creating test harnesses and manufactured data to test system efficacy.  Working with the Business team to address functional and performance defects.  Please note this position is available remote anywhere in the US. Pay Range The typical pay range for this role is: Minimum: $ 75,000 Maximum: $ 167,000 Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location. Required Qualifications  4+ years of experience with application development.  4+ years of experience programming with Python, R, Perl or any other Object-Oriented languages such as Java, LISP or Net.  2+ years of hands-on experience with Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning Technologies (AWS, Azure services, IBM Watson or other AI Platforms).  1+ years of experience in Data Modeling and or Data Mining. Preferred Qualifications  Strong Knowledge of Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, IVR and RPA solutions.  Proficient in analyzing complex systems (applications/data structures) and their associated relationships.  Data visualization experience with Tableau or other package.  Strong understanding of XML and XSD structures. Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine Learning, or related discipline. Master’s degree preferred. Business Overview Bring your heart to CVS Health Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver. Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable. We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an affirmative action employer, and is an equal opportunity employer, as are the physician-owned businesses for which CVS Health provides management services. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, promotion, or any other personnel action based on race, ethnicity, color, national origin, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
