title: Research Internship, Industrial Artificial Intelligence (AI)
description:
We are looking for graduate interns to join our “Physics Informed Artificial Intelligence” (PAI) research group in Princeton, NJ or remotely! PAI is part of Siemens’ central in-house research department - a strategic R&D partner for Siemens’ businesses. At PAI we work on understanding how prior knowledge can be brought into AI methods to facilitate robust solutions to the industrial challenges of our Siemens’ businesses, such as Predictive Maintenance, Planning and Control, Sustainable Design and many more. The Challenge  This intern will: Conduct applied research in industrial artificial intelligence, with a focus on one of the following topic areas:  Physics-Informed AI-based differential simulation surrogates for fluid and rigid body dynamics modeling and control in industrial metaverse applications Symplectic integration schemes with applications in Machine Learning (ML) Simulation techniques, such as closure model ML-assisted fast simulation for analog and mixed signal circuit simulations Data-centric AI/ weak supervision application to multivariate time series big data Graph machine learning, graph mining Industrial Knowledge Graphs and Semantic Modelling Design, develop and implement (research) prototypes and demonstrators under the guidance of your supervisor Contribute to our team’s R&D projects Create technical reports, presentations and/or scientific papers The Candidate  Qualified candidates will have/be: Currently pursuing your MS or PhD in Computer Science, Symbolic Systems, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related discipline Preferably graduating within the next 12 months and are considering a career in industrial research Demonstrated ability to work with Python or another programming language and have experience with two or more:  Deep Learning libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch or Julia  Physics-Aware AI frameworks such as Modulus Nvidia’s Warp, Omniverse Graph databases, Semantic Web Technologies such as RDFS/OWL and SPARQL Graph Analytics, Graph Machine Learning frameworks Excellent communication skills, eager to learn and be part of diverse team Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. Chubb is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. This role is oriented at developing cutting edge data science models towards improving claims outcomes using a combination of machine learning and natural language processing methods on structured and unstructured data. Execute all aspects of analytics initiatives including exploratory data analysis, machine learning model development, model evaluation, and benefit estimation. title: Director of Professional Services (Federal), AI -Start -Up (East Coast)
description:
AI-powered systems are increasingly being used to replace or augment human decision-making across a broad range of industries. These systems already impact many aspects of our lives and will continue to grow in their influence over the next two decades. Therefore, ensuring the reliability, safety, security, fairness, and understandability of these systems is critical. To date, tools to ensure that AI-powered systems meet these standards have lagged behind the tools used to develop them. This has led to two common outcomes: deployment of AI-powered systems without proper verification and validation, or conversely, failure to deploy a system after costly development time and resources due to a lack of trust in the system by stakeholders. This is where CalypsoAI comes in. We are building a suite of products and tools to facilitate the deployment of trustworthy AI by focusing on rigorous verification and validation testing. The ideal candidate: We are looking for a highly skilled individual with experience in managing delivery of complex software and AI project deployments to USG and DoD customers, with a track record of driving tangible value and outcomes for customers. Expertise and experience in application development, AI/ML and data integration are required in addition to domain experience across Federal agencies and DoD ecosystem. The primary measurement of success for this role will be on time delivery of SoWs and OTA contracts as well as installation of product. You’ll have a strong technical aptitude with technical individual contributor experience in a role such as software engineer or data scientist and a combination of skills: strategy consulting, facilitation, stakeholder management, project management, process optimization, analytics, and AI methods. You’ll thrive in a fast-paced environment and will bring new ideas, challenge us and roll up your sleeves when needed. This role requires US Citizenship. Active Department of Defense (DoD) security clearance (Secret or higher) is preferred. YOU WILL… Own projects from start to finish, staying consistently apprised of customer needs and adjusting plans as required based on customer feedback. This includes but is not limited to: Technical scoping Technical architecture and design Estimation and SoW writing Product installation/deployment Documenting the deployment environment Training customers Define and shape the service offering and define processes and standards for delivery Develop detailed, clear, and executable project plans in a timely fashion.  Maintain a thorough understanding of CalypsoAI’s offerings and how to technically integrate them into customer systems.  Work closely with the engineering and customer engagement teams to ensure the smooth deployment of products and required integrations into customer environments.  Create presentations and training for knowledge transfer (both internally and externally) Collaborate closely with existing Data Science, Sales, Engineering, and Product teams Be part of the extended management team and shape the future of Calypso AI YOU HAVE… 7+ years of project management experience in leadership roles Minimum of 7 years leading delivery teams in a SaaS and on-premise environments Proven experience supporting Federal agencies and working within DoD ecosystem Experience executing on Services deliverables pertaining to revenue, quotas, and customer retention metrics Ability to excel at working directly with customers to gather, prioritize, plan and execute solutions to customer business requirements as it relates to technology Strong aptitude to learn domains and products Extra strong analytical thinking, strong system perspective, and diligent process analysis skills Strong initiative, innovative thinking skills, and ability to analyze details and translate them into “big picture” view Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing product and respond strategically to customer needs Technical aptitude and proficiency with Professional Services, CRM tools, and Operations Strong level of cross-functional technical knowledge, and a proven track record in software development Project Management. title: VP of Operations
description:
VP of Operations at Vic.ai Location: Remote and New York City This is a fully remote position, full-time, with flexible working hours and work arrangements. The Vic.ai platform is reshaping how the world does B2B transactions: tracking business data used to be manual, now it's autonomous; reasoning about business data used to be report-oriented and simplistic, now it's real-time and statistically sophisticated. How do we do it? Leading-edge AI, highly-crafted UIs, and deep product thinking tying it all together. We're a Series B-funded company and are fortunate to have some renowned investors and partners: Costanoa Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, GGV Capital, and ICONIQ Capital. We are a remote-first company: our people occupy all 4 US timezones and 2 EU timezones. We have an office in Manhattan, New York. Our company is rethinking how B2B transactions and financial intelligence works....a mind-meltingly large market. We're a talented, hard-driving team led by experienced entrepreneurs. If you're an enthusiastic, detail-oriented, curious disruptor, come and build with us, you'll fit right in. Role  We are currently seeking a full-time Vice President of Operations interested in joining a high-growth stage startup. The mandate of the VP of Operations is simple but challenging: help build out our operations and play a key role in expanding Vic.ai globally. Above all, the successful candidate is a self-starter who is resourceful, organized, detail-oriented, communicative, and friendly. What we are looking for in our next VP of Operations…. We are looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for someone who has experience building and scaling a team in a B2B SaaS environment. You excel at building cross-functional relationships to achieve desired outcomes and you enjoy the balance between developing a strategy and operationalizing it. You have experience directly related to a broad set of initiatives including, for example, strategy; reporting; metrics; technology; staffing; career development; diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives; and leadership initiatives. You have several years of experience implementing products and driving adoption with enterprise clients. You are a self-starter who enjoys the autonomy to act on opportunities when you see them. You have a passion for innovation and disruption. You are curious and obsessed with continuous learning. As a role that focuses on achieving operational excellence and efficiency, you excel at: Putting company growth strategies into practice Leadership skills and finding solutions in situations with high ambiguity Working with teams to achieve operational excellence Building out teams in fast-growth companies What You'd Do…. As a leader of the Operations team, you will be responsible for a cross-functional team that owns and executes initiatives across the organization. What this entails but is not limited to: Ongoing business operations: Lead the team responsible for day-to-day business operations, compliance, and continuous process improvements across the organization.  External initiatives and projects: Operationally systemize and execute new initiatives and lead cross-functional undertakings (ex. Opening a new market, supporting other teams expansion).  Cross-functional process optimization: Creating and continuously optimizing internal processes and routines (ex. Product/Engineering, or onboarding of new customers). Enable partners to be successful in ongoing operations (example: integrations build, sales support, product implementation support, etc).  Customer Delivery: Responsible for successful Vic.ai platform implementation for large enterprise customers. Accountable for on-time delivery to customers for complex onboarding initiatives in collaboration with product and engineering teams. In addition, we know that building a super tight machinery that takes a signed contract into a happy live customer is THE most important thing for the next 6-12 months.  Customer Success: Customer onboarding projects and ongoing relationship management, Support & Help Center, and customer health monitoring.  Data Analytics: Continue to build out our data analytics service offering, and provide visibility and data insights to our customers as well as the company internally.  You'll collaborate the closest with…. Chief of Staff: who will frequently require Ops to execute leadership initiatives.  Business Development: who will frequently require Ops help to execute.  Product: who you will partner with to research, and analyze new opportunities.  Operations Staff: you will be leading a growing team of operations directors and managers.  People Team: who you will partner with on employee development, various people and culture initiatives, as well as attracting and retaining new talent.  If you fit the following, you'll love growing with us…. 8+ years of progressively responsible operational management experience, data analysis, reporting, and planning in a B2B SaaS environment Passion for helping our clients transform their businesses and be successful Exceptional leadership skills, including the ability to implement change Proven success in building and scaling teams and systems  Superior project and change management skills  Strong balance of problem-solving, decision-making, creative and analytical skills, with the demonstrated ability to successfully drive both strategy and execution Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to manage complex projects and geographically dispersed teams Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills, as well as excellent communication skills Experience working in a fast-moving, high-growth company; high comfort level working in a matrixed organization Expectation of regular business travel Bachelor's Degree required (Master's Degree preferred) or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience What We Offer…. An exciting work environment operating at the forefront of AI technology development Competitive salary 401K, health/vision/wellness perks (including health insurance coverage option 100% free for the employee AND family and perks like ClassPass and CitiBike!) Generous maternity and paternity leave Virtual team-building events & awesome swag  People-focused culture, adding value and fun to our meetings Generous vacation time, family and travel-friendly environment Work alongside an enthusiastic, collegial, and driven team in a highly meritocratic environment  The opportunity to work remotely, including workstation setup A team-focused culture. The team builds the product, the business builds the team As an employee-first culture, Vic.ai also offers in-person retreats to employees. We love connecting in person as a remote-first company. We make it a benefit to our employees to come together and be able to celebrate our accomplishments, work together in person, and enjoy team-building activities! We hold company retreats multiple times a year to keep our Vic.ai community strong. Check out all the fun we are having @vicdotai on our Instagram page. Also, don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date on our AI technology and new career opportunities to join our teams.  Acceptance and inclusion for everyone is at the heart of our company. We strive for diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects the entire  Vic.ai  community. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Sr. Developer Advocate (MLOps/ML/AI)
description:
About Pachyderm: Pachyderm is the leader in data versioning and pipelines for MLOps. We're building the data foundation that allows data science teams to automate and scale their machine learning lifecycle while guaranteeing reproducibility. With over $40 million in three rounds of funding from leading investors like Benchmark, Microsoft M12, and Y Combinator, Pachyderm is committed to building industrial strength capabilities for Data Centric AI. Pachyderm offers a commercial Enterprise Edition and an open source Community Edition. Pachyderm helps customers get their ML and AI projects to market faster, lower data processing and storage costs, and supports strict data governance requirements. Pachyderm is growing fast and still small, so joining means you are getting in right at the ground floor and that you will have an enormous impact on the success and direction of the company and product. Pachyderm has always and will always embrace a "Remote-first" approach to growing our team. This allows us to hire a diverse group of individuals across the country (and world!) while giving our team members the flexibility to work from anywhere. Being a member of The Pach means joining a supportive team that cares about you, values kindness and works hard to create an open and transparent workplace. Job Summary Pachyderm is looking for a Sr. Developer Advocate (see also Developer Relations Manager) to be the face of Pachyderm to our community and users. You'll work across marketing, content, evangelism, and product teams to write new content and engage with users and prospects online. You'll establish strong relationships with data scientists and ML Engineers around the world in a scalable way, by crafting great resources to help them build with Pachyderm, including open source demos, code samples, documentation, how-to guides, blog posts, and demo hours. You'll foster developer communities, championing their interests and translating their feedback into actionable product insights. Primary Job Responsibilities Create content to educate, inspire, and equip technical audiences with tools and techniques that make them better at their craft.  Collaborate with different teams, guest authors, customers and content partners, to come up with topic ideas.  Work with the community team to develop and engage the Pachyderm Slack community, listening to feedback and rewarding community members for their participation.  Engage with external contributors and communities on topics related to Pachyderm.  Organize community and evangelism events.  Communicate user requirements and provide input to product management on feature enhancements and future product direction.  Required Skills 2+ years of technical writing experience.  Basic knowledge of Python or other programming languages.  Proficient in producing DevRel content (blogs, dev demos, youtube tutorials).  Superb written and verbal communication skills, with extensive experience in public speaking and/or technical writing.  Maintains a strong and credible presence in online platforms or social media channels relevant to developers, developer tools, data scientists, ML/AI Engineers, and other technical professionals.  Entrepreneurial and self-driven. You thrive at solving open-ended problems, social engineering, engaging individuals on their interested and teaching/expressing your own Ability to rapidly come to consensus with colleagues. Strong opinions, loosely held. No ego Amigo! You are comfortable and skilled at communicating to and gaining traction with audiences of all sizes from meetings with the CEO, to customer meetings, external events and all hands meetings.  Experience in Data Science, AI/ML, Kubernetes, Docker, or other open source software is a strong plus.  Benefits: Significant equity, 401k and full benefits (100% medical, dental and vision for employees, 50% for all dependents).  Flexible PTO - work/life balance is important and we want you to take time off to rejuvenate! Remote friendly- we were remote before remote was cool and we intend to continue to invest in a remote first culture.  Tons of fun swag and surprise packages sent to your doorstep.  Tech and office stipends - what you buy is yours to keep.  Education and donation stipends - we want to support your career growth and the community.  Supportive parental leave (see also: work/life balance).  Encouraged fun - game days, fun activities, zoom hangouts and more (and - when responsible - visits to our home base for team on-sites) We can't wait to meet you and hope you'll join our PACH!

title: Data Analytics - AI, & ML for High-Impact Weather Applications
description:
Description The School of Meteorology at the University of Oklahoma ( http://meteorology.ou.edu ) invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant or Associate Professor focused on  Data Analytics.  The Mission of the College of Atmospheric and Geographic Sciences is to provide a world-class academic experience that promotes convergent and innovative education and research at the intersections of weather, climate, and sustainability. To fulfill our mission, we are dedicated to preparing students for successful careers in the private sector, academia, government agencies, and non-governmental organizations. Data Analytics . We seek an innovative scholar to contribute to research on the applications of data analytics to weather and climate. The ideal candidate will use data analytics approaches, such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML), to improve the prediction and/or understanding of weather and climate, especially for time scales ranging from subhourly through subseasonal to seasonal. This position offers collaborative potential with the new OU Data Science Institute for Societal Challenges . Examples of expertise sought include, but are not limited to: i) The development and use of analytics techniques to process big data and model outputs, ii) Advancing the design of hybrid AI/numerical models, and iii) Furthering the use of data analytics techniques to improve our understanding and ability to predict high-impact and severe weather, which are increasing with climate change. This position is embedded within a multi-year College-level effort to become a global leader in Earth System Predictions and Community Resilience Research. This is one of seven positions in a successful strategic cluster hire in High Impact and Severe Weather research that began in 2021. The Committee Chair for this search is Dr. Cameron Homeyer, chomeyer@ou.edu . School of Meteorology :  The ideal candidate will have the potential to contribute to research and educational activities in our intellectually diverse department. Applicants must possess a PhD in Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, Computer Science, or a related discipline at time of appointment. The successful applicant will be expected to develop a vigorous, independent research program, to teach in the School of Meteorology (the standard load is 1-1), and to contribute to mentorship and advisement of students in our undergraduate and graduate degree programs. The School of Meteorology is currently composed of 28 faculty and has a long and distinguished history of excellence in various sub-fields of meteorology. Our vision, i.e., to “ Develop the School into a globally- engaged, student-centered atmospheric science program to advance the Nation’s Weather, Water, and Climate enterprise, by leveraging our strengths in research, education, and community engagement” is articulated in the recently developed Strategic Plan ( SP2030 ). The University of Oklahoma  is a Carnegie-R1 comprehensive public research university known for excellence in teaching, research, and community engagement, serving the educational, cultural, economic and health-care needs of the state, region, and nation from three campuses: Norman, Health Sciences Center in Oklahoma City and the Schusterman Center in Tulsa. OU enrolls over 30,000 students and has more than 2700 full-time faculty members in 21 colleges. OU is committed to growth in research, student success, affordability, and societal enrichment, as articulated in the Lead On strategic plan released in 2020. Norman is a vibrant university town of around 113,000 inhabitants with a growing entertainment and art scene. With outstanding schools, amenities, and a low cost of living, Norman is a perennial contender on “best place to live” rankings. Visit http://www.ou.edu/flipbook and http://soonerway.ou.edu for more information. Within an easy commute, Oklahoma City features a dynamic economy and outstanding cultural venues adding to the region’s growing appeal. Qualifications Applicants must have completed their PhD by the time of appointment.  Application Instructions  To apply, submit a letter of interest, a curriculum vitae , a list of three people who can serve as references (with e-mail addresses and telephone numbers), and separate brief (~2-3 pages each) statements regarding 1) research, 2) teaching, and 3) service. The research statement should summarize your prior contributions to research and your goals for developing a research program at OU. The teaching statement should summarize past instructional and mentorship experiences, plans/goals for teaching at OU (including existing and proposed courses), and advising a diverse cohort of undergraduate and graduate students. Please submit all these materials in one file to http://apply.interfolio.com/112260 Screening of applications will begin on October 15, 2022, and will continue until the positions are filled.

title: Data Scientist (Linguist)
description:
Data Scientist  GAP INTERNATIONAL  – A unique, purpose-driven, consulting company Global Management Consulting firm Gap International, based in the Philadelphia area, is looking for a qualified Data Scientist with a background in linguistics, machine learning, NLP, statistical analysis, probabilistic programming, semantic annotation, language modeling. Data Scientists are crucial to the ongoing development and execution of our linguistic work and consulting methodology. Qualified data scientists will work to study language and its impact on business performance and results. Through this work, we provide our clients access to sustainable growth for their businesses. You will become a member of our dynamic professional team, working both internally for Gap International's business, with opportunities to consult in our client system. Accountabilities for this role would include contributions to Gap International's business such as: Providing analytics, data visualization, machine learning and language modeling Leverage Machine learning and AI technologies to model, simulate and explore linguistic data and theories Extract semantic vectors and meaning/information from unstructured text Classification of query intent for the purposes of semantic web classification Responsibilities Conduct research on new ways to apply our proprietary linguistics work to business performance Develop and submit research articles and papers based on our proprietary methodologies and applications to business Adapt existing linguistic work to current and future consulting models and approaches Conduct original research on language and its implications on Gap International's focus areas Qualifications Master's degree or above in data science, psycholinguistics, cognitive linguistics, computational linguistics (or other related field) from a leading academic institution with a strong academic record Strong background in Semantics and Syntax Interest in the business application of data science and linguistics Demonstrated ambition with a high-performance track record Client-facing experience preferred Able to work effectively alone as well as part of a team Potential travel domestically and/or internationally (when it is safe to do so) Current resident or able to relocate to Philadelphia area PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES Python, Java, R, SQL PyTorch, TensorFlow Ability to operate in a UNIX/Linux environment About Gap International Gap International is a global performance consulting company based just outside of Philadelphia. We specialize in helping leaders articulate and fulfill the boldest possible future for their business, creating breakthrough outcomes and aligning the organization's actions to be consistent with that future. For over 40 years, we have had an expertise in identifying and shifting mindsets in the organization to deliver unprecedented, quantifiable business results. With proven and proprietary methodologies that embed lasting change across an organization, our work unleashes teams across the business to innovate and create new pathways to achieve the desired outcomes for their business. GAP INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATES Purposeful people at work impacting companies around the world People who thrive in a learning environment and enjoy learning, growing, and performing at their best; energized to continually push beyond their comfort zone Comfortable with ambiguity; eager to take on things they don't know how to do Curious and flexible when it comes to their own growth and development, as well as receptive to coaching and feedback to maximize their potential Willing to communicate and contribute thoughts, insights and new ideas to senior leaders both internally and externally What We Offer Purpose-driven work An unmatched culture and commitment to ongoing growth and development Highly competitive health benefits Generous 401k Bonus based on company and individual performance Tuition reimbursement International travel opportunities LOCATION Gap International associates are based out of our corporate office in the Philadelphia metropolitan area. 700 Old Marple Road, Springfield, PA 19064 Gap International is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration.

title: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning (AI/ML) Engineer
description:
Radiance Technologies is seeking an Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML) engineer to support the U.S. Army Space and Missile Defense Command (USASMDC) Technical Center, Space Directorate and Systems Engineering Directorate (SED) office in Huntsville, AL. The AI/ML engineer will support efforts to design and develop Army science and technology (S&T) and research and development (R&D) programs that deliver PNT capabilities to the Warfighter in the field. This position requires a talented AI/ML engineer that could work within a multi-disciplined team by providing advisory technical expertise, feedback, analysis, and other assistance. The AI/ML engineer will assist with computational activities and assessment for software products. Responsibilities Provide expertise in AI/ML to produce high quality, professional, and innovative solutions for complex and technologically advanced AI/ML-problems. Perform data, image, and video processing to support development and evaluation. Provide technical support in the areas of Computer Vision, AI/ML, Deep Learning, Data Science, and Image Science for collection assets and data sources. Work with SMEs to translate manual data analysis into automated analytics and with developers for proper algorithm implementation. Apply technical knowledge of state of the art and novel approaches in ML. Participate and provide technical guidance during the system design activities. Work with Government to design, develop, test, implement, and maintain visualization capabilities for supporting and integrating PNT operational capabilities into existing systems. Implement human computer interfaces, multi-modal interaction techniques, and non-traditional geospatial visualizations (e.g., software toolkits, libraries, efficient algorithms). Apply experience to help coordinate testing and evaluation of research efforts and transition research into operational environments. Exercise independent and professional judgment under moderate supervision to experimentally prove innovative and effective solutions to complex AI technical problems. Desired Qualifications Master’s degree in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related disciplines, with an emphasis in artificial intelligence or machine learning. Minimum of 10 years’ experience supporting AI/ML-related projects. Familiarity with GPS, PNT, and/or Navigation Warfare (NAVWAR), such as Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS) and GNSS receivers. S. citizenship with an active Secret clearance. Required Skills Bachelor’s degree in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related disciplines, with an emphasis in artificial intelligence or machine learning. Able to coordinate with, as well as to contribute to, a small team of PNT engineers. Self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills. U.S. citizenship with the ability to obtain a Secret clearance. Required Experience Minimum 5 years’ experience supporting AI/ML-related projects. Proficient with artificial intelligence, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, and/or image processing.

title: Data Scientist
description:
At Precise Solutions, we are looking for top talent consultants to bring on as employees of our organization and service our clients in the various Life Sciences Industries. We are much more than a consulting firm! Precise Solutions provides competitive compensation packages with great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off and employer-based 401k contributions. We Currently Have An Immediate Need For The Following Job Title: Data Scientist Location:  Remote until virus restrictions are removed. Onsite in Lake County, Illinois after restrictions. Compensation:  $60.00 per hour, Paid Time off, Company 401k contributions, Health, dental, and vision insurance. Total Annual Compensation including benefits is $138,000.00 Note: Please do not submit resumes with candidate photos, they will not be considered. Enterprise Data Scientist is the key player in driving advanced analytics and maturing AI at client, supporting multiple use cases across various business technology organizations within the client; covering but not limited to language/image processing, machine learning analytics, deep learning analytics etc. The use cases cover areas in the client’s research, commercial operations, manufacturing systems, supply chain planning, logistics, infrastructure processes etc. The successful Data Scientist will translate business needs into analytic questions; conduct data exploration leveraging data from disparate data stores cross the clients systems (including data lakes, traditional relational and non-relational data); develop model specification; design and perform rigorous analyses of operational, customer, and financial data; and translate these analytic findings into leading information for our business partners. This position would act as an advisor to executive and management level decision makers. This individual would provide ‘end-to-end’ guidance on deployment of machine learning models including data governance and industry best practices with a lens towards agility and efficiency, leveraging a) data science and statistical methods, b) programming languages such as R, python, Spark, SAS, c) libraries such as TensorFlow, Pytorch etc. d) technology capabilities such as containers and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes) in on-prem, cloud and hybrid infrastructures. Responsibilities Consult with internal and external stakeholders to determine how best to apply descriptive analysis and/or statistical learning to support business objectives across AbbVie’s use cases. Demonstrate a thorough understanding of concepts related to statistical methods, language and image processing and operations research and how to use them for solving real world problems. Apply linear models, machine learning algorithms, times series forecasting, and modern optimization methods (i.e. metaheuristics) to understand and/or predict events impacting various business operations. Understand the guidelines needed to build credible and efficient simulation models used to inform the decision-making process. Collaborate with subject matter experts and data engineers to deploy advanced analytic solutions into the operational environments. Adhere to agile project management frameworks and set the direction of data science initiatives  Qualifications Masters or Bachelors in quantitative discipline (e.g. applied math, operation research, computer science, etc.) Lifesciences, pharma, healthcare analytics background preferred. Practical experience with times series forecasting, monte carlo analysis, spatial analysis, and/or machine learning (random forest, neural nets, SVM, etc.) Familiarity and use with public datasets such as Clinicaltrials.gov, imagenet, COCO etc. Familiarity with Machine Learning solution offerings/operationalize from cloud providers such as AWS (ex. Sagemaker), Azure, GCP. Familiarity with the concepts of container-based machine learning models, automation and operations. Familiarity with language models (SpaCy, NLTK, Stanford NLP) and using them to operationalize and enhance chatbot user experience. Familiarity with navigating in both a relational (Teradata-based) and non-relational (Hadoop) environment. SQL skillset is strongly desired. Knowledge of Java/Scala/Apache Spark is a bonus Proficiency in R/Python; familiarity with libraries such as Tensorflow, café, Pytorch etc. Practiced in exploratory data analysis (EDA) and manipulating large data sets Capable of accessing external data sources through various APIs (e.g. google distance matrix, quandl financial data, etc.) Powered by JazzHR

title: Data Analyst SME
description:
About The Company At Slate Technologies we are bringing fresh minds and tools to the world of Smart Buildings, Smart Infrastructure, Sustainability, architecture, and construction. With a credible team from world renowned institutions, we are leading the way in transforming the way buildings and Infrastructure comes to life. Better decisions happen in construction when you have better context, without context stakeholders are unable to see the right information, at the right time to make confident and quick choices. That's why we created Slate, a Virtual Digital Assistant that helps you identify and evaluate information in your business so that you can make better decisions, save time and money and improve project outcomes. Our mission at Slate is to help improve each construction professional impact construction productivity by revealing the timely context that helps them make earlier, better decisions. Slate’s “Digital Assistant'' uses machine learning and AI to execute multi-dimensional analysis across internal and external data sources. This includes public data such as weather, labor and traffic with the dark data locked in silos and non-integrated systems within their own and sub-contractor organizations. Want to join us on this incredible journey? What You Will Be Doing Exciting career opportunity in a Worldwide Organization, within the Customer Engagement Team shaping the design of a new generation of products and solutions that are transformational in nature. In this position, you (and your data skills) will play a key role in informing and shaping the design of a state-of-the-art AI system to modernize the smart buildings and infrastructure space. A unique opportunity at the intersection of customer engagement, industry, product, and engineering, you will work with some of the brightest minds, leading customers and creating solutions from the ground up. The Customer Engagement Team also works closely with Slate’s partners to showcase how Slate’s decision assistant can transform the way they view and action data, and always has an eye looking ahead, researching, and exploring innovative solutions. Remote. Essential Duties & Responsibilities In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to use your data analyst/engineering skills to discover and analyze patterns across datasets from our customers and partners, as well as large industry datasets. You will be at the “data front line,” developing approaches, examples, and data stories, showcasing how datasets can be integrated into Slate’s decision assistant, and providing significant value to our customers, transforming the industry along the way. Collaborate with other Subject Matter Experts and team members, as well as external stakeholders, initially to define key questions to explore within the datasets. Creatively aggregate and analyze numerous datasets (from industry partners, as well as the design and construction customers) to research and create specific examples, which provide a springboard for the Engineering Data Team.  Demonstrate how large, complex datasets can be utilized to meet customer business requirements. Collaborate with the Engineering Data Science team to identify how engage effectively with the data pipeline architecture. Collaborate with the Engineering Data Science Team to utilize the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. Data storytelling interacting with customers, external partners, and internal team Create data tools for analytics and for use by the team.  Familiarity with multiple programming languages and knowledge of SQL and AWS technologies, as well scripting languages and tools such as Grasshopper and Dynamo. Ability to think out-of-the-box, and creatively explore what is possible at the intersection of design and construction industry datasets. Required Experience/Skills Master’s or bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Analytics Engineering, and/or related disciplines. 6+ years of experience in data analyst / engineering. Strong Python skills with focus in data analysis/engineering. Knowledge of algorithms and data structures. Understanding of machine learning models, and model training. Working knowledge of deep learning models. Strong communication, collaboration, and data-storytelling skills. Self-motivated and enthusiastic about collaborating to shape and design next generation tools. Ability to work remote and on customer location/sites. Customer facing personality that likes to engage with customers and their data to help them understand how to see their data in the Slate solution. Desirable: Knowledge of Building Construction Environment a plus. If this sounds like you, you should apply right away so we can discuss how you can be a part of this exciting, fast-paced organization! Slate Technologies, Inc is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. title: Intern, Analytics & Data - Data Science, Summer 2023 - 011360 (Multiple Opportunities Available)
description:
The Summer College Internship Program is a 10-week, paid internship experience that provides undergraduate and graduate students the opportunity to attend development workshops, network, and be part of our company. Our college interns work on meaningful projects, are mentored under their respective managers, and continue to develop throughout the entire summer. In addition, through the internship program, our interns can attend development workshops that are focused on key concepts within the divisional tracks of Information Technology, Actuarial, Analytics & Data, Clinical Studies, web-based Customer Experience, Digital Operations, and other technical based degree programs.  This is a paid 10-week summer internship from the first Monday in June to the second Friday in August (up to 40 hours per week).   May reside in either a technical or non-technical area   Development events are provided to help with the transition from school to the corporate environment.   Housing is not provided as part of our program.  Essential Responsibilities/Accountabilities Within this role, you are part of a highly collaborative team with a wide range of skills that develops innovative machine learning (ML)/artificial intelligence (AI) solutions to help improve member health outcomes and solve a wide range of business problems. You will build the skills necessary to function as a full stack data scientist/machine learning engineer by developing and enhancing your programing skills - using R, Spark, Python, and SQL and expanding your understating of machine learning algorithms through health care applications. All members of the data science are empowered to take initiative and bring new ideas to the team. Analytics & Data Specific  Works with a mentor from a specific Analytics & Data discipline which ranges from Data Management & Integration (Data Warehousing & Big Data), Analytics & Reporting (Business Intelligence, Analytics, and Data Science), and Data Governance (Data Profiling).   Depending on the discipline the intern may assist with the following:   Assists with Big Data on network performance, using tools to manipulate diverse real-world data and develop complex data visualizations; use data-driven metrics to create visibility into network performance, to mine data, and solve problems.   Assists with predictive modelling, forecasting, and Data Science related tasks.   Conduct data profiling analyses to ensure data quality.   Develop reporting, analysis, and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI, Cognos, SAS, R, Python, or possibly other analytical tools as necessary.   Works with a technical mentor and provides support to key strategic projects.   Responsible for work assignments and possible responsibilities that vary according to business need and departmental opportunities, in addition to student’s qualifications   Duties will vary with assignment, specific divisional callouts are listed below   Functions performed are technical in nature and will cover a broad range of business-related projects   Creates and delivers presentation at completion of internship   Consistently demonstrates high standards of integrity by supporting the Lifetime Healthcare Companies’ mission and values, adhering to the Corporate Code of Conduct and leading to the Lifetime Way values and beliefs.   Maintains high regard for member privacy in accordance with the corporate privacy policies and procedures.   Regular and reliable attendance is expected and required.   Performs other functions as assigned by management.  Minimum Qualifications Our ideal candidate will have experience with R, Python, SQL, Spark Desired majors include: Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Software Engineering General Technical  Must be in good academic standing.   Strong communication skills and the ability to interface with staff at all levels of the company.   Experience using a desktop computer in a professional environment.   Experience with Microsoft Office Suite.   Demonstrates strong organizational and prioritization skills.   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.   Proactive approach to work, displaying creativity and flexibility in completing their assigned tasks.   Commitment to continuous improvement of their own skill and team functioning.   Must be self-motivated and able to work independently, as well as on intra- and inter- departmental teams where needed.  Physical Requirements  Ability to work at a computer for two or more hours at a time.   Ability to use a phone and/or TTD as needed.  The Lifetime Healthcare Companies aims to attract the best talent from diverse socioeconomic, cultural and experiential backgrounds, to diversify our workforce and best reflect the communities we serve. Our mission is to foster an environment where diversity and inclusion are explicitly recognized as fundamental parts of our organizational culture. We believe that diversity of thought and background drives innovation which enables us to provide leading-edge healthcare insurance and services. With that mission in mind, we recruit the best candidates from all communities, to diversify and strengthen our workforce. Our Company Culture Employees are united by our Lifetime Way Values & Behaviors that include compassion, pride, excellence, innovation and having fun! We aim to be an employer of choice by valuing workforce diversity, innovative thinking, employee development, and by offering competitive compensation and benefits. We are the rare startup that has 4 years of profitable growth without raising venture capital. Gridmatic is a great place to work with a culture that values teamwork, continuous learning, diversity, and inclusion. We are environmentally and data-driven, with a growth-oriented mindset and we value integrity as much as excellence. We are looking for an AI Researcher who is capable of expanding the horizons of our technology as we work to accelerate the decarbonization of the electricity system. This role involves investigating new types of technologies to solve problems we already solve, as well as designing solutions to problems we don’t yet solve. This job requires the ability to develop a deep understanding of the relevant topics and then rapidly carry out experiments to determine whether certain methods could form effective solutions. A love of learning is an absolute must for this role, as it requires constant learning of both engineering and mathematical concepts, as well as economics and electricity market related topics. Responsibilities Applying cutting edge ML and optimization techniques to problems in the energy space.  Develop understanding of mathematics and mechanisms of energy markets in order to be able to discover and adapt appropriate methods to solve specific problems.  Identify, formulate, and solve optimization problems related to portfolio optimization and real time control of devices on the grid.  Keep abreast of latest advances in ML and optimization research in order to consider if any new methods are especially promising for problems in the electricity market space.  Generalize and unify problem frameworks across electricity markets to utilize the same solutions across markets.  Requirements Proven experience researching and implementing relevant machine learning models.  Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture.  Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms.  Ability to write robust code in Python or Julia.  Familiarity with ML frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn).  Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.  Excellent communication and teamwork skills.  Enthusiasm for learning.  BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; PhD is a plus.  Join our team and make a difference! Click below or email us at careers@gridmatic.com.

Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. In this role, they will support all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions to ETL, from performing analyses to delivery of insights to decision-makers, with particular attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce and consume it. title: Product Manager, AI/ML
description:
The Opportunity AI is rapidly changing the world. From processing job applications and credit decisions, to making content recommendations and helping researchers analyze genetic markers at scale -- many aspects of our daily lives are touched by machine learned systems in some way. Arize is the leading machine learning observability platform to help ML teams discover issues, diagnose problems, and improve the results of machine learning models. In short: we are here to build world class software that helps make AI work better. The Team Our team is working to define the "canonical stack" for ML workflows, by solving the toughest problems in ML today: how to manage, observe and improve models at scale in a responsible way. The product team has deep technical and strategic backgrounds from leading AI/ML companies (Uber, Cruise, Spotify, Apple) and experience shipping market leading platforms at scale. Working with this team is an opportunity to develop further as a PM leader in a rapidly growing space by collaborating with some of the best in class ML Engineers and Data Scientists in the industry. What You'll Do You will be owning, strategizing, and developing a large portion of Arize AI's core product roadmap.  From ideation to creation, you will be involved in all stages of the product life cycle.  You will be engaging with our customers directly to gather meaningful insight and feedback in order to create a world class product.  You will be working cross functionally with internal and external stakeholders; including engineering, design, marketing, and sales to drive our product strategy into production.  You will be responsible for communicating and integrating competitive analysis, usability research, and market analysis into product requirements.  Utilize your understanding in ML or related technical space in order to contribute to Arize AI's main product offering.  What We're Looking For 2-3+ years of relevant product management experience or previous ML experience with strong product ownership.  Strong track record of producing in a new domain while building new products quickly and efficiently.  Experience and/or knowledge of working within machine learning, or data platforms and infrastructure.  Experience working directly with customers and promoting community discussions in order to gather client feedback.  Experience driving data-informed product strategy into production.  Bonus Points, But Not Required Previous engineering and/or tech lead experience Experience in API design Early startup experience Experience working with Figma or similar design tools More About Arize Arize's mission is to make the world's AI work and work for the people. Our founders came together through a common frustration: investments in AI are growing rapidly across businesses and organizations of all types, yet it is incredibly difficult to understand why a machine learning model behaves the way it does after it is deployed into the real world. Learn more about Arize in an interview with our founders: https://www.forbes.com/sites/frederickdaso/2020/09/01/arize-ai-helps-us-understand-how-ai-works/#322488d7753c Diversity & Inclusion @ Arize Our company's mission is to make AI work and make AI work for the people, we hope to make an impact in bias industry-wide and that's a big motivator for people who work here. We actively hope that individuals contribute to a good culture Regularly have chats with industry experts, researchers, and ethicists across the ecosystem to advance the use of responsible AI Culturally conscious events such as LGBTQ trivia during pride month We have an active Lady Arizers subgroup

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
About EliseAI  Our company was born with a powerful vision: to improve business efficiency without sacrificing human connection to make quality housing more accessible. With that vision in mind, we built Elise — our revolutionary conversational AI that can answer any and every question in real time, automate business processes, and allow seamless collaboration between teams. At EliseAI, our skilled team of engineers, sales and operations talent is building the future of conversational AI. EliseAI is well-funded by VCs, strategic real estate investors, and customers and was started by technical co-founders from MIT and the University of Cambridge.  About The Role  EliseAI is growing quickly and you’ll be using our data deriving insights that drive product strategy. You will work closely with the software development and automation teams, designing and building out the infrastructure for 24/7 service for our first million apartments and beyond. You will have a huge impact on a product used by thousands of people a day. We are a fully in-office company with a beautiful new office located at E 33rd Street and Park Ave.  What You'll Do  Build our core conversational AI that automates the leasing process and helps our customers operate their apartment communities more efficiently.  Develop new features that increase value for our customers.  Design meaningful improvements to our ML Ops and data infrastructure  Propose meaningful improvements to our software architecture and design patterns.  Research and publish innovative approaches to conversational AI   About You  We’re looking for someone who Is driven and excited to join a highly productive team composed of engineers and scientists at a fast-growing startup Has 2+ years of coding experience in Python or another language Has hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch or TensorFlow  Has strong fundamentals in machine learning and statistics evidenced by a track record of independent quantitative research (academic or industry) or projects Has Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science or a related quantitative field Willing to work in person at NYC headquarters with your team 4-5 days per week Nice to haves include PHD in quantitative discipline such as computer science, physics, or similar  Experience putting machine learning models into production Experience with natural language processing, especially conversational AI Linux/Unix experience Familiarity with AWS or similar cloud provider Why join Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded startup that’s scaling. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.  Benefits  In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits: Equity in the company in the form of stock options  Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%  Fully paid parental leave Commuter benefits  401k benefits Monthly fitness stipend Our brand new Midtown south office with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company paid lunch Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program Unlimited vacation and paid holidays We'll cover relocation packages from outside of the Greater NYC metro area - we'll make the move exciting, not painful.

title: Machine Learning Engineer – 3D computer vision, Autopilot AI
description:
What to Expect  You will be part of a team of computer vision experts that research, design, implement, optimize, and deploy neural networks and computer vision algorithms that advance the state of the art in perception for autonomous driving.  What You’ll Do  Train neural networks for autonomous driving tasks, such as object detection, pose estimation, depth estimation, keypoint detection & tracking, SLAM, etc. Participate in the complete computer vision task life cycle: develop a new task or neural architecture, optimize it for execution on our in-vehicle compute platform, deploy it to a development build, work with peer engineering teams to integrate it into our planning and controls stack, and validate its safety with our QA team.  Stay abreast of advances in machine learning, particularly in the areas of object detection, object tracking, depth estimation, SLAM, neural radiance fields (NeRF). What You’ll Bring Strong experience with Python, C++, and software engineering best practices.  An “under the hood” knowledge of deep learning: layer details, loss functions, optimization, etc.  Fluency with common neural network architectures for computer vision.  Expertise in one of these areas: object detection, object tracking, pose estimation, depth estimation, multi-view stereo architectures, neural radiance fields (NeRF), video networks, keypoint detection & tracking, SLAM.  Experience with PyTorch, or another major deep learning framework such as TensorFlow.  Experience with data manipulation tools including jupyter notebooks, numpy, scipy, matplotlib, scikit-learn, Python & Bash scripting, Linux environment.  (bonus) Experience with SIMD/SIMT parallelism, GPU programming, multithreaded programming.  (bonus) Comfortable working in a shared cluster environment (e.g. Slurm, network filesystems).  (bonus) Record of driving research projects from start to end, including conception, experimentation, iteration, and integration into a working product.

title: AI Research Scientist
description:
Modern Intelligence is seeking an AI Research Scientist to help lead fundamental research and development into compositional, hierarchical neural networks and their application to the defense sector in areas such as sensor fusion, decision making, autonomy, complex inference, electronic warfare, and more. Modern is using proprietary advances in information and complexity theory to build one AI for defense. Our hierarchical approach provides a dramatic scaling advantage over classical neural networks, naturally enabling very high accuracy on few-shot learning for novel problems, and in many cases, the ability to solve previously-unsolvable problems. We’re looking for an experienced ML practitioner and insightful theorist who believes that there are fundamental, foundational improvements in the field just waiting to be discovered, and that the current incentives in the industry, towards incremental improvements and away from real innovation, create an enormous opportunity for smart people to rethink how we do ML. You’ll join us in improving our compression and NAS algorithms, you’ll bring your own theoretical contributions to the table, you’ll help communicate with our platform engineering team to turn our ideas into practical reality, and you’ll get your hands dirty with theoretically-motivated experiments and real-world problems. As an early hire, you will have the opportunity and active encouragement to grow into leadership and supervisory roles as the company expands. Qualifications PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or related field. Candidates still in their graduate program will be considered Strong proficiency in at least one popular ML framework, e.g. Tensorflow or Pytorch. The ideal candidate will have hand-rolled their own ML training environment, even if in a very limited capacity Strong proficiency in coding and data science Proficiency in Probability Theory and other mathematical areas relevant to ML. The ideal candidate will have strong proficiency in multiple areas of mathematics A demonstrable track record of foundational thinking in ML. The ideal candidate will have a publication record demonstrating relevant areas of interest and the ability to make non-incremental novel contributions Experience with computer vision models, natural language models, multimodal data and/or sensor fusion Excellent communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team If you’re a brilliant high-level thinker, and don’t want to waste your career on incremental advances; if you’re interested in working with an equally brilliant, dedicated, and close-knit team to develop groundbreaking approaches to ML; and if you want to see those approaches turn into real-world products that are orders of magnitude better than anything else on the market; then come work with us.

title: AI Advocate
description:
Our Purpose At Fiddler, we understand the implications of AI and the impact that it has on human lives. Our company was born with the mission of building trust into AI. With the rise of the internet, trust in AI has been degraded by a plethora of issues like spam, fraudulent transactions, hate speech, and online abuse. Fiddler enables organizations to get ahead of these issues by building trustworthy, transparent, and explainable AI solutions. Fiddler partners with AI-first organizations to help build a long-term framework for responsible AI practices, which, in turn, builds trust with their user base. Data Science, MLOps, and business teams use Fiddler AI to monitor, explain, analyze, and improve their AI solutions to identify performance gaps, mitigate bias, and drive better outcomes. Our platform enables engineering teams and business stakeholders alike to understand the “why” and how behind model outcomes. Our Founders Fiddler AI is founded by Krishna Gade (engineering leadership at Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, Microsoft) and Amit Paka (two-time founder with acquisitions by Samsung and PayPal and product roles at Expedia and Microsoft). We are backed by Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Lux Capital. Why Join Us Our team is motivated to unlock the AI opaque box and help society harness the power of AI. Joining us means you get to make an impact by helping reduce algorithmic bias and ensure that models in production across many different industries are transparent and ethical. We are an early stage startup, and have a rapidly growing team of intelligent and empathetic doers, thinkers, creators, builders, and everyone in between. Within Fiddler, there is ample opportunity for growth. The AI and ML industry has a rapid pace of innovation and the learning opportunities here are monumental. This is your chance to be a trailblazer. Fiddler is recognized as a pioneer in the field of Model Performance Management (MPM) and has received numerous accolades, including: 2022 a16z Data50 list, 2021 CB Insights AI 100 most promising startups, 2020 WEF Technology Pioneer, 2020 Forbes AI 50 most promising startups of 2020, and a 2019 Gartner Cool Vendor in Enterprise AI Governance and Ethical Response. By joining our brilliant (at least we think so) team, you will help pave the way in the MPM space. What You'll Do Educate. Be an industry thought leader and an evangelist for Model Performance Management Create. Nurture meaningful and thought-provoking content and conversations across podcasts, webinars, blogs, whitepapers, research papers, and more Nurture. Build relationships with and be present in multiple communities related to Data Science & MLOps Connect. Speak directly to our DS & MLOps users about their business needs, technical landscapes, and pain points. Give demos as needed Influence. Advocate for the needs of our data science community and bring their feedback back to the product and marketing teams Speak. Represent Fiddler at conferences, industry events, and additional public speaking engagements Become a product expert. Steep yourself in the experiences that data scientists have when using Fiddler, and champion ease, clarity, and transparency  What We're Looking For Bachelor’s degree in technology, data science, computer science, or a related field 3-5 years of experience as a Data Scientist or AI / Machine Learning Advocate Passionate about AI: you geek out on data science and machine learning theory and industry developments Technically knowledgeable on AI & ML concepts including model monitoring and explainable AI Experience speaking at public events Nice to have: Prior experience managing and contributing to DS, AI, and ML communities Fiddler is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: AI Machine Learning Engineer
description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security. To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees who are unvaccinated will be required to adhere to onsite safety protocols. Description: The Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS) Artificial Intelligence (AI) team is seeking motivated engineers with a strong background in software engineering, DevOps, artificial intelligence and machine learning to support the RMS AI team and product portfolio. The RMS AI team has an immediate opportunity for an engineer with a strong software background. The candidate will apply AI and optimization techniques to develop unique and proprietary solutions to our customers’ challenges. If you have an interest and passion for making AI / ML, this role is for you! At Lockheed Martin, we are driven by innovation and integrity, and we are excited to bring cutting edge technology to our customers & their missions. This role is expected to utilize current AI paradigms, algorithms, and models (e.g. deep learning, reinforcement learning, computer vision); applying these techniques in relevant domains to tackle sophisticated problems and create innovative solutions. This also requires a candidate to maintain awareness of emerging analytics, AI / ML, and domain-specific technologies. This role requires working within an Agile Scrum environment, including supporting sprint meetings (review, retrospective and planning), planning poker and backlog grooming. This job is aligned with our 21st Century Security (21CS AI) initiative to help the U.S. and its allies leverage emerging technologies to deter threats to economic prosperity and national security. Benefits Of Employment To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin champions an inclusive work environment that urges differences and big-picture thinking. Here Are Some Of The Benefits You Can Enjoy Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.  Medical {many choices of plans; some LM locations have on-site medical}  Dental  401k {with generous matching}  Paid time off including, {we have a 9x80 schedule which means: 25 three-day weekends}  Work/life balance, family-friendly environment  Career development, career-growth, and lots of learning opportunities for aspiring minds  Fun, talented and witty teammates  Knowledgeable, supportive and engaged leadership  Diverse, inclusive and community-minded organization  Mentorship opportunities  Rewards & recognition  Generous Tuition Reimbursement We support our employees, so they can support our mission. Basic Qualifications  Bachelor's or Master's Degree is Software Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related STEM degree.  Experience with AI/ML domain programming languages (e.g. Python, C++, Java, GO)  DevOps experience including CI/CD pipelines to build, test, deploy Desired Skills  Sonar, Signal Processing, Math and/or Algorithm development experience  Experience developing and deploying AI/ML models, and a knowledge of machine learning frameworks and deep learning toolsets (e.g. SciKit-learn, TensorFlow PyTorch, Caffe, Keras)  High Performance Compute (HPC) / Cluster management experience  Experience with software planning and execution throughout the requirements, development, design, build, test, and integration phases of a program & familiarity with transitioning prototype software to production, including rapid software prototyping experience to create minimal viable products for evaluation of options Job.Qualifications BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. Experience Level Experienced Professional

title: Developer Relations (MLOps/ML/AI)
description:
About Pachyderm: Pachyderm is the leader in data versioning and pipelines for MLOps. We're building the data foundation that allows data science teams to automate and scale their machine learning lifecycle while guaranteeing reproducibility. With over $40 million in three rounds of funding from leading investors like Benchmark, Microsoft M12, and Y Combinator, Pachyderm is committed to building industrial strength capabilities for Data Centric AI. Pachyderm offers a commercial Enterprise Edition and an open source Community Edition. Pachyderm helps customers get their ML and AI projects to market faster, lower data processing and storage costs, and supports strict data governance requirements. Pachyderm is growing fast and still small, so joining means you are getting in right at the ground floor and that you will have an enormous impact on the success and direction of the company and product. Pachyderm has always and will always embrace a "Remote-first" approach to growing our team. This allows us to hire a diverse group of individuals across the country (and world!) while giving our team members the flexibility to work from anywhere. Being a member of The Pach means joining a supportive team that cares about you, values kindness and works hard to create an open and transparent workplace. Job Summary Pachyderm is looking for a Developer Relations Manager (see also Sr. Developer Advocate) to be the face of Pachyderm to our community and users. You'll work across marketing, content, evangelism, and product teams to write new content and engage with users and prospects online. You'll establish strong relationships with data scientists and ML Engineers around the world in a scalable way, by crafting great resources to help them build with Pachyderm, including open source demos, code samples, documentation, how-to guides, blog posts, and demo hours. You'll foster developer communities, championing their interests and translating their feedback into actionable product insights. Primary Job Responsibilities Create content to educate, inspire, and equip technical audiences with tools and techniques that make them better at their craft.  Collaborate with different teams, guest authors, customers and content partners, to come up with topic ideas.  Work with the community team to develop and engage the Pachyderm Slack community, listening to feedback and rewarding community members for their participation.  Engage with external contributors and communities on topics related to Pachyderm.  Organize community and evangelism events.  Communicate user requirements and provide input to product management on feature enhancements and future product direction.  Required Skills 2+ years of technical writing experience.  Basic knowledge of Python or other programming languages.  Proficient in producing DevRel content (blogs, dev demos, youtube tutorials).  Superb written and verbal communication skills, with extensive experience in public speaking and/or technical writing.  Maintains a strong and credible presence in online platforms or social media channels relevant to developers, developer tools, data scientists, ML/AI Engineers, and other technical professionals.  Entrepreneurial and self-driven. You thrive at solving open-ended problems, social engineering, engaging individuals on their interested and teaching/expressing your own Ability to rapidly come to consensus with colleagues. Strong opinions, loosely held. No ego Amigo! You are comfortable and skilled at communicating to and gaining traction with audiences of all sizes from meetings with the CEO, to customer meetings, external events and all hands meetings.  Experience in Data Science, AI/ML, Kubernetes, Docker, or other open source software is a strong plus.  Benefits: Significant equity, 401k and full benefits (100% medical, dental and vision for employees, 50% for all dependents).  Flexible PTO - work/life balance is important and we want you to take time off to rejuvenate! Remote friendly- we were remote before remote was cool and we intend to continue to invest in a remote first culture.  Tons of fun swag and surprise packages sent to your doorstep.  Tech and office stipends - what you buy is yours to keep.  Education and donation stipends - we want to support your career growth and the community.  Supportive parental leave (see also: work/life balance).  Encouraged fun - game days, fun activities, zoom hangouts and more (and - when responsible - visits to our home base for team on-sites) We can't wait to meet you and hope you'll join our PACH!

title: Image Processing Engineer
description:
Are you working in a job that is making a difference for millions of people? If not, keep reading to learn more about Elucid. We are a rapidly growing, Boston-based medical technology company using AI to help physicians predict and prevent heart attacks and strokes. Elucid's software is the first FDA cleared and CE marked non-invasive software used to characterize heart disease. The unique information provided by our software informs better treatment decisions by physicians leading to better patient outcomes, improved quality of care, and reduced healthcare costs. Join the Elucid team and you will be part of a team that is making a notable impact on advancements in cardiac prevention! We are excited about the continued growth on our Image Processing team and are looking for candidates who are passionate about what they do. Our Image Processing Engineers develop and test tissue characterization algorithms from CT, CTA, Spectral CT and MRI modality images. In addition, they will analyze data and develop methods using machine learning for feature extraction and classification. The Image Processing Engineer will work as part of a multidisciplinary team including expertise in systems biology, software and data science. Elucid is a leader in Quantitative Imaging, Tissue Characterization and Atherosclerotic Plaque Analysis. The ideal candidate will have: MS in electrical engineering or related field is required, PhD is preferred. Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a business setting. Strong experience in CT/CTA imaging processing in various areas including image segmentation and registration. Strong Experience in C/C++ is required, some experience in Python and/or Matlab is nice to have Experience with machine learning and classification is highly desired (e.g. k-nn, support vector machine, CNN, RNN) as well as experience processing multispectral data. Experience with imaging systems, photodetectors is highly valued. Experience of CUDA programing is strong plus. Applicants should be well organized and have excellent verbal and written communication skills. Elucid is a hybrid workplace with a strong preference for candidates to be in the greater Boston area. Boston-based employees are expected to be in the office on Monday and Wednesday unless other arrangements are agreed upon. The office is open 5 days a week for those who prefer to be in person. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
